So even adding 400w of light to the area being monitored did basically nothing to improve the results. So in an attempt to troubleshoot, I took the camera down and placed it inside the house on a shelf at the end of a 15' hallway.  With the hallway lights on,  the picture was just the same as it was outside.  In color, clear, and more than acceptable.  When turned out all the lights to create a totally dark environment, the "night vision" functionality, to my surprise, had a decent, infrared, black and white picture.  If the hallway was twice that long, I expect I would have gotten much more than I ever got outside.  Had I gotten even close to these results outside, my rating would not be so low.  So why does it work so well inside and not outside?  Only Netgear can answer that and I have a trouble ticket in to find out.  Regardless, since this setup was purchased to be used in an outdoor setting,  the indoor results are irrevelent to me and at this point, is just not going to work in our environment. I have also read where one can add an IR emitter that is much stronger than what the camera has and should also help immensely, but I feel that why should I have to spend more money just to get this to work as it is advertised to. I have a trouble ticket open with Netgear and if anything changes, I will update with the results. Otherwise, if no update is seen, it means Netgear had no answers and I have returned the unit. 2 year update - system is still bug ridden beyond belief and Arlo support is worthless.  Month after month, issues new and old go unresolved with nothing more from support than "We are working on it".  The only reason my Arlo stuff isn't in the trash yet is I am not dishonest enough to sell it to anyone else.
title: Moving to something else

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Steve
content: I couldn't get this device set up because the Base unit had been used.  The serial number was already registered to a different email and user.  When I called netgear, nothing was resolved after 1 1/2 hrs with them.  They couldn't figure it themselves and told me that I would get a call back which I never did.  Horrible customer service and Terrible technicians.  The mounting is easy to take off as well.  It holds the camera by magnet.  If the customer service was decent, I would consider troubleshooting bit the response and knowledge of these guys is not worth it.
title: Horrible customer service and Terrible technicians

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Yanira Caro
content: Great concept poor quality. I bought the base station with two cameras back on May and it looked awesome. I decided to add on two more cameras at Amazon and bought the Arlo Q later on. The Arlo Q has been fenomena. The Arlo pro not so good. I purchased the extended warranty for the base but not for the extra cameras. Not buying the extended warranty for the add on cameras was a big mistake. The product works good when it works.  The problem is that the batteries only last like only 3-4 weeks,  and despite having a 150mbps internet connection and a signal booster the base station keep getting disconnected from the internet or the cameras disconnected form the base. A constant issue. The worst was the system won’t us know when it was disconnected. Our car was broken into over night. When we checked the video, the base was disconnected AGAIN! Since I bought the extended warranty for the Base with a local retailer I returned it one las time and got store credit. I had exanged the base twice before. Now I still have the two additional cameras collecting dust. A waist of $358.00, without including the tax.  If you are going to take the risk of buying this cameras I surest you to buy the extended warranty.
title: Great when it works, but it rarely does.

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Shade
content: My reason for buying this system is an increase in homeless persons seen trespassing in my backyard as well as my elderly neighbors! I live alone in a mobile home community my yard has only a 5 foot decorative wall which separates it from a fairly busy business parking lot and a major street beyond no other fencing. The homeless are using this area to congregate at night do to access to water, electricity and seclusion. The property owner is doing little to nothing to stop the situation and police have their hands tied with lack of owner support... My home and lot area are small about 2000sqft  with the 3 wi-fi camera system I have been able to cover over the fence into the parking lot, my most exposed backyard area, a portion of my neighbors backyard and over the fence adjacent to her lot, along with my large deck and front door I am considering a 4th camera to cover the long side and parking area of my property. I would say you have to have some knowledge of internet setup ie hardware connections and installing apps and web access which I do so it was very easy to plug in the Arlo main base, install the lithium batteries, and sync the cameras. Then download the app into my android phone, a tablet and desktop Note: one monitoring device overrides the other when in use not an issue for me.  You can give limited access to anyone to one or all of the cameras through separate email address and password logon you approve this is nice for my elderly neighbor who spotted the trespasser in my yard and now has access to one of the cameras  without leaving her house. Installation of the cameras only took a ladder, screwdriver, drill and the app on my cell phone to get a visual to where they were pointing! I am using the screw-on extended mount in all location (a way to lock the camera on would be beneficial) but so far so good. once installed and positioned I haven't touched the cameras since... After 7 days in the high traffic areas they're at 92% battery life I'm good with that! I don't want to climb a ladder to take them down to charge so with good reviews I purchased waterproof 20 ft charging cables you can plug into the cameras and stretch to a power source works for me! All in All so far I am very Satisfied with the Arlo Pro Camera system and the app that has a ton of adjustment features to how the cameras work for your situation! I would recommend this system to anyone! Oh and it was recommended to me by a friend already using it and a friend in law enforcement! If Arlo fixes the ability to lock the cameras to their bases and the Desktop Chrome and Adobe Flash player issue on Win7 (I have to use IE8 to see live video) and I would give it 5 stars
title: I Recommend the Arlo Pro system

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Cattlelady
content: Some of the cameras work, some of the time. Constantly loosing signal even though nothing has been touched or changed! And now one outdoor camera tells me it can't work in the cold. It worked fine for a couple weeks and then it got glitchy and doesn't want to maintain connections with all of the cameras. I currently tried to have it work two cameras and they weren't even armed and they lost connection. One was no more than 30 foot away, others was maybe 80. Spending too much time checking if they are working! Not worth the money at all. Buy a real security system. After almost one year my review is worse. The batteries don't last 24 hours. I am using two cameras to keep charge in the house to supply the other 3 with batteries.  They take forever to connect and rarely have anything more than a shot of the tail of the vehicle. Can take up to 10 minutes to connect to get a live view. So my review is less stars, and I suggest buying a real system.
title: not ready for prime time

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Bob Carpenter
content: After owning the base unit plus three of the pro II cameras, with night vision, for over a year, I would not spend this money again.  The two of cameras, mounted on the outside window molding did very poorly.  These failed after about 7 months.  I used the standard charging cable with these two.  Failed meaning the batteries gave out then after removing the battery, they worked for a bit then completely failed.  The third camera, mounted outside but under cover, where the front door is offset 18 inches from the exterior, lasted about 9 months.  I had purchased the specialized outdoor extension cable to keep the battery charged for the 3rd camera.  This is disposable product..not meant for the long term.  Many of my neighbors experienced the same outcome.
title: Poor investment

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Oakley
content: Fantastic product. Worked straight out of the box. Monitors everywhere I need it to and feeds the video to my phone or tablet. It takes a little while to figure out the sensitivity settings for each camera and also which one's to have alert you (otherwise you will get "pinged" every 30 seconds!). Once you've figured out the settings over the first few days of use, it's a great system. The video quality is awesome. Provided you're willing to go and delete videos off the dashboard each week, there's no need to purchase the extra storage space from Netgear (I wish someone had warned ME of that!). The standard storage provided is more than adequate for most homes. If there's a video you want to keep - you can download it. Other than that - it's a great product. One other (creepy?) "benefit" is that if you have a camera indoors - you can watch what the family do in the house while you're out! Be sure to buy the recharging station that recharges 2 batteries at a time (link below). Arlo Pro Charging Station - Designed for Arlo Pro Wire-Free Cameras (VMA4400C) The batteries on my set up last about 8 weeks between charges. I've actually got them "staggered" so that I change 1 camera battery a week and then get a month off before the next cycle starts. I have read other reviews that state that the batteries don't last long enough. I can only presume that they must have their cameras in high traffic areas or they've got the sensitivity set too high - it's critical in reducing the number of false-positive camera activation's and/or battery depletion.. Arlo Pro Security System with Siren - 5 Rechargeable Wire-Free HD Cameras with Audio, Night Vision, White (VMS4530-100NAS) Update: 3 months on.... still working perfectly. I had to reduce the sensitivity on a couple of the cameras to stop "false/positive" recordings taking place when wind moved a bush in the picture. Apart from that, the original batteries are still 40% charged on 3 of the 5 cameras (the other 2 cameras were the one's which I adjusted the sensitivity on - because they kept recording). It alerts me every time that a delivery is made to the front door, and even alerted me when someone was snooping down the side of the house - so I called the sheriff. The perp had gone by the time they arrived, but I was able to download and show them a picture. He's a known local who burgles for money for his fix - so they went and had a "chat" with him. Already saved me money and proved invaluable.
title: Better than the standard video with the alarm company

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Michele
content: I bought a 2 camera system over a year ago that took customer supplied batteries, so as I think most customers with these type cameras, we bought rechargeable batteries, and they have worked fine.  However 5/18 I purchased the newer rechargeable unit with sound for my front door.  The item worked initially, but as soon as it need recharged, it failed to take a charge.  I called customer service who had me perform 1 test on the device itself and they sent me a new camera.  The new camera will not charge either so they either misdiagnosed the issue or both battery and camera were not working.  We had a hiccup with sending the old camera back in time and contacted customer service 3 times, and 3 times they hung up on me.  I understand if there is nothing they can do to give a longer return time, but to be hung up on each and every time I try to discuss the issue is completely unprofessional and not a company I would like to be affiliated with.  Had I known customers are valued so poorly I would have chosen a different brand.
title: Horrible customer service

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: swnk
content: I am using thier android app. When I first bought these cameras I was very happy with them. They captured motion well, playback was pretty quick and the video quality was good. With each software update the video playback and getting "live" video takes a very, very long time. The current update is terrible with regards to video playback and "live" video. If the camera is in the middle of a motion capture you cannot bring up live video.  You have to wait until the camera has finished recording and saving it to their cloud, and depending how you adjust your settings it could take a very long time. I set my recording to 25 sec.  If I see that it's recording, I have to wait 25 sec. and whatever time it takes to save it to the cloud before I could even bring up a live video.  With the lastest update I've been waiting about 5 minutes to be able to either get a live feed or view the video that was recorded 5 minutes ago.  In that time, if there is something going on, it would have passed and it would be too late to do anything. Also, for some reason, it seems the camera is constantly recording or doing something that it's draining the battery very quickly.  For one of my cameras, which is also connected to a solar panel and I've been using for over a year, I wouldn't need to change the battery for a month to six weeks.  Now (August 11, 2020), I've had to change the battery every week.  That means EVERY WEEK I have to climb a ladder to replace the battery. WHAT THE HECK, ARLO?! From what I can figure something changed with the software to accommodate the new camera, Essential, and it has had some negative consequence to the other cameras.  There needs to be better programming and quality assurance. How can you put out a software release that negatively impacts the user?
title: With each software update the video playback and "live" view is incredibly *slow*

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Brad S
content: I have 8 Arlo Pro cameras set up around the perimeter of the house. They've been installed for about 2 weeks, and so far, so good. I did have one that arrived DOA, but for $16 or so Netgear cross-shipped me a new one, and the rest have been flawless. I wish there was a bit more control over the motion sensitivity. The wired cameras apparently allow you to create a "frame" within the image and the frame becomes the target for motion detection. It would be handy to have something like that for the wireless cameras as well. When in night vision mode their range becomes much more limited, but that's understandable. All in all, quite pleased. Updated 5/11/18 - I checked my Arlo cameras remotely to discover that half of them were nonfunctional and required a firmware update.  I attempted the update several times remotely just to receive an error.  I finally unplugged and replugged the Arlo hub and retried the update and it worked.  That's completely unacceptable for a security camera.  Completely.  Unacceptable.  Something is clearly very wrong with the way Netgear supports this product.
title: Mixed results at best

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: MoJo
content: Works well! I wanted a system that had two-way communications, was battery operated, had wifi capability, easy to install and not have to pay huge fees for a cloud backup system. After ready MANY different reviews independently from, and on, Amazon I settle for the Arlo Pro with Siren. I installed a Netgear Orbi mesh router a few months ago and also wanted a surveillance system that would integrate well with my Orbi and ISP without picture lag. I was set up and running in 30 minutes which included mounting the camera outside. The Basic cloud system gives you 10 seconds on each video for a 7-day span. The videos are downloadable. If you set up to receive notifications via email, expect to receive many emails so set up an email rule to drop them in its own email folder. I haven't touched the Arlo much since installation a few weeks ago, so I could be wrong here, but this is what need works: I have the geofencing enabled, but when I'm home I still receive notifications every time I walk into and out the house such as when I go walk the dog; would love to have the ability to create visual notification zones (like how Ring does) and better integration for app notifications (other than hearing a sound on my tablet or phone I haven't seen any way for the app to provide a visual on-screen notification like Canary does.) What works well: Night vision (the user has the ability to lighten/darken the screen); screen resolution; camera battery life; and setting up. Could be better: other than what I already mentioned about zoning and geofencing, the lag for picking up video is okay but would like it to pick up video quicker as someone is approaching the door (I stated that with the Basic cloud service, you only get a 10-second video - most people have rung the bell and are already walking away by the time the video captured it.) I would love if Netgear came out with their own doorbell system that can integrate into the Arlo system. Cons: none really. I plan on purchasing one or two more cameras.
title: Would buy it again.

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: SP
content: I have purchased 3 separate Arlo Pro systems for three separate properties (most recent one was less than a year ago). I have also (unfortunately) recommended the system online and amongst friends/acquaintances. My most recent system has had two major failures: one of the cameras stopped working (I replaced it via warranty and  RMA process) and now the base station has failed. I am quite tech-savvy and have done everything recommended to resolve the issue, but to no avail. I just spent a frustrating 90 minutes on the phone with Arlo customer support - their only solution (after much arguing from my side) was to send me a replacement base station unit and, if they did not receive the faulty unit back within 10 days, they would charge my credit card for the full cost of the replacement base station. I get that this is Arlo policy, but seriously, my faulty base station is in a remote location that I will need to arrange separate travel to in order to do the new installation. Arlo refused to give me the courtesy of a flexible return to replace a faulty device (due to what I expect is poor Arlo design/quality control). Please do yourself a favor and DO NOT buy this product - if your's stops working like mine did, you will be endlessly frustrated by a customer service organization/warranty process/RMA policy that is non-customer friendly. Arlo does not seem to understand that consumers have a lot of choices for camera systems - and their technology and support is not up to par. There are better options out there - please do your research and choose wisely. I completely regret that I installed these systems in 3 locations... If you can't count on your camera system to be reliable, you shouldn't have that brand... I am going to install a non-Arlo solution in each of my locations.
title: Base Station Failed - ZERO useful support from Arlo for a loyal customer

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: MT
content: I bought Arlo Pro and had some issues with the batteries and was unable to fix it so I returned it and received another one.  It works great.  Picture quality is great.  You do have to learn proper placement and fine tune the sensitivity but I have no issues with this camera.  One issue is the battery will not charge if it gets too cold and that can be a real problem.  Mine are plugged in so I dont have to worry about that.
title: I like it

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: T Palmer
content: I needed a wireless camera solution and the Arlo Pro Wireless system seemed to fit the bill well. It has worked as intended for about 2 months now and I am satisfied with the system. The camera picture is as expected for a 720p system and shows what I need to see. The battery life is very dependent upon how much activity there is for the camera to "see". One of my cameras, due to its placement, gets activated by almost every car that drives down the street. That camera sends 75+ notifications every day and the battery needs to be recharged every 2 weeks or so. The other camera "sees" much less activity and thus only needs to be charged every 4-5 weeks. Certainly the best feature of the Arlo system is the no-charge archiving of all videos on a rolling 7-day schedule. You pay no money and have access to any video recorded from up to 5 cameras for 7 days, which is plenty. The Arlo Pro system was a good investment for me.
title: A Good Wireless Solution At A Reasonable Price

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: J
content: This was supposed to be"Condition: Refurbished - Certified Manufacturer Refurbished".  I don't think so.  This camera had obvious problems from the moment it was turned on.. I don't write a lot of reviews but this one burns me.  It was defective from the moment I turned it on, this should have been obvious if it had been tested or "Refurbished". The previous owner had probably returned it for the same reason.  Thanks

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: matthew d wainwright
content: The cameras and system work fine, though they are totally screwing up my other 2.4GhZ WiFi channels.  Some genius at Netgear decided that the base stations will use the same channel for camera communications that any WiFi router you use is also using, causing co-channel interference.  I broke out my NetScout AirCheck when I wondered why my Alexa started to stutter and tweak and our Smart TVs became unsmart once the Arlo system was up and running (I have 3 base stations to control 15 cameras and guess what, they have all decided to use Channel 1 or 2 depending on what my router decides to use that day on the 2.4GhZ band).  This is an inane and insane design flaw built into the Arlo units as the user has no control and the Arlo Base stations will follow your wireless router on its channels as you attempt to move it.  Their support forum cracks me up when they try to defend this behavior and I am having to change all my other wireless devices to use only the 5Ghz band to work around this.  Pretty silly if you ask me to make such a rookie design mistake in my opinion (especially since the base stations are wired for Internet communications and just need the 2.4 GhZ to communicate with the cameras separately--why overlap the band like this)?
title: The cameras and system work fine, though they are totally screwing up my other ...

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Nick A Osipchuk
content: This is not a professional security camera system. It is however perfect for the average home owner who wants some peace of mind. Setup and operation is easy for just about anyone who isn't tech savvy. On the other hand, there are plenty of settings and features for advanced users to dive into. Lithium Ion rechargeable battery is the way to go. The one down side it the steep price tag, but you get what you pay for. (build quality and software are excellent) UPDATE: 5/29/17 I got two more add on cameras to mount them outside, a total of 5 cameras costing me about $830. Mounted a few outside, and that's when I started to notice how poor the quality was. At about 10 feet off the ground, there is absolutely no detail. They looked fine when they were setup inside and everything was up close. Also, I started noticing a lot of compression artifacts in the video footage. (All cameras have full WiFi strength, ISP is 5-up 100-down) I ended up returning the whole set. Changed from 5 to 3 stars. For less then what this setup cost me, I was able to get five wired bullet cams with 2K resolution and one PTZ camera at 1080P resolution with a 3TB hard drive. I understand the benefits of having a wire free system (renting a place where you cant drill or run wires, or having the ability to move the camera when ever you want). This is just not the system for me. I would have kept it if it didn't cost so much or if it had a slightly higher bit rate which would result in a lot more detail.
title: For the price, it should have way better video quality.

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Good Bye 123456789
content: Can't even read a license plate 10ft away in broad daylight on highest quality setting. 1 WEEK UPDATE: One of the cameras keeps dying within 1 day, it's either a faulty camera or battery.  I've charged it fully twice and this camera location has almost no activity. 4 WEEK UPDATE:  One camera still dying, doesn't even stay online for a day.  Other 5 cameras have been fine but had to lower sensitivity on one because it was killing battery about every week by being triggered too easily.  Video very grainy compared to any mid-tier wired security system such as those you'd see in Costco.
title: Can't even read a license plate 10ft away in broad daylight

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: M. Valenzuela
content: I bought these to monitor a couple buildings and have been using them for about a month. Pros: Easy to install, setup, administer Easy to charge batteries and swap out Lots of mounting options 2 way audio App is easy to use Scheduled recording times Audible alarm External drive option Cons: Motion trigger is done on camera and not in software. This means the trigger is only good up to about 20 feet so motion further from the camera won't be recorded. It would be better if it could detect pixel changes in software to trigger a motion alert anywhere in the field of view with zones to control motion triggers. Website cannot show Live View on cameras when accessing through a computer. I've used multiple browsers, installed the latest Flash plugin, reset everything, allowed all Flash content, tried multiple computers, etc. I could not get the Live View to work at all. It always shows a connection problem. It works great on my phone and tablets but I would prefer it on my computer screen. I hope they convert the system to HTML5 as Flash will be unsupported by all browsers soon. Easy to steel. The cameras I put in more accessible locations are screwed into a mounting base but anyone can steel it if they wanted to. Recording delay. Recording starts a few seconds after motion is triggered. This causes me to lose some valuable recording time. I've positioned the cameras to account for this as much as possible but the combination of motion triggers only happening within 20 feet and a recording delay mean I sometimes get the top of people's heads as they are passing below instead of a good shot of their face. Overall, they are good cameras for what they do but they could be great cameras if they were able to fix the problems.
title: Good Cameras but Could be Better

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: RJ
content: For the following reasons: Setup:  I have my arlo pro mounted outside my second floor window pointing at my driveway 1. Video quality:  Even in good lighting conditions, the video quality is not good enough to make out a license plate on a car. 2. Motion detection: a. Sensitivity:  My arlo pro with the sensitivity cranked to 100% cannot detect people 15 feet away.  It does detect trees swaying in the wind and moving cars on the road. b.  Video recording lag:  There is a lag of many seconds and the event that triggered motion (has to be as big as a car moving) would have already passed. Summary:  I had a thief break into my car on the driveway at night (20 ft from the Arlo Pro) and it didn't catch it at all. So for the purpose that I bought it for, it is useless.
title: Interesting in theory, fails in practice

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: ChemBob
content: I had previously purchased a three-Arlo camera kit including the Pro base station. I decided that I needed at least one more camera, so I purchased a single Arlo Pro camera with a Pro base station, removed the older base station, and connected my three original Arlo cameras to the new base station, along with the Pro Camera. I then stuck a 128 GB flash drive into the new base station after syncing the cameras and firing up the system. My first observations are that the new camera, with its rechargeable battery is going to last a long time between recharges; not to mention that the siren, the audio features, and the video quality are pretty amazing. But what really surprised me was that the batteries in my older Arlo cameras seem to be having a greatly extended battery life relative to previously. I can only assume that the Pro base station connectivity is far more efficient regarding battery life. Additionally, the whole system seems to be much faster at picking up movement and recording it. I would highly recommend the Arlo Pro to anyone desiring a wireless security system and encourage anyone with an old system to upgrade ASAP.
title: Fantastic Upgrade to my Arlo Security System

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Vicky Jeffers
content: In May 2018 Arlo released a firmware update that caused cameras to drain their batteries at least 3x faster than normal.  Hundreds of customers have reported batteries draining to 0% after just 3 weeks, instead of the advertised 3-4 months.  This battery drain occurs even when cameras are in off or standby modes, or when only a few seconds of video are being recorded each day.  Most customers report their cameras were working fine for months or years prior to the May software update and that they made no changes to their setup that would cause the batteries to drain so rapidly.  Note, the software update coincided with Netgear launching a new optional service (for purchase) which is supposed to make managing your alerts more convenient.  Unfortunately, it has resulted in ruining service for existing customers.  Netgear responded to the thread of complaints on the Arlo user community site stating they were working on a solution---that was June.  There have been no status updates since.  Arlo did release a new firmware version in July, stating it implemented improved battery management, but it has not solved the problem.  I own 5 of these cameras, and have invested about $800 in this product.  I, like the hundreds of others, are waiting for Arlo/Netgear to do something about this.  Having to recharge every 3 weeks is extremely cumbersome, greatly diminishing the utility of this product.  Netgear customer service is horrible--call center personnel are difficult to understand and not very knowledgeable, and resolving an issue takes multiple service calls (hours).  If you are considering buying this product, I would advise you to either buy something else or wait until Netgear has solved this issue.  My message to Netgear/Arlo:  please let us know what's going on, and fix this problem ASAP.  Until that occurs, my $800 investment is next to useless.
title: Arlo Pro Firmware Update Killed Battery Life - Netgear Failing to Respond as of August 2018

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Dmitry's Garage
content: Horrible battery life and motion detection. Seems like a good idea at first, but batteries just aren't any good yet. Unless they get solar charging working and improve the way they handle motion this is basically a useless product as far as security. If you set the motion sensitivity high enough to detect people walking across the camera then any gust of wind will set it off. If you set it lower then it doesn't detect anything and never records anything. I have two cameras and basically any time its remotely windy I'll lose 20-30% battery life in 1 day. I might go for a week with no battery life loss, but that one windy day ruins everything. Save yourself the money and just get a normal traditional wired security system. You can't seriously use batteries yet, maybe in another decade.
title: Horrible battery life and motion detection

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)

The third time, some issues with storage or for whatever reason they only saved two days' worth of video for me to review. Probably the worst part is their support. They are rude, do not try to understand your problem, and unresponsive. I hate Arlo now.
title: The hardware works fine, but the software and support is some of ...

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Louie
content: I have had Arlo cameras for over a year now. The first ones I purchased don't pick up sound. I use them where I don't need to hear what is going on. The newer ones, that do pick up sound, don't have as good of infrared.  All though, you can't see the infrared lights, they just don't light it up as well. I love that they pick up sound. If my dogs are barking, and are out of the shot, I know something is going on. I also love that they are rechargeable. It's going to save me about $45.00 a year. The rechargeable batteries don't seem to last as long though. I just need to figure out a way to make the camera easily accessible, yet secure enough that no one walks off with them. I like that the router has an alarm built into it. It may come in handy someday. It could stand to be a little bit louder. It's not bad in the house, but I would like to be able to hear it at the neighbors. It's not even loud enough to freak my dogs out. I guess I need to look into another alarm device that can hook up to Arlo. They are making so many home devices that can "talk" to each other now that it shouldn't be a problem. I plan on purchasing more cameras in the near future.  You can never have too many cameras for your home security system.
title: Arlo makes great cameras.

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Karentina Fujinaga
content: I would highly recommend going with another product until their customer service improves.  I am not impressed at all with the support for such an expensive product. Purchased this product and received it quickly.  Right out of the box I had no problems connecting it to my phone and connecting all five cameras.  The process took less than 30 minutes to initially set up.  I was thrilled.  I then updated the firmware on the base station and all 5 cameras.  Before setting the cameras up outside in their permanent locations, I wanted to play a little with them so I left them in my office.  About an hour later, I checked my app again to see how it was working and all cameras were showing offline.  I didn't think much of it at the time knowing I wouldn't be able to play around with them again for a few days. When I did get back to them, they were still showing offline.  I tried connecting them, reinstalling them, completely disconnecting the system from my app...all to no avail.  I then read through as many forums as I could find on similar problems and tried every fix.  Hours later, I finally gave up and called customer service.  It didn't take long for me to talk with a live person who had me go through pretty much everything I had already tried.  His response was, "hmmm, that's weird.  It shouldn't be doing that."  Then he says that I likely have a faulty base station, the cameras are working fine and that I'll need a replacement.  He said I could return it to the store, or they can ship me a new one.  I chose the latter option since I was already dealing with them.  Apparently this wasn't the answer he was hoping I would say.  He then puts me on hold for several minutes and finally comes back with "new ideas" that his team said might work.  Fine...I'll keep trying.  Nothing worked.  Puts me on hold again.  Several minutes later he comes back and says that my case has been elevated to a higher level, whatever that means.  Says I'll receive a phone call back in 24 hours.  This was now over 48 hours ago and I still haven't received a call. From what I have read, this product works great if it works.  If you are unlucky like me to get a lemon, then your best recourse is likely to return it and spend the money on a dog to watch your house.  I am NOT impressed with the customer service.
title: I would highly recommend going with another product until their customer service improves

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Tracy Rose
content: The up-side of ARLO is that you get the phone app to watch anywhere with little trouble.  You can also store it for free with 5 cameras or less.  Getting near-real time video and clips helps!  Lastly these are for the un-committed who don't want to drill holes in their walls. I have mine plugged into the outside outlet and the constantly give me "fault warnings" using their hardware.  I find myself recharging, rebooting, and servicing these way more than I'd like.  Leaving the high-maintenance battery version wasn't that much of a change.  If someone attacks your home, they should do it when it's raining and the motion has no idea what to monitor with all the raindrops.  They could come at you on a windy day when there is so much "motion" outside that false alarms are common.  Getting tech support is somewhat creepy when a third party logs in and looks at all your video real-time at the flick of a button on their side.  The last turd in the punch bowl here is the now pop-up ads they slam at you when going to review your video.  If a murder is outside your house, you'll be batting down ads trying to get status.  The Facebook of security...
title: The good and the bad

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: ICARIAN
content: The charging system on these things is the worst ever.  I *would* give these 5 stars if it weren't for this problem.  The setup is extremely easy, video quality is adequate and the sound is fine - though not needed a whole bunch. I also have accessories such as covers, more permanent mounts and even the security lights and all are great products.  But trying to have these hooked up to power outlets or the solar panels (those are a HUGE waste at $70+ a pop) and 95% of the time they don't work.  It displays "Incompatible charger has been detected" on all of the cameras that are plugged in/on solar.  WTF?  Hey Netgear - this is all your sh*t, how can it be incompatible? In my case, I added an arlo pro 2 (1080p), and had 1 extra camera - so I cycle the batteries through that and it is one of the few that has the ability to charge.  In fact, there is only ONE of the Arlo chargers that works with it. The other (that came with the set) gives the same Incompatible message. So, I have to change batteries on some of these once every few weeks, others every few months, depending on the weather and how many times they go on.  Not a big deal, but some of these require a ladder and moving plants and sh*t out of the way. I cannot recommend these at all for the charging problem.  It's highly stupid and their support instantly blames the customer (not me directly but I see it all over the forums) of A.) not being able to insert the micro-USB into the camera correctly or B.) there is dirt/dust in the receptacle and there isn't a good connection.  I test using my phone with the exact same cable by taking it out of the camera and plugging into my phone - every single one of them works.  The problem, actually, is that their software is absolute crap and is determining if the voltage is "appropriate" and if it's not within some asinine range it just sh*ts itself and decides not to charge at all. And to make matters even more fun, sometimes they work.  If you leave them plugged in, they just randomly charge every now and then - though you can't tell from the app how much battery life is left (even if it isn't charging) - but if you catch it at the right time, you will see the camera charging and you don't get the error message.  Netgear needs to fix this and you SHOULD NOT BUY THEM unless you know this is fixed.
title: One major flaw

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: AnthonyNYC
content: Purchased a 4 camera system from bestbuy and an additional 5th camera here on amazon.  Initial setup experience was fast, easy, and awesome.  4 of the 5 cameras worked without issues. One camera, however, has given me 3 issues within the first week. Issue #1 - Upon initial battery installation, when I tried to connect the camera to the base station - pushing the top button did not cause the blue lights to come on. I removed/reinstalled the battery and then it worked normally. Issue #2 - The same camera, approximately 3 days later, just went offline. I tried re-linking it, but again got no blue lights.  I removed and replaced the battery once again, then re-joined it to the base station.  Then it came back online. Battery level was at 97%. Issue #3 - a repeat of issue #2.  This seems to be an unreliable camera. I checked the battery terminal and the contacts inside and they appear the same as in the other 3 cameras. All normal, none bent, none blocked. Also note, it was located indoors at all times. I contacted netgear support, and they're on the other side of the planet somewhere.  Guy kept me on the phone re-setting system for 30 mins, seemed to think it was a distance issue with the camera that kept going offline.  The camera was between 30 and 35 feet of the base station.  He said that was far and that I should bring it within 20 feet.  20 feet, really?  Kills the advantage of the entire system.  I then pressed him and asked - what is the maximum distance that a camera can be located from the base station according to your specs?  He answered that indoors under the proper conditions (yada,yada, yada) the range could be up to 300 feet. 30-35 feet is a lot closer than 300'.  I told him I suspected it to be a hardware issue due to my problems with the power/linking button.  He said to give it a few more days and see if it comes offline again, he again pointed out possible interference and distance issues.  On the app and desktop, the reception strength reads 100%.  I once again reminded him about the issues I had with the linking and power button as well as with the need to remove and re-insert the battery 3 times already in order to enable linking.  He still did nothing and said he'd comment on my support request and we'd have to wait to see if the camera comes offline again.  So now I'm waiting.  A security system needs to be reliable.  Strike 1.  Other issues are resolution and night vision.  The resolution of these cameras as well as the sharpness of their focus is greatly lacking.  Night vision is ok but not better than some other cameras I've seen.  So far I am not thrilled with the system.  It is absolutely no fun purchasing a brand new, and expensive system - just to be stuck dealing with customer service a week later.  So now I'm waiting on them with an already unreliable brand new security camera system that cost a considerable amount of money.  Had I not thrown out the packaging immediately, everything would be going back.
title: Issues with Hardware, Resolution, Night Vision, Motion Detection, and Customer Service

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: JD
content: We've had this system for a three weeks now. It's incredible how easy it is to install and set this up. I especially like the position mode and motion detection test you use when first mounting and aiming the cameras. This helped immensely to find the best location and angle for installation. When you get this, be sure to surf through the controls for each camera and the modes and settings for the system. You'll be amazed how many features and functions you'll find to customize this to your exact needs. Four of our five cameras are mounted outside and I tweaked the settings for each one to go with their particular purpose and environment. The picture quality is excellent, even in hard dark. Both of us have it set up to manage and view video from the system on our iphones and ipads, from anywhere you have a cell signal. In the options you can opt to get iphone on-screen notifications and/or emails when the system alerts, and the Arlo app icon shows a number indicating new alerts/videos, similar to the number on your message app icon that shows number of new texts. You can also opt whether or not any individual camera's alerts will set off the base station siren. The motion detection can be very sensitive if you want. One of our cameras sensed the motion of a squirrel about 20 feet away from the camera! I reduced the motion sensitivity of that camera and now it will only alert for larger things. The audio detection is also very sensitive and adjustable, as well. After three weeks out in the cold, the camera with the lowest battery level is at 90%! I could go on and on with how cool this system is. We're having lots of fun with the cameras just looking at replays of animals (and ourselves!) caught on camera. And we're confident this system will do it's real job of providing security. I only have a couple gripes. I wish the base station had better signal range and didn't need to be ethernet wired to the router. I got a wireless range extender and have the Arlo base station plugged into it and centrally located in the house, but one camera out by the garage door still barely gets a signal, but it's good enough. To be fair, my home is large and has composite fire retardant siding that probably inhibits signal range through it. Also, the speaker on the camera is not very loud, even on the loudest setting. We can talk using the camera, but the person by the camera has to stand pretty close to it. Don't expect to be yelling at kids out on your lawn - they won't hear it. However, the cameras microphones are very sensitive and pick up sounds clearly from far away if you set the sensitivity to 80-100% All-in-all, this system is nothing short of amazing. We'll probably buy more cameras.
title: Simply Amazing - and fun!

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Frank V
content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video. I've now had this camera operating for about a week.  The first thing to note is that the battery power is still reading at 100% so I expect to go a long time without having to recharge it. I got the Arlo Pro because I wanted something completely wireless that I could put anywhere.  I keep it in my living room and the wide angle 130 degree lens captures the entire room.  The picture is true HD and very clear and the night vision works well. The motion sensor does pick up my dog walking around (see video), but I was able to adjust the sensitivity so it only records and sends a notification when he actually walks around. I got this camera in part so I could keep an eye on my aging dog, so it's actually doing its job. The other great feature of this camera is the free 7 day cloud storage which for most people removes the need for any kind of subscription like other cameras have. The iPhone and AppleTV apps work well.  However, since I never plan to use the alarm/siren, I wish there was some way to completely remove it from the list of devices, but there is currently not. I did have some interference trouble with my wifi, which was curiously particular to my iPhone (no other wireless devices where affected), but once I plugged the Arlo's ethernet into the cable modem instead of the AirPort, it solved the problem.  Others have moved the Arlo base away from their wireless base station and that seems to help them.
title: Great if you're looking for no wires at all.  Long battery life. Great picture quality.

content: I absolutely love my Arlo Pro! My only regret is that I didn't get a second camera with it. I plan on buying an add-on camera as soon as I am able! product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Carol Evans
content: Anyone considering buying this product should be sure to read the Arlo Forum discussions first, putting the phrase "About 1/3 of recordings, play about 10 seconds and video freezes but audio keeps playing" into the search bar.  You will find that for many owners the quality of video has seriously degraded in a number of ways since the last firmware update in April and Arlo has neither acknowledged the problem nor offered any solutions.  Video does not continue for the duration of motion but arbitrarily stops at about 20 seconds.  It might freeze midstream with audio continuing, subjects might ghost or suddenly disappear, or the video might be so horribly pixelated with drifting movement that there is no way to determine what you are looking at.  The small percentage of videos that do work are nowhere near the promised--and previous--1080p HD quality.  While customer service is responsive, walking people through possible solutions and sending replacement products, the solutions are useless and the same problems appear immediately on the replacement product.  Once in a while an Arlo moderator will say that they are aware and working on a solution, and updates will be provided soon.  This has been said over and over for 7 months. I can only conclude that Arlo does not support their product. I use this security camera on a bird spa to see migrating birds during spring and fall, and for the first 12 months or so it was wonderful.  The features are great--I could zoom in and get quite clear and up-close videos of bird behavior, identify unusual birds etc.  I had had no idea the array of wildlife who visited the spa at night, so that was a wonderful revelation.  The camera withstood being tossed around by a fox who bit off and chewed up pieces of the silicone skin, as well as 18 months of all kinds of weather.  And best of all you didn't have to pay for a subscription to download your videos! I am terribly disappointed because it is such a terrific product.  But my patience has run out and I will be going today to buy a Nest camera to replace it.  What a shame, Arlo!  Support your product!
title: Read up and think twice before you buy!!

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Martin Owen
content: We wanted to have a camera to cover our front door and wanted wireless rather than wired. I checked Apple supported products as we’re a HomeKit house, not Alexa.  Apple only do wired products.  The Arlo range comes out best of the wireless. I only wanted one camera at this stage but we may add more later.  Very hi-def was not needed.  I decided on an Arlo Pro as opposed to a Pro2.  There are many packs containing multiple cameras and a bridge, but you have to search for a single camera and bridge pack obviously as both the manufacturer and Amazon want to keep the purchase price high. The quality of the product appears to be good.  The installation instructions are pretty clear but could have more information. The app is also good and has improved with a recent app upgrade. Note that there is no Ethernet cable in the box to connect the bridge to your router, so plan ahead! Positioning of the bridge is critical.  Our camera is outside above our front door of our 2500sq ft stand alone house.  Our router is probably 30’ away and the camera could not acquire a signal at that distance through walls. I ended up getting a 25’ Ethernet cable and locating the bridge high in one corner of the room where the router is located. Then I got a one or two bar signal which is adequate. If I wanted to locate another camera further from the bridge, I would have problems. Arlo need to look at producing a signal extender or repeater. However, once that was sorted out the system still didn’t work ‘out of the box’ as it constantly put itself in positioning mode and stalling.  After rebooting a number of times, it sorted itself out. I also ordered a permanent mount from Arlo as the included magnetic mount is not suitable outside. It would be too easy to just remove the camera!  The mount is ok although it should have come with a template for locating the screw holes on the wall.  An indication of what drill size would be suitable to drill the holes would also be useful. All in all it’s a good system but it’s not a installation job for someone who knows nothing about simple home maintenance or indeed about WiFi signals. I’d buy it again, but I’m waiting for the signal extender.  You can tell why Apple don’t support it (besides not being HomeKit compatable) as it doesnt ‘just work’, it needs knowledge and more than average home maintenance skills unless you’re planning a very, very simple installation. In operation it’s good. The picture quality is good and I assume the Arlo Pro2 is even better. Sound is pretty good too.  Anyone approaching the front door prompts an alert to my cell phone and iPad. So, it does exactly what it says on the box.
title: Pretty good but not perfect.

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Techhit
content: I'm writing this because of my terrible support experience with Arlo.  Up until a couple of months ago, I was happy with the product and it was performing as expected. Then one time, the alarm decided to go off while my wife and I were having dinner at home and the alarm was disarmed.  None of us were using our devices to trigger the ear-piercing siren coming from the Arlo Pro Base Station.  I contacted support immediately after who had no explanation for what happened. Two months later, the arlo pro cameras decided to drop off the system.  Despite repeated attempts to de-register and re-register the system on my Arlo account (multiple factory resets), the discovery of the base station would fail and/or register briefly but then drop off the network as being 'offline'. After a lengthy call with Netgear support, it was deemed to be a fault with the base station and they issued an RMA. Here's where my terrible experience begins. After submitting the RMA request, it clearly says that follow-up instructions will be emailed to me.  No such instructions arrived, so I was not given a return address.  I had to contact support again to get this, and they gave me an address which was wrong. I had the unit sent back to me after a few weeks of trying to figure out why the RMA had taken so long, and I contacted support again who advised me a completely different address this time, without any explanation as to why I was given the wrong address the first time. Whilst I was chatting with this rep I decided to google the address which happened to me 5 mins away from where I live.  Google maps showed that there was no business registered there and it was a logistics warehouse that had nothing to do with security/netgear/arlo products.  I asked the rep to confirm that this was the address, and she advised me that it was and issued me with a new RMA number. When I typed the RMA number into the system it says RMA not found, which was different from the first RMA where I could actually verify that it was a real RMA number and verify the status at all times.  2 weeks later, the RMA number is still saying is invalid (despite copy and pasting what the chat agent gave me) and they gave me a lame excuse that there 'system is down for maintenance at the moment, but will be back up later'. I drove to the address, and there is NO business there.  This was evident by using streetview on google maps, which is why I challenged the chat agent about the validity of the address in the first place. It's been two months, and I still have a defective unit in my hand and nowhere to get a replacement.  Arlo - YOU SUCK.  Stay away from this poor product.
title: Died after 12 months and terrible support experience

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: E. Seale
content: I've just had this device up and running for a short time, so will update my review after it's got some months under its electronic "belt."  But my first impressions follow... The Arlo Pro is really easy to set up -- you'll need a wired network drop and power nearby, and you definitely need fast broadband.  The Arlo mobile app is helpful but can wait (I set up my system using my desktop computer).  The stills and video meet my needs (keeping an eye on the front of my house), others may want / need higher resolution. Pros: * Good video and still quality (good enough for me, anyway) * Free online account will store 7 days of video; you can store more locally on a USB drive attached to the base station * Lots of mounting options, particularly if you make use of the 1/4" screw mount on the camera * Battery-powered camera, completely wireless, other reviews indicate it doesn't need charging often (but I'll update this once I have more experience of my own...) Cons: * Completely unusable if you've got a slow broadband connection (i.e., DSL).  The base station and camera can't even update their firmware via a slow connection.  And the device has no local-only video storage option (!?!).  Good thing we were scheduled for an upgrade to faster broadband within days of our Arlo Pro's arrival -- 2 Mbps wasn't fast enough for it, 40 is plenty. * Netgear customer support is awful -- as other reviewers have pointed out, if you have a problem with your base station or camera, they will do little more than tell you to power cycle things or let them sit overnight.  If your problem goes deeper, good luck! As you may have guessed, my first Arlo Pro camera & base station had an issue that power cycling and "let them sit" didn't fix.  Lacking any help from Netgear, all I can say is thank heaven for Amazon customer service!  The first Arlo Pro kit is on its way back, its replacement is working beautifully.
title: Excellent product, iffy manufacturer support

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Treu
content: I'm very happy with this purchase. The setup was very simple. The video quality is very good. I also purchased the Alro outdoor security mounts because they are more secure. They screw into the unit, whereas the mounts that come with it are magnetic. Also the battery life is amazing! I've had my camera's for nearly a month now and they have both made 100's of recordings and they still have tons of battery life left. I expect these batteries will last 2-3 months before they need recharging (charger included) If there are videos you want to save you can download them right to your phone from the app. It also has live video, and microphone and speaker, so you can speak through the camera as well as listen live. The way is unit works is, you set up an account online and download the app, plug the base unit into your internet router and turn on the cameras.  When the camera picks up motion it will record for 10 seconds. You will then get a notification on your phone and/or email depending on the settings you choose on the Arlo app or website. If you are putting these in high traffic areas expect to get a lot of notifications. I set mine up to only get notifications on my phone because it was filling up my email. For how inexpensive home security camera systems have gotten, everybody should have them.
title: Highly recommended

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: AP1974
content: I bought a 6-camera kit  with a free basic plan included, that was the deal. I guess I was wrong... They sell you a 6-camera kit, but can only use FIVE cameras for free, if you want to use 6 to 10 cameras, you need to subscribe to a $99/year plan, so, I either have to pay $99 for one extra camera, or buy more cameras to "justify" the subscription. It would have been ok if I had cloud in 5 cameras, but not 6. The problem is that I can't use the 6th camera unless I pay. Well....I guess I should have bought the 5-camera kit and saved $150. The 2-second lag on video is annoying, but because the system is intended for security, there's no problem there. The cameras work great, just beware of what you buy.
title: DON'T BUY THE 6-CAMERA KIT

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Peter Susi
content: Camera was easy to setup, and the alerts work as advertised.  However, the Live view is up to a minute delayed, when it even loads.  Given that the beginning of the recording is about 5s after the action that triggered it, it makes using this as a real-time monitoring tool nearly useless.  (Firmware, Internet speed, and base stations resets have all been explored) It's nice that I can get a 10s video that starts with someone walking away, I guess.  It would be better, in fact it would be what I was SOLD, if the recording included the person walking up to my door, knocking/dropping off/picking up/ etc. and THEN walking away. So, it's better than nothing, and it will capture video, but not in a way that matches the promises on the box.
title: 30-60 second delay on "Live" view

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Jane Smith
content: I spent over $1,000 for my arlo set and within less than a year the batteries have gone to crap- i am having to recharge 3 times as much and the cameras are actually recording less (makes no sense), the company had a massive information hack and VERY minimally advised their customers- i noticed my camera was recording when i had them turned off, the company has yet to respond to several requests i’ve made in regards. This is a product meant to provide extra security but instead has violated privacy and the company could care less- ARLO IS GREEDY, i could never recommend their product.
title: Total Rip Off

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Luis
content: Expensive garbage, i’ve owned them for two years now and regret spending the money every time i have to deal with them. Do your research and look elsewhere.  I’ve never been able to get it to work flawlessly and it’s not from lack of trying or knowledge.  I have other wifi cameras with way better resolution and functionality with snapier performance and cost me a fraction of what these cameras cost. No included international storage and charging the cameras can only be done with the charger it brings. Motion detection is usually lagging by a lot.  For example lets say someone is running towards your front door, you won’t get a notification until its too late.  If you amp up the motion detection it will detect the smallest flicker but again too late. Smart home integration is worse than dealing with their app.  When Alexa tries to open the camera feed it loads the audio and the video just loads and loads.  If you are looking for smart integration look elsewhere. If i could go back in time i would have not spent the money on these.  There are better cameras out there even if the companies are less known.  Do your research and skip this one.
title: Keep looking elsewhere, bad investment.

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Enigma
content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video. Arlo Pro does a great job capturing Amazon tossing your packages at your door with total disregard! Overall these cameras are worth it. I live in a crappy neighborhood right now and Ive caught plenty of sketchy stuff on my cameras which has helped law enforcement find some bad guys and also helped me to also catch people who did stuff on my property that caused damaged or transients trying to steal stuff. I wish the motion detection was pixel-based on the Arlo Pros when theyre plugged into power and not just a PIR motion sensors with zones, but with correct camera placement these cameras still do an excellent job capturing video that is good enough for the price. I have one camera placed in a high-traffic area and hard-wired with power, and Im very pleased with how well the recordings make it up to the cloud without ever skipping a beat...and I am talking VERY high traffic areas with a new recording every couple minutes for hours and hours on end and Netgear/Arlo has yet to complain to me for storing too much free video or anything like that. These Arlo Pro cameras, along with the Arlo Q cameras that I use indoors, all provide exceptional value in my opinion. Watch the video I caught today of an Amazon delivery driver tossing a 4 pound box at my door and waking me up from a nap, leaving me worried that someone was breaking into my house. I quickly reviewed my Arlo cameras outside and I caught the Amazon-branded delivery driver treating my expensive Amazon purchases like cheap garbage. Amazon didnt seem to care too much about the incident, if you were curious (and this isnt the first time its happened with the lazy package tossing by Amazon delivery drivers)...Amazon apologized and that was it. If I needed to use this camera as evidence to prove how a new delivery item is broken or how it somehow becomes faulty in the near future, these Arlo cameras have saved the day! :) Thank you Netgear for these amazing Arlo cameras and free cloud recording features; I am very grateful. For outdoor use I recommend getting some silicon protective skins to put on these cameras which are very affordable and can be found on Amazon. The battery in these cameras in a semi-high traffic area would last me about 1 month and in a very high traffic area the battery would last 5 days...this led me to finally hard-wiring the power to all of my Arlo cameras outside. If hard-wiring power to your cameras isnt an option I would still say that the battery life is excellent for what you are getting and recharging the batteries isnt the end of the world as long as you remember to charge the batteries when they need it and get the battery back into the camera before you miss a recording opportunity. I also own Blink XT cameras outside and while the Blink XT battery life is superior to the Arlo Pro cameras in the same areas; the Arlo's motion sensors and capture distance and quality is far better than the Blink XT cameras. Blink XT missed motion recording opportunities that the Arlo Pro cameras caught with ease even when I had my Blink XT cameras right next to the Arlo Pros with identical side-by-side placement. There is a place for the more affordable Blink XT cameras and I use my Blink cameras in less traffic areas and the Blink is closer to the distance of whatever Im trying to capture. My Arlo Pros do the heavy lifting for outdoor recordings though, where I can capture most (but not all) motion out to the alley behind my apartment building with cars and people walking side to side on the camera about 20 feet away which I consider to be excellent for the price and technology available here. I hope this review helps.
title: Arlo Pro does a great job capturing Amazon Delivery tossing your packages at your door!

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: anniemosscity
content: Battery drains way too fast. Unreliable doesn't record when you want it to. Records wind and trees in the wind. You must buy the extension wire so you can plug it in at all times otherwise you're dealing with switching batteries every 2 weeks, and wasting time adjusting the angle since you have to move the camera every time. With the power plug, it blocks the bottom of the camera so you cant angle it down when you attach it to the wall.  You have to strategically position the magnetic anchor against your surface to get your desired angles. At least with the power plug they'll catch every car coming down the street without the camera dying on you. However, expect 500 emails a day on every clip.
title: DON'T GET WIRELESS, too much hassle to change batteries every time!

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: WestCoastWoman
content: We've set up our Arlo and Arlo2 cameras to monitor our front yard and front door, respectively. Unfortunately, the cameras frequently fail to detect humans walking directly into the frame to deliver packages. On the other hand, they notice leaves rustling in the distance, which means we'll often get alerts and accompanying video clips that we have to scrutinize for any indication of actual movement—but in the clips, giant boxes will have magically appeared on our doorstep with no alert or recording of that event. I.e., the cameras are failing at the one task we bought them to perform. (See attached images for an example of a double failure: 1) a box was delivered to the middle of one camera's field of view, with no alert or recording, and 2) a carseat was retrieved by someone who must have walked right into the middle of the field of view, again with no alert or recording.) I waded through the morass of customer-service-defense lines to find a telephone number to discuss this problem with a human (with images and videos to illustrate the failures), and the customer-service reps proved (a) unwilling to depart from their scripts (e.g., asking me questions whose answers I'd just given, because those questions were part of their required scripts) and (b) unwilling to actually address the root problem, which is a poor motion-detection algorithm. They claimed that because our cameras are behind glass and use passive infrared (PIR) detection, they won't ever detect human movement. However, I have (and showed them) several clips in which the cameras *have* detected and recorded human movement. Detecting something *sometimes* means that the detection algorithm hasn't been given sufficient training data. When I offered to help the team fix the problem (I use machine-learning algorithms at work), they weren't interested: They simply told me to mount the cameras higher, which would not solve the problem. Now we're stuck with a few essentially useless cameras, and Arlo has our money and no interest in supporting us as customers or improving their own product line. If I could do it over again, I'd look elsewhere. I'm hopeful that this review will help someone else avoid our situation.
title: TERRIBLE at motion detection

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: LiZo
content: I've had this for a few months now.. so far I'm pleased with it. I like how I can look on my phone at any time and see/hear what's happening. It's tiny bit slow when loading the app but once it's up it runs smoothly. There is also a slight delay about 5 seconds. We have since purchased another camera; the cameras hold a charge for a good month depending on where you put it and if there is a lot of movement however you can turn off the cameras from your phone if you want the charge to hold longer or schedule times when you'd like to have it recording. Lots of storage space, holds up to 7 days of recorded videos for free so I can look back if needed. Overall I like the system, especially since it's wireless. It comes with the magnets which have the strongest hold- I ordered magnets separately but like the ones that it comes with much better..
title: So far so good..

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Basil D.
content: 1) Geofencing routinely disarms security even when the app shows I am away. 2) The app randomly requires me to enter my ID and password, even with fingerprint enabled. The app does not notify me when it needs my password, but it disarms security until I enter it. 3) Last November the entire network/system went down for 15 hours. 100% of customers had no security at all (total system failure), and Netgear did not inform anyone for 4 hours. In what reality is it appropriate for the default position of a security system to be DISARMED and for customers to not be informed when the system fails? Calling customer support is a total waste of time because the person barely speaks English and understands very little. After being on the phone for more than 30 minutes, the representative told me a "senior engineer" told her that there were systemic issues with Geofencing, then proceeded to ask for my app login and password, and base station serial number though I told her I was not at home. If there are systemic issues with Geofencing, then: a) all customers should have been notified as soon as Netgear confirmed the issue; and b) the representative should have told me at the beginning of my call, not 30 minutes into the call; and c) why did she continue wasting my time with troubleshooting when the whole service was down?
title: You can't trust a company with your security that does not inform you when their systems/apps fail
