product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: NX
content: 720p with wide angle, so you will not see great detail unless the person is very close. You must select a slider between quality and battery. Default is balanced between the two.  I like that they activate with motion detection. There is no always-on config. Videos will have audio also (optional).  If I were to change the product, i would change the mount from a hemisphere to 3/4-sphere to have a better range of adjustment. The free 7 days recording service is limited to 5 cameras. You must pay for more cameras or longer storage.  You can customize arming modes also: All/some armed with/without push notification, with/without email notification, and mode based on your multiple smart-phone geo-location.  You can invite your spouse to create an account to have full config also.  IFTT.com also has some integration.  Although a bit pricey, this is good for home-use.  I have experience with Axis IP Cameras, but those are more expensive than this entire system.  So if you want a wireless camera system, this is probably the best you'll get in this price range.
title: Good for home

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Mtn Hack
content: I have only had the Arlo Pros up for a week now, but I am thrilled with the performance. I would have given a full 5 stars if a couple of things were different. If the Advanced A.I. Detection were available in the non-subscription model, that sure would be nice. Filtering out my dogs would be so useful, but not $72 per year useful. I wish the alarm were separate from the hub so that it could be placed in a more useful spot, closer to the door or outside of my house. Also, an included security leash of some sort would be nice. As is, I will have to jury-rig something, which will cost more money. All these things are fairly minor nitpicks that can be dealt with.  Great product otherwise! Note: facial recognition not rated as the current angles are not set to see the face at all. I will eventually reinstall elsewhere to maximize the correct angle.
title: Great product with minor nitpicks.

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Jenny
content: After weeks of research I decided to purchase the Arlo Pro for the convince of not having to hire someone to wire a system in and the 7 days of free cloud storage.  I am very happy with the system.  It was a snap to set up and install.  The best features are the picture and sound.  Both are much better then I expected. The only advice i would give is to buy the adjustable camera mounts for cameras installed outside.  The ones that are included are fine for inside, but I am not comfortable with those on my outside cameras and the adjustable mounts are easier to use to get the right angle outside. The app is great and easy to use.  I am so happy with the cameras that I am planning on buying more cameras to add to my system.
title: Love our new Arlo Pro

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Phil G.
content: Arlo can certainly teach Apple a few tricks on squeezing more money out of you with proprietary equipment. After a month I needed to recharge one of my Cameras. Only the dedicated Arlo Cable and wall plug will work.  That alone is bull. But to make it worse they do not put any branding on these part.  I must have 50 of these plugs and cables in a box which I had to sort through one at a time until I found one that worked. And here is another thing! You can't just pull the battery to charge it, I had to unscrew the camera and bring it inside. I looked into charging stations and even solar power but the reviews said that Arlo would not work with them. These are the little things that add unnecessary complexity to ones life. Other then that it is fine so just proceed with this knowledge.
title: Why One Star?

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Andrea
content: I bought the cameras before leaving for a short trip. I have a dog and always wanted to know how she is doing when am not home. I bought a camera, hang on the wall with wires. It was a pain to install the software on the phone, and it never worked. After my son can figure out how to operate from a laptop, there is a list of what to do, step by step to open the camera. That challenges my patience. I waited for a long time then getting back to see if anything is better. Bought Arlo from the positive reviews. Setting up was easy. Each camera comes with a magnetic base to install on the wall. Very strong, and you can rotate the camera too. I bought some extra bases but ended up using just the magnetic bases that came with the camera. The pictures are very clear. The battery seems to last very long before it needs to be charged. A bosus and surprise is there is a 'siren' feature, you can turn it on to scare off some uninvited guests, an option to call e911 and call a friend. Will update after a few months.
title: Great pictures and features, easy to install

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: William Gonzalez
content: The positive; The equipment (Camera, base unit etc.) are well made & compact overall. Picture quality is great during the day. Installation and set up is pretty quick. I have it hooked up to direct AC instead of the provided battery this way I don't have to worry about recharging the battery. Also, if you choose to go completely wireless (using camera with battery only) I have to say it does go the distance. I tried it and got over two months before recharging. It also gives you warnings when the battery is running low. The Negative; (Camera App) Absolutely Terrible! The new app upgrade is horrible, I believe this new upgrade was mainly created to frustrate consumers who did not opt/sign-up for their monthly service protection plan. Personally I don't like or sign up for anything that comes with a contract. The new app is extremely "SLOW" now and a "LAG" in recording time. The motion detection use to be on time and reliable. The previous app was far better and reliable. I would have given it a five star overall rating on everything and was going to purchase several of them, but now I have to research other companies. Very dissatisfied and disappointed with "Arlo" & the company. I will provide this feedback to as many ratings available so that consumers are aware what there getting & what to expect.
title: Equipment is great, but app is "Terrible"!

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: MDamazonFan
content: I ordered this because it got such good reviews on multiple sites, and offered 7 days of free online storage.  I was quite disappointed to learn when I got it that the website requires Adobe Flash.  I was quite surprised to find that out, and wish I had known earlier.  In this day and age, it is quite surprising that a company as savvy as Netgear is relying on Flash. If and when they every update their website, I will return to update my review.  Until then, I recommend avoiding this product unless you can tolerate Flash.
title: Beware!  The website to review your video still relies on Adobe Flash!

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: T. Sen
content: They say batteries last up to 6 months. It takes one month to drain the batteries and with 13 sec recordings weekly. If they didn't say anything about the battery life I would guess it that it would last around one month, since Netgear is not a great consumer oriented company. off course they don't built products to last. Also, sometimes it picks up the motion and sometimes it doesn't. it is way late to record motions, when I check the recordings sometimes I see a car leaving by just its bumper. I am very upset with this company and never ever buy their security camera products
title: This product is a scam

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Amazon Customer
content: Quick tip, since I couldn’t figure this out before I purchased: the only difference between “system only” versus “system with charging cable” is you get a spare charging cable that has a 90 degree turn in the insertion point. Not sure why I’d need that. Reasons I chose this system over other models: - No subscription! Stores videos for a week for free. You can subscribe to store longer, but why would I need that? - Wireless, light-weight cameras makes it easy to put them wherever I want. The battery life is fantastic. I’ve had these for 2 weeks and they’re still at 100% - Motion sensor isn’t overly sensitive. I haven’t had anything trigger them other than people walking past. A lot of reviews on other models said people got a lot of false alarms for passing shadows or a fan blowing. - Super easy set up and use. My Aunt recommended this set saying “even your uncle can use it” and he’s notoriously not tech savvy. I found the step by step instructions in the app to be super clear. - Video quality is great - Cheaper models seem to have some weird privacy issues - I haven’t used the wall mounts, but the magnetic feature is great. They would be very easy to take down and put back up. Downsides: - As others have described, there’s about a 5 second lag in receiving the video. Makes talking through the speaker almost useless. But it still captures video of the entire event. I don’t actually lose the first 5 seconds of what happened, just takes some extra time to get to me.
title: Works great

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Peter Youssef
content: Do these cameras work? When they want to.  Would I ever trust this as a home security system, no way.  Would I ever trust this system as a baby security camera, not a chance in hell.  Every time I go to a business and I notice that they have Arlo cameras as their only measure of security, I literally shake my head in disappointment. In fact, I have a friend with a coffee shop who got robbed who owns these cameras. The problems with these cameras is that they consistently disconnect from the base station and there have been moments where it takes 5 to 7 minutes to view a video on my phone.  Someone can rob my house and be out of there before I even get a chance to load the laggy app. It's a decent item, but it should be priced around 20 to $25 a camera at best. Dropping a $100 is retarded
title: Too unreliable

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: alan leatherwood
content: I bought the Arlo system after a lot of research. I needed at least a 3 camera system that would work in an outdoor setting. I also needed them to be battery powered because they are no where near any outlets. I knew I didn't want to run wires all over the place and wanted free cloud storage. The Arlo fit the bill on all needs. The setup is ridiculously simple, insert the batteries in the camera, plug in the base station, sync the cameras and then mount them. Download the app for your phone and you're ready to go. I had read others complain about some lag time on the cameras and I did experience a slight lag on one of my cameras that was farthest away from the base station, but I just switched it to recognize a range extender and after that I had zero lag. The picture quality is good for 720. I would have preferred 1080 but I don't have any problems recognizing faces which was what I was after anyway. Viewing the shots on my 42" monitor is great with lots of flexibility with what you need for each camera. You must go to each camera and untick boxes if you don't want notifications on your phone or email alerts. I didn't on certain views and it was blowing my phone up. Hint: go into the mode tab. The only problems that I have had so far are getting live feeds when I'm using my VPN and sometimes camera requests are timed out on the first request. I don't use the VPN that often so it's not a big deal and the time outs could be the app or my ancient phone. Still not a big problem. All in all, I'm real happy with this system. Captures faces with good quality and audio, easy setup and viewing properties, free cloud storage and add on capabilities for future cameras. Can't go wrong with this system.
title: Super Easy Setup

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: amroz
content: Worked very well when first purchased, was amazed at the battery life. Everything was great until I decided to sign up for the "Upgrade" and add 4 more cameras. Almost immediately I began to experience problems with faulty motion activation, notification alerts and battery life. The battery life may have been coincidental since the first charge lasted a full 6 mos. then struggled to achieve 2 mos. on the next full charge, and even shorter thereafter. Two of the added cameras filters turned purple; called customer support, which was an overseas CSR with poor English / communication... could barely make out what was being said. What we figured out was that she wanted me to reboot the system and sync cameras, which I explained several times that I had already tried this without success, but insisted I keep repeating the process. No thanks. In short, buyer beware, especially at $1000. Hopefully your luck is better than mine, but lesson learned on this side of the purchase. I was able to return the added cameras, but unfortunately am stuck with this $1000 bag of rocks.
title: FAIL !!!

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: dantran99
content: This system was easy to setup. The picture quality is great! There are a few flaws though... 1) motion detection is only 80% of the full camera view because it uses a PIR (heat) sensor instead of pixel detection. 2) the way motion detected recording works causes multiple very short video clips since the recording stops almost immediately after motion stops instead of trailing. If you walk into frame and stop moving for a couple seconds, the video clip will end and start a new one as soon as you start moving again... 3) setting up actions for what happens with motion detection is very time consuming. Especially if you want one camera triggered to record on all cameras. You have to edit that one action as many times as cameras you want to start recording... 4) this is probably one of the biggest flaws. The 2way talk is horrible. The people on camera can barely hear you if you use a phone. This is due to their application coding. They won’t admit it no matter how many people complain. 5) when recording and using 2way talk at the same time, the recording on captures the camera side so it seems like they are talking to thin air.
title: Great camera, great picture, not so great motion capture...

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: G. Owens
content: My mother is recently widowed and is wheelchair can bound due to MS. She recently had over 2 grand of cash stolen from her "hiding place" in her home. Of course everyone denied knowing anything about it's disappearance. This lead me to lots of research and reading reviews on wireless security cameras as I didn't have time to run wires and my setup would mostly be indoors and I wanted something portable. After lots of reading I settled on the 2 camera Arlo Pro. At this point I am two weeks in everything is working really well. Motion detection is fairly responsive. Yes there is a sec or two delay but for my purpose this is acceptable. Video it's clear, night vision is good. battery life is also still I took off one star (wish I could only deduct a half star)  mainly due to the difficulty in programming it. I have read several forum post and invested a couple hours of reading, but still can't get my head around setting up modes for multiple cameras.  I was finally able to use the schedule mode to accomplish what I needed, but there should be better training videos out there that goes in-depth a bit on the different ways of programming a multiple cameras set up them as they give you several options. Over all very happy with them and a great way to be able to check on a elderly parent just to make sure they are ok and keeping and extra set of eyes on things.
title: night vision is good. battery life is also still I took off ...

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Elizabeth B.
content: I wanted an easy to access, and yet inexpensive, security camera set for any future travels.  I have a great support system and could get a house sitter, but the added comfort of having these cameras is worth the money.  You will not get the top of the market quality image, but you can manipulate the image and zoom from your mobile app, and you can even talk through the camera if you want.  I would agree that there is a definite and unfortunate delay in the recording and the app notification.  It is anywhere from 3-5 seconds which is enough for an important moment to be missed.  This is something ARLO should fix either with a back record time of 5 seconds or however. I did capture a police officer on my property within 15 hours of me mounting my cameras which was a comfort and a stress.  I was glad that the cameras captured their movement, and if they had spent any time at the door, or at the window, the camera would have captured the action well . All in all, I think these will serve my needs to give myself some comfort when away from my property.  I will keep experimenting with the placement which takes some practice. Worth it because: The app The camera quality Ease of set up Improvement Needed: Recording response time
title: Worth the price

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: faraway
content: After a month as a Basic user, here are my comments: Dislikes: - Only one login allowed and you need to login to view cameras, see status. You can send alerts (email,text) to more than one person, however if they each attempt to login and view cameras, they will log out whoever was logged in. - Phone app has less functionality and different controls than the PC application. For example, you cannot change password via the phone app though it would appear you could. - There is no notification when the Arlo server (cloud) is down. Be aware if your internet or the Arlo cloud server is down, you have no access to cameras or base system even if you are home. This has happened 3 or 4 times in the past month; my internet was not the problem. - Delay, I have had notification and mode setup delays as long as 5 minutes. "Try again" messages are common. Camera video clips are 90 to 120 secs so Arlo may miss recording the bad guys in a quick snatch break-in. Meanwhile no issues with other apps or devices with my home network. -  I have been periodically logged out for no apparent reason. - Email notification should in the subject header specify the device/camera. At present you have to open email to find out if it was the Basement or Kitchen camera. Though if you remembered your device order, you would know the first email is from the first device. - Camera speakers are not loud enough. Camera mikes seem ok. - Alarm is not loud but the skreeeech is annoying enough. - Tech support needs major work. Chatting and community blogs are not sufficient.  Search for a "bug reporting" and at most you will get replies about bugs on camera lenses. Search will also direct you across unrelated Netgear product line. Ugh. Likes: - Easy to setup especially wireless cameras. - After a month, one camera battery (the most used for detection and recording) is half discharged. I like the product idea and look forward to a fuller implementation. Is it ready to reliably replace my 25 year old alarm system? No, for now I use it as a secondary system.
title: Great idea but needs more development and support infrastructure

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Tim
content: I love these cameras.  I bought the 5 pack to put around a 3,000 SF Victorian built in 1891 and the connection was no problem from the front of the house to the detached garage in back.  I was a little worried because I figured all the lath and plaster would eat up the signal, but no problems at all.  Setup literally took 15 seconds per camera to pair and it was super easy.  I have 4 cameras mounted on exterior portions of the house and 1 "free camera" to move between the interior and the garage. I wish there were 2 things handled better.  1) If more then 1 person can log into the account to view the cameras simultaneously.  I share it with my Fiancee and when we get a notification we both log in to see the activity, meaning only one person can view while the other is consistently getting logged out.  2) Speakers could be louder.  I have them all set at 100%, but sound really gets eaten up outdoors.  It's like someone talking with an inside voice with the speaker.  It's fine to communicate if someone is listening for it.  Otherwise, you'll just blank on it. I like that they're battery operated so I can keep them anywhere without worrying about cable management wires.  The customized "Mode" settings give you access to control individual cameras, so I'm looking to playing with them more.
title: I love these cameras

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: cricuttips
content: Really really sucks. The sync system is awful and bad. Please do not buy The Good: -Good imagine quality. -Good device quality. -Warranty was ok. The Bad: - One camera didn't last even 6 months and a very cumbersome warranty process with several follow up phone calls and emails to get a new one. - Battery life is not good enough for front doors or continuous motion detection. I suggest you must have the camera connect it to an outlet at all times. The Ugly: - The synchronization process is painful and very annoying, you have to reset the device each time you need to charge or change the battery. Very poor process. My advice is to research very carefully all brands before make a $ commintment for security system
title: Good video quality, bad battery life and painful re-synchronization everytime

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: John G.
content: It's been nearly 2 years since I purchased and installed my Arlo setup (5 cameras). If I had known what I know now, I would've gone a different route. First of all, I bought Arlo because it didn't require a subscription. Then, to get the more advanced features, it did start requiring a subscription. It's cheaper than others though, so OK fine, I'll subscribe. Person detection, vehicle detection, package detection, they all work fine. Zones? No way. Good luck getting those to work. Smart notifications? Sure, they kind of work, but if you tap the notification on your phone, you don't actually get the see the video you were notified of - it's still processing in the cloud. Not very helpful when you're trying to see who is at the door (you have to go into the app and livestream for that). Homekit integration did come eventually, but I haven't played with it enough to say whether or not it's any good. Here's the big kicker form me. Cameras must link to a Base Station for connection. That's OK, I get it. It saves battery on the camera itself. The range on the base station isn't all that great. I have a Netgear Orbi setup in my home, with great Wifi coverage at all corners, I should be able to use that to connect to the base station, right? WRONG. No integration with other Netgear products (tsk tsk). Back to the notifications. Not having a "Camera Offline" notification is simply inexcusable. I had a camera go offline after changing a battery and I never noticed. ~1 week later, without any input on my part, it came back online. Only then did I notice that I was missing a full week's worth of recordings on the front of my house. Since I'm already into the Arlo ecosystem for so much money I'm probably just going to order another Base Station to put near the back of the house. They're down under $100 at this point, so it's not worth ripping everything out and starting over with another system. It's unfortunate, but I'm pretty well shackled to Arlo at this point.
title: If I had known, I would've gone a different route...

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Russell C
content: This is the biggest joke for a security camera that I have ever seen, the motion detection range is garbage, I am 6 foot and it will only pick me up 5 to 10 feet away from it, the lag in the video makes it almost impossible to set up.  This camera will not detect anything smaller than a large dog.  In the instructions it says to position the camera so it is at an angle to since the motion sensor works best across the field of view so I tried that and it made no difference at all.  If the camera is in the a shadow it will white was out so bad when the sun is up that you can not see anything through it.  So the bottom line is this, why on earth would I want a security camera that only detects motion from a max of 10 feet away, have such a horrific video lag that they intruder will be inside my house by the time I know he is there and can not be used in the daytime since it white washes out so bad?
title: How can so many people be wrong?

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: J. Mason
content: I'm still working out a few bugs; but so far, I'm rather disappointed with my new Arlo Pro system.  Overall, it's a neat TOY; but that's about the best thing I can say about it. Pros & Cons: I love the idea that this system is totally wireless.  That enables me to easily move my  cameras anywhere I may want them. I also love the fact that Netgear includes 7 days of free cloud storage.  I did encounter problems when I tried to download videos onto my PC, via the Netgear website; but I was able to download them on my smartphone, via the Arlo app. As for accessing my Arlo account, Netgear only allows one login at a time.  If I'm already logged on, and my husband decides to log on, it will kick me off.  No advanced warning... just "so long Charley". Setting up the base station, and syncing the cameras, was almost effortless.  I say almost since both required an immediate firmware upgrade.  My first attempt to upgrade the base station failed; so I had to repeat that process. I purchased the 720p  Arlo Pro, as opposed to the 1080p Arlo Pro 2.  Numerous reviewer have claimed the Pro 2 cameras will frequently go offline automatically; and I certainly didn't want that. The 720p resolution on the Arlo Pro is decent; but definitely not great.  The night vision mode is awful.  By the time someone gets close enough to see who he/she is, the camera washes out the person's features to almost totally white.  BTW, this happens regardless of whether infrared night vision mode is turned on or off. Ideally, I would like to leave live monitoring turned on and displayed on my Android tablet all the time; but that just isn't practical.  Even when video is not being recorded to the cloud, the camera's battery power is still used to stream the live view to the base station.  In the end, constant live monitoring would require recharging the camera batteries entirely too frequently. For serious home security, I simply don't trust the Arlo system either.  I have two cameras set to record video whenever motion is detected.  Furthermore, I have the sensitivity level set rather high.  On numerous occasions, both cameras have failed to record a video, when I walked directly in front of them.  Other times, they have recorded a bird flying by.  If I were to have an actual intruder, I have zero confidence that the Arlo would record the event.  The recording is just too inconstant to be taken seriously as a home security system.  (Note: I am positive that the failure to record the videos was not due to my network connection being down.) When the cameras do manage to detect motions, there is a considerable lag between the time motion first occurs, and when the camera starts recording it.  One of my videos captured a person walking down my driveway, to my front door.  The video didn't even start recording until the person was about 10 feet from the camera. My system is too new to know how long the batteries will last.  I'm talking about the actually battery life, not the time between having to recharge it.  Replacement batteries  cost $50 each.  That might not be too bad if the battery lasted a year or two; but from what I've read the batteries have to be replaced about every 4-6 months.
title: Disappointing

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: gb_ott
content: After initial euphoria, I have to say that the ROI is marginal at best. Briefly, here is why: Positive: 1. Excellent day and night picture quality 2. Simple configuration and UI. 3. Free storage up to limit. 4. Rugged construction 5. Integration with Smarthings and other IoT. 6. Easy setup. Ensure you buy the condoms and mounting brackets for outside. Negative: (Relative to price point) 1. Battery life is marginal. If you never have motion in an area great. But, think about that front yard where you have people walking by or cars parked just on the edge of your property. With roughly 10-15 activation per day, the battery drains quickly. I feel I would be better off with a perm. powered device. 2. While it has a standard micro usb port similar to virtually any android smart phone. You still require the Arlo  plug to charge. Not a deal breaker, but painful. 2. App load times/camera viewing is slow. I have a 100 mb Xfinity internet connection with Netgear Orbi Mesh setup within 15 ft of the front camera. Connection in my house is not the issue. I have a Samsung S7 device.  Be prepared to wait upwards of 30 seconds before  authentication, app loads AND THEN the camera activates to see who is at the front door. It needs to be faster. 3. The absolute worst aspect of the camera is that recording does not start fast enough. Roughly 30 seconds of an event (or more) go by before capture begins.  This is not acceptable. I have tried playing with various settings but unable to resolve. Overall, I regret purchasing now. I should have invested the time and installed a fixed camera setup. 12-Jul-17  - I have lowered the stars on this product because of the incredibly poor support provided for both this product and in particular the ORBI which I also have. The warranty on both products which are similarly priced make zero sense.  Stay away from NETGEAR until they get their act together. 17-Aug-17 - Finally heard back from NETGEAR and received confirmation in their user forums that the original screw adapter on the VMA1000 mount for the solar panel is too big. (gee thanks..I knew that) I was sent new screws that now allow the solar cable to be plugged in along with the VMA1000 mount.  Why these are not highlighted everywhere and why there is no update to the Amazon listing as a bulletin or something to look for when buying the solar panel, I don't know.  Overall, I would say NETGEAR is completely lost on any form of cohesive support and sincerely hope my product continues to work as I do not want to ever have to call or email again.. June 2020 I am done with Arlo. The product is over-priced and unreliable.  Here is why: I added the doorbells 2 yes ago and 2 of 2 have been rma'd. 2 of the cameras have been rma'd. 1 of the 2 solar panels has apparently died as not properly charging. This after less than 2 years. I only realized recently that some Einstein at Arlo decided to have the wifi channel operate on the exact channel my mesh is on. There are clearly issues. The camera has good and bad days from an access perspective. Some days they come up in about 30 seconds. Some they don't load.. The delay of 5 seconds before motion activates recording is brutal. You can completely someone moving fast. Arlo support has become poor after being fantastic initially. This product will be going the way of my Orbi soon. I am done with Netgear ( or formerly Netgear) products...
title: Marginal ROI relative to lower cost fix camera setups / Incredibly bad customer service

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Erol Esen
content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video. One afternoon we heard a loud noise from the driveway. A brick was thrown through the back window of my wife's car. Shattering the glass into million pieces. That same day we went to Costco and bought our first Arlo camera and installed it on the garage. At 2 A.M. Arlo had recorded an intrusion. Two kids had opened the gate and came right to the camera. Their faces are blurred to protect their privacy in the attached video, but a much clearer video was sent to the police. The next day there was a police car where we think those kids live. We never saw the kids anywhere near our house again. Since that incident we bought several more Arlo cameras, including this one from Amazon, and the entire perimeter of the house is covered--we  can have up to five cameras free of charge for cloud service, where the video clips are stored for a week, and they can be downloaded. We can also watch all of the cameras from Echo Show.  This particular camera has sound capability to listen and talk, as well. Very highly recommended product and brand!
title: Arlo is synonymous with security for us!

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Jettblack
content: The hardware is mediocre to sub-par.  This is NOT equipment for true security, the system is more of a gadget and toys.  If security is your concern then I recommend anything but Arlo products. As far as the software, it is by far the most basic and is the least user friendly I have had the displeasure of using.  Most of my negative experience has been with the configuration of the geofencing, the modes, the schedules and even the integration challenges with SmartThings.  Just not flexible and not intuitive enough to truly provide the types of customizations needed to prevent false positives. The final nail in the coffin is that the company changed the geofencing mode notifications to be mandatory.  There is no way to keep alert notifications enabled but disable geofencing has changed the mode.  They admit this in the forum, that they made this decision FOR us.  So now I have all notifications disabled which nullifies the security aspect completely. I will now replace this system with a mature system and never recommend any Arlo products again.
title: Sub-par hardware + unfriendly software = don't waste your money

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: JasonG
content: I decided to give this unit a try and it does exactly what it says. However, there are times when I walk in front of the unit and motion is not detected (maybe I set it off to many times to quickly?). The motion detection is only good for up to 23' the box says, and as of yet its been installed inside my house. I wanted to put it outside, but my house to the street is greater than 23' so, I'm afraid that might not work how I want. The picture quality is nice, not the greatest. But, I suspect i bought a lower 720p version of the camera and I might need to look at the 1080p versions to get better picture quality. I like that I can have 5 cameras and can save the footage for a few days all for free. I have been testing the magnetic mounts, and ultimately I think I would prefer to not use the whole "wireless" as that means I have to keep the camera in a  reachable range so as to take it down and charge again. But, I will say, the current battery has been going for over 1 month and its been triggered daily as its inside within range of where my kids play (you can easily understand how often the motion detection might go off now). The setup was easy, I wasn't thrilled that I had to use my phone, but whatever. I got it all setup in about 10min.
title: Good little camera

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Mark G
content: First of all SUPER easy to install, we are talking of like 3 steps just make sure youre close to your internet modemI bought the 3 camera Arlo Pro system. I honestly very happy I went with the Pro. Excellent quality, instant notification and recording when it detects motion. I keep 2 outside and 1 inside the house. Downside sometimes when you try to see your cameras live it'll deny you access but this happens probably once or twice out of 10 times thats why I gave it 4 stars. Other than that excellent system well worth the money. Update 9/13/17: One of the 3 cameras started acting up. When I try to see the live feed says "Request timed out" cant log into it anymore. Dropped one star from review Update 7/15/2018: All batteries died $50 each($150 for 3) lasted less than a year had tons of issues with their app and their customer support is garbage. 9/1/2020 The unit has become unresponsive from time to time requiring constant resets. Forgetting devices. Few of the cameras just stopped working. Thankfully new products on the market much better than this one. Skip Arlo is too expensive for just a few years of functionality. The software was always buggy.
title: NOT WORTH IT DO NOT BUY (3 year update)

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Adam W.
content: I've owned this Pro camera for a couple years now and in that time I've only managed to get a notification and go live AND activate two-way voice just ONCE in time to speak to someone at my front door. The notification service is slow.  The live interaction to the camera is slow.  Activating two-way voice is "slow". What this means is it takes 15 or more seconds before I'm notified of someone at my door.  Then another 10-20 seconds for the camera to activate in my app and then another 10-20 seconds before I can speak to the person.  This is between 30 seconds and a minute not including the time it takes for me to check the notification and the time for the app to load on my phone. By the time I can say "hello" the person has already left making the two-way feature utterly pointless. I have 4 non-pro cameras as well. Overall the cameras have a good picture and good night vision which is heavily let down by the fact that the actual service leaves a lot to be desired. The whole system is great for seeing what went on when there's a notification rather than what's going on.  I'm sure if someone was casing my home I would be able to get the notifications and alert authorities in a timely manner but paying extra for this "pro" version of the camera is just pointless. If two-way talk is important, see out another system.  If not, Arlo will do just fine.
title: Too slow for interaction?

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Mongoosej
content: I bought an Arlo pro camera system with five cameras and the home base stations. I decided to add an additional camera to the system. When you add in additional camera to your original system you are required to upgrade to get support for the additional camera. The upgrade cost $10 a month or a yearly one time fee of $100. I chose to go ahead and pay annually up front and paid for the service all at once. When I upgraded my account to add the sixth camera everything worked fine for around two months. One day out of the blue the sixth camera quit working and my account said that I needed to upgrade to support the additional camera?already paid for the year. The Arlo system has a glitch that apparently customer support cannot figure out. I spent an hour on the phone two separate days trying to get through the issue. Each call was the same runaround and handing me off to the next person. The support call center is located in India it is almost impossible to understand who you were talking to. After the case  being handed to four different people I still have not got issue solved today is December 12, 2018. The first call to Arlo support was on December 5, 2018. The first day I reached out to them they told me that the camera would be running within 24 to 48 hours that didn’t happen. Today I was told the issue would be handed to hire up Support to be resolved, and that I needed to wait for an email with confirmation that the problem was fixed. No email has been sent as of now the issue has not been fixed. So altogether I am out $250 for the additional camera and to upgrade the system. I did not ask for a refund I just want my camera to work. I will update this review if the issue is taken care of.
title: If you upgrade your Arlo system and have an issue their support absolutely sucks.

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Emily Listmann
content: We purchased our Arlo about two and a half months ago. Set it up relatively easily and it worked, though I was not happy about the sometimes up to ten second delay in notifying you of motion detection. It almost defeated the purpose for me, since I had bought it as an early notification system of someone walking up our driveway so I would know before they got to the house. However, it was nice to have for security purposes and to occasionally capture Pepe Le Pew the skunk waddling around at night in our front yard. Then, a few days ago I turned it off and back on again, and I couldn't get it to connect. After trying for thirty minutes, it seemed to just go dead. I called customer service and was told I was the 25th person in line and I could get a callback when an agent was available. Left my number, waited an hour, no call back. The next day, I called back to just wait in line. I waited an hour. An hour! Finally got someone on the phone who walked me through the steps of trying to fix it, and to no avail. They told me they would send me a return authorization via email. I went to go fill it out, and the options were 1) Send in the broken camera and pay for shipping, wait for Netgear (Arlo) to inspect it, and then wait for them to send me a new camera. Free of charge, except for the cost of me shipping it out. 2) Have them send me a camera now. $20 plus cost of me covering shipping 3) Have them send me a camera next day shipping. $30, plus cost of me covering shipping Seriously?! I cannot believe that I have to pay for shipping and then wait around for weeks without our security system for them to send me the camera and that if I obviously don't want to wait around for that, they charge me. Just another way to make a buck off of you when this is their problem in creating a defective item. And it's truly shameful that they make you pay for shipping their defective device that you paid $200 for. What awful customer service. I brought this up to a customer service representative on their online chat and asked to have my shipping covered and have a new one sent to me free of charge because why in the world would I have to pay to have my $200 new defective device fixed in a timely manner. The agent was extremely rude and told me that if I didn't like their customer service, I should just return it to amazon. I have never had a customer service representative a) talk to me like that b) tell me that I should just return their product where I purchased it, and b) not even recognize my complaint or make any kind of attempt at a resolution. This company feels like a complete scam in sending defective merchandise and then refusing to resolve the issue and actually trying to charge you more money to fix it. I will never purchase anything from Netgear or Arlo again and strongly warn my fellow amazon customers against doing the same.
title: Received defective item and then was charged to have it fixed

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Rjgroves
content: I have 10 of these Arlo Pro cams, 5 Arlo Q cams and 2 base stations. After a 14 months I am only able to use 7 cams. Reason, I have 3 dead batteries that will not charge. Likewise 2 cams that have to be charged weekly and 1 within a month of full charge.  I paid over $2000 jest to get set up.  I am also paying for premium service, ($150 a year). With my investment I would think Batteries would last a lot longer than 14 months. As far as changing weekly on the cams, I do not have those camera’s recording any data. I am really bummed at my decision to use the Arlo system to watch my property. If you decide to make the mistake of buying Netgears Arlo, (as I did), be prepared to buy new batteries. For $250 to replace my batteries and the $150 yearly service I plan on buying a new system.
title: Batteries do not last or just die after a year.

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: PODIII
content: While this product might be highly rated, my experience was otherwise. The image is NOT HD. The zoom feature exaggerates the blurry image. NetGear tech support was basically useless. We had agreed that the camera was defective and an RMA would be issued within 24-48 hours. A second session was a repeat of the first, again, no RMA issued. I’m returning for full credit and looking elsewhere.
title: Look elsewhere for CCTV solutions

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Big Three D
content: I think this is a piece of junk.  If you set it up to be battery operated.  The battery doesn't last long euough (less than two weeks)  and when it runs out it does not alarm.  So, here you sit thinking you have protection and you do not. The programs all need to be reset after you recharge or set up on electric. This things picture quality is horrible.  If you had a thief and you did not know them you could not identify them from this cameras picture quality. I also cannot set up friends and expect the settings to last more than one Day. If I not let time slip by and missed my Prime return time I would return in a minute.
title: Terrible Product

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: styledata
content: Longtime Netgear Securty user, starting with Vuezone, then basic Arlo. Upgraded to Pro to get 2-way communication. It works from the desktop, but not from an iphone or ipad. When you press the mic button to talk, it can be heard at the camera, as it should be. But once you do press that mic button, the speaker volume coming FROM is throttled to a very faint level that cannot be heard. I have tried everything (uninstalling, reinstalling, and two support sessions). They do not know what the problem is. My support ticket is open and I will give them a week or so, otherwise this gets returned! Any comments from others with this or a similar issue welcome. If the issue IS resolved, I will update this review. 05/24/17: Netgear issued an iOS App update: Release Notes - iOS App 2.4.1 - 24th May 2017. I have to laugh at them calling it a "Minor Release", though! I am bumping up my review by one star. There are still lag times using mic and hearing back, they should work on that. Will post again if more improvements.
title: 2 Way Communication does not work properly on iphone

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Joe Miller
content: We bought the Arlo Pro with two cameras and right away, one did not work at night. We tried all of the fixes and patches and reloads and after hours of trying, still a black screen at night. Less than one year later, the other camera failed. When plugging it in to charge, we get a reading saying, Charge Fault: Incompatible Charger. Trouble is, it's the Arlo charger - says so right on the charger. And it works with the other camera with the defective night vision. Sadly, aside from reams of postings by other people venting similar frustrations, there is no satifactory recourse BUT Arlo will talk to you "for a small fee." No thanks. Add to this the delay in the motion sensing device that often turns the camera on just as the subject is leaving the field of view and you have, in my opinion, a pretty worthless, low quality bunch of expensive electronic hardware. I would not buy again under any circumstances.
title: Not Reliable in My Opinion

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Dr0pZ0n3
content: I hate giving bad reviews but this one I had to let the other buyers know. I've purchased this camera as I've noticed that there's a lot of good reviews. I am not sure if my batteries are just faulty or defective. I've installed all 6 camera's all over the house just to test it. Not even a week and my batteries are down to 45 percent... Really!! Wow, I thought these batteries last up to 6 months? Audio is not that great either. Update: 10/24/2018 After a week one battery completely drained to 0%. This doesn't look good. I will wait for another week and see how the rest will hang on.
title: False advertisement - Crap batteries

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: RTP LongIsland
content: The biggest problem is the constant need to climb up on a ladder to access for maintenance. For some reason the cameras are constantly losing sync. I have bought housings for one that I hope will solve the issue on that camera above the garage door. The one on our porch I removed the battery and plugged it in to a power source. The battery constantly needed to be charged. You can run the camera without the battery, kbut plugged into AC, folks. However, between the pain of charging the battery and loss of sync, I don’t  think the  Arlo is well designed. The alarm function is a joke. It is very loud and not easy to use. I am reluctant to use it. It should be set on low as the default. Instead us set to ear piercing. I bought the Arlo bell at Best Buy on sale. I didn’t have low voltage wires. Instead I used the alternative wireless connection. The resulting delay is ludicrous slow speed. Between the depressing of the bell and the activation of the wireless chime it is absurd. Why wouldn’t Arlo use Bluetooth  between the bell and chime. It appears that the signal goes to the cloud then back. I purchased 25$  Wyze cameras for in the house, since we are selling and thought having recorded movement, when the agent is showing the house would be a good idea. That way we can see what is happening. The Wyze are very much easier to install with no hub. They have super resolution. They have no battery. I have not had one go down yet. When we sell we might leave the Arlo and adopt the Wyze as our standard. You can buy a housing for the Wyze Camera. I don’t Know if it will work but I will give it a try.
title: Not  A Great Deign. User unfriendly attributes

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: MathiasR
content: I was skeptical to purchase such an expensive system that did not support Apple HomeKit, but after a months worth of use I love this system. It gives extremely fast updates for movement and audio. At first the audio was very sensitive and gave too many notifications, but after adjusting the sensitivity it’s perfect. I keep this system armed at all times, with no automatic audible alarm, and push notifications only. This has worked well for me and allows me to be aware of who’s at the door, when packages arrive, and provides a comforting sense of security. Despite not being compatible with HomeKit, this system is perfect. I would recommend this to anyone.
title: Perfect and works well with iPhone.

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Joe M.
content: Having been an Arlo user for over 2 years with the original camera design, this pro cam was our 5th and last available slot for monitoring while still maintaining the free cloud service. The biggest benefit with the pro cam is the 2-way audio...the clarity and coverage that this mic picks up is unbelievable. Audio seems marginally better than the original cameras—I couldn't really tell a difference aside from maybe the frame rate/smoothness of video being slightly better(?). With this camera, you have to invest in an extra battery and the Arlo charger to make it a seamless change when it comes time to swap batteries. Batt life is slightly better than the rechargeable 123a batts of the first gen cameras....I see about 4-5months from the original cameras and the pro seems to be giving me close to 6 months.
title: Long time Arlo user, the pro takes it up a notch

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Brad
content: This camera is surprisingly easy to setup. The video and audio quality are great. Battery life is longer than expected. Only negative so far is the price. Update... Revised my review to 1 star. Would give it zero if that option were available. After about 2 months I needed to charge the Arlo. The battery would not charge after days on the charger, so I contacted customer support who told me to try another outlet and leave it plugged in for at least 6 hours. That didn't work either so I called them back and explained that not only wouldn't the battery charge but the camera didn't work with the power cord and no battery (it's supposed to work). They insisted that although it's supposed to work without a battery on the power cable, in sending another battery. It took 4 days to get the battery and they want me to pay to return the old one. Surpirse surprise, the new battery doesn't charge either so I called back. They finally agreed to send a new Arlo but wanted me to pay shipping to return the defective one first. Netgear is horrible and I won't be buying another product from them.
title: Buyer beware!!!

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Larry A
content: Initially, I thought this was a great system. However, after almost one year, I now know otherwise. Firstly, the android app for my Google Pixel XL phone freezes and/or crashes frequently. That means that an alarm is triggered when I walk into my house and I need to go to my Desktop computer to deactivate the camera. VERY ANNOYING!!! And next issue is the very long lag time when accessing the live view or the video playback. A thief could empty my whole house before I could call the police. This makes it virtually USELESS AS A SECURITY SYSTEM!!! Now, after less than a year one of my two cameras looses charge after 2-3 days. Support is supposedly sending me a replacement battery, which may or may not solve the issue. May also need a new camera. In the course of my conversation with tech support, I discovered that the camera is ON and sensing motion ALL THE TIME, even when I have turned it off with the app. WTF? This sounds like a prime HACK vulnerability.
title: WORTHLESS POS --- DO NOT BUY!!!

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: J. Mitchell
content: Arlo’s terrible software ruins all of the good things about the product. Every time there is a significant iOS update, Arlo’s software (in particular the geofencing feature, which you will want to use) will break. And because Arlo doesn’t care about its customers once they have your money, they won’t fix it for months, if at all. iOS 13 is the latest example - it has broken geofencing and over a month after public release (and many months since the OS has been available as a beta), Arlo still hasn’t fixed it.  If you look on the Arlo support forums, there are hundreds of posts about this and Arlo won’t even respond. It is their only job, and they are abysmal at it. It should be illegal, and I regret that I have recommended this product to so many people.
title: Ruined by terrible software support

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: plain_elaine
content: I purchased this camera about 3 months ago to be able to see the end of our long driveway. (Otherwise you have to go outside the house to have a line of sight to the road). Driveway is about 500 feet long and we live in a rural area. I placed the base station in the front window of our house, and mounted the camera about 250 feet down the driveway on a tree. (There is a line of sight from the base station to the camera). I can see and hear what is going on down there very well. It has night vision if you need that. The app works great, and I am able to view the camera feed from anywhere. I only set my camera to be "armed" for about two hours per day (this is the mode where it alerts you when it detects motion), and I have only needed to charge it twice in the last three months. Otherwise I just look at the camera live, whenever I want to see the driveway. The app stores anything you record for 7 days, with no extra fees. I have had no problem with it being out in the rain, but I have had to scrape ice off of it, which is to be expected. So far it's been wonderful for us.
title: Great camera for a long driveway in a rural area

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: ZE
content: I've had the Arlo set up for 6 months, and at first it was great.  For the past month, it has not been able to consistently recognize when my wife and I come and go from the house.  Geofencing is a joke, and Netgear/Arlo don't seem to have much luck fixing it.  We've followed their customer service recommendations - unregister and re-register phones, add and remove cameras, reboot system, verify firmware, reinstall app on phone.  Some days my wife's iPhone 11 will be recognized, but my Galaxy S10  just reads 'in the zone' when I'm 20 miles away. So of course if the system thinks one of us is home, its not recording.  Other days, mine will work and hers doesn't.  Head over to the Arlo forums and check out all the issues people are having.  Of course, there are people who don't know what they are doing and having really dumb problems, but I work in technology and engineering and can tell this system has bugs and is not very stable.  Regretting my purchase.
title: Great, when it works!

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Brenda the barber
content: I hate to leave a poor review, I have left very few ever, I am really easy to satisfy, and i so wanted to love these cameras.... but.. *Cameras arrived over packaged and shrink wrap upon shrink wrap--razor blade required. *All parts complete and sturdy, magnets are fantastically strong, but.... *While instructions are FANTASTIC and easy (by far the best I have every received with any product), cameras would not sync properly, kept knocking eachother off the system.  call to tech support. *Tech support very good, the accent is hard for me, but very efficient. ***There is NO useable 2 way audio/talk.  I can scream into my device and hear only a broken soft quack out of my cameras (both); the audio is loud and clear--but BROKEN so you hear fits and spurts.  my wifi is strong.  My reason for purchasing mainly was for the talk feature. **You cannot log into 2 devices as the same time, such as me watching from my business, and husband watching from home on his phone **Slow login, and often you cannot get a live view for whatever reason--timout **Camera #2, which is 30 feet from wifi, gives mostly half screen and broken images, green blurs.  Works less than 10% of time. Sadly i will be returning these cameras, rather expensive ones ($360 for 2 without hdmi support) I am going to try ring next for 2 way talk UNLESS ANOTHER SMART AMAZONER HAS A BETTER IDEA!  I need 2 way talk from my phone to my business, price is less important than function, any of you have a better product idea?? The camera is low megapixel.  not important to me, maybe to you? I purchased a more perament mount for better positioning, and had to climb back up the building multiple times when the camera needed to be brought in and re-synced.
title: the good, the bad and the RETURN

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Jes
content: I thought this was the answer to my security needs. I did the research and wanted something wireless so I wouldn’t see wires everywhere or have to have an electrician or someone to run them behind the walls.  It seemed like a good idea to install it high up so someone couldn’t take or steal it.  So had it installed high up to see front door area and street view. When I saw the first pictures I thought the screen quality was good, not great.  The camera caught movement up to about 15 feet but nothing beyond because I walked out abt 30 feet and waved my arms while walking toward the camera. I saw my dog take off but not what direction. But the biggest disappointment was after 4 days and battery went down! That was not good because that’s when I realized I was going to have to pay my handyman to get the camera (I’m 70 and not climbing ladders) to charge it and after however long it takes to charge, put it back up. I had an offer to install 5 camera’s, very good quality, all wired in the wall with bells and whistles for $700. I thought I’d made the best choice...I was wrong.  I thought I read somewhere that battery life was a year depending on activity. I’m not on a busy street so 4 days is ridiculous! Lesson learned.
title: Battery life ridiculous so having to retrieve the camera to replace battery is absurdly ridiculous.

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: ZF
content: I love the Arlo wireless cameras. I already had three cameras plus the base station from a previous purchase. I bought this extra camera to add to the back entrance of my house. These cameras are a breeze to setup and the batteries last about 3 months per charge for my house. I only enable recording when I’m away from home (I use the geofencing feature for this) and I have the cameras scheduled to record during sleeping hours at night. Because I have these paremeters setup for recording, the cameras don’t record unless they sense motion during the specified times of the day and when I’m away from home. This really increases how long the battery charges last. Like I said, setting these cameras up is a no brainer and the mobile application is fantastic and easy to use. I also like the Apple TV app for arlo. The cameras are made really well and they really do well in cold, hot, wet, or snowy weather. I haven’t had any issues to report after having my original first three cameras for over a year. For the price, I wish the cameras were higher resolution. 1080p seems to be fairly standard these days for cameras, but you get a lower quality 720p with the Arlo Pro cameras. They get the job done though. I love that I didn’t have to wire any of the cameras, and the base station easily hooks up to your existing router. Overall, I’m very happy with the Arlo projects. I would like the Arlo Pro 2 cameras which have 1080p, but I’m too invested in my current setup to hand out the extra cash for the higher resolution. These cameras really do give you a peace of mind when you’re away on a trip, or just want to check in on your pets when you’re out for the evening.
title: Really easy to setup, made well, and the rechargeable batteries last a long time when setup properly

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Irish Pedro
content: Arlo isn't your total security cam system right out of the box. It can be, though. What I use if for, is a monitoring system. You have to ask what your needs are. Mine are to make sure anyone coming up my driveway or in my backyard are people I allowed. Kids having friends over while we're out etc. This system does that to a tee. You can purchase a 24/7 recording service from Arlo if you want an always "on" security system too. I use the FREE 7 day cloud recording that is available right out of the box. I love the "modes" option, you can set camera's to record ITTT scenarios, disarm, only certain cameras to record while others push notify you. The phone app is very easy and intuitive. Live video is great, there is a delay like people say, but it all depends on your internet speed. I have 500mb down, 50mb up and my delay is only about 1-2 seconds. All live video is delayed through the internet anyways, you will never get a true live feed from any service out there. Night vision is great. Motion detection is fair, only reason I gave it 3 stars is I feel it could be stronger. It hasn't missed any motion detections yet though. Just needs to be within 20-25 feet of camera. I have mine about 10ft ubove ground level. Mine still detect from about 20 feet. Arlo is the best for what you pay. I would recommend Arlo to anyone.
title: Best Free recording out there

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Craig Rager
content: The video quality is good, not great, even on the highest setting. The ease of installation without wires is convenient. I've had good battery life on the remote cameras, but only get a month out of the batteries in the high access areas. The speaker is decent, but expect a small delay in communication. I waited years for the wireless to have the quality of a wired system. This is pretty close. The unit does not come with a battery charger? WTF? you must connect the units to power to charge the battery. They are coming out with a battery charger. I paid nearly $1,000 for a 6 camera system, and will pay extra for a battery charger? Also the web interface takes up to 30 seconds to connect and display recorded events and live viewing. It comes standard with a 10 second record time once the motion is triggered. Often this is not enough. I need to see if I can increase the record time. Overall the unit is pretty good, but could be better for the price.
title: No battery charger

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Lindsey
content: I really liked these cameras for quality and the app but these refurbished units both quit working within a few months. One only works when it’s plugged in to the charger shuts off when unplugged and the other one just doesn’t turn on at all anymore. We had them both hung under awnings so they aren’t water damaged and it has not been unreasonable temps in Tennessee since we bought these. Return policy is 15 days and after that they offer ZERO help with any issues. These are not a cheap purchase for something that will only last you 3 months. Buy new from the actual company—these people are awful. Customer service with them is crap.
title: DO NOT BUY.

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Pete Tucker
content: I wanted to give zero stars but the minimum I can give is 1 I returned this camera (which was bought as a spare) because the Arlo app problems (and lack of customer support ability to resolve them) finally made me give up on Arlo products. BTW the reason I bought this as a spare is because one of my cameras quit. I tried every thing with it to no avail until the new camera arrived then my last attempt to get the old camera working was successful. I didn't do anything different, just the luck of the draw I guess. Full story:- I bought a 5 camera system about two years ago. Everything was fine and I was impressed with the system until about 12 months ago. Then I started getting two phone alerts for every motion event. A bit annoying but whatever. Then about 4 months after that I start getting 3 phone alerts for each motion event, then a bit later 4. At this point I decided to try to get some customer support from Arlo ……. it's a joke. If you go look at the forums you'll see Arlo commented to the multiple alerts issue in June 2018 saying they were aware of the issue and were investigating. Some people were reporting 7 notifications for each motion event ……... I couldn't find any further updates in the community pages so I went to online chat for help. I wasted 2 hours last Friday evening following the (obviously scripted) instructions. When we got to where the guy wanted me to uninstall the app I was reluctant. I had seen in the community pages people saying that every time they removed and reinstalled the app they got another additional notification. I had kinda run out of time anyway (late Friday night after a long work week) so I decided to live with the multiple alerts. That lasted over the weekend until it got to be intolerable. today I uninstalled then re-installed the app. as the guy had recommended. Guess what …… now I get no alerts ……. zero ….. So tonight (Monday) I spent 2 hours on online chat where the best advice the girl could give me was "you're going to have to wait until your cell phone company rolls out Android 9 then call us back to see if the problem persists". Seriously ……… Arlo doesn't test their app updates on the last version of android????? I persisted and said I wanted to talk to a supervisor. They told me it would be no more than an hour ……… after about an hour the phone rings, I answer it and keep saying hello for about 30 secs then the other end hangs up. I called the number back from caller id and give my case number etc. then I'm told that the supervisor had tried to call me multiple times with no answer. Why would they lie about stupid things like that. Eventually through persistence I was connected with the supervisor and asked about the claim they had called multiple time, she told me "no I only called once". Long story short Arlo has no idea when they will be able to resolve my issue ……….. if you want a security camera system that may or may not work (surprise) Arlo will be a fun ride for you but if you want a no hassle well supported security camera system I recommend you look elsewhere. Me …. I'm going to end up throwing my $1000 Arlo security camera system in the trash ….. EDIT July 2019 - As a result of Arlo responding to my review I reached out to them. The phone call with customer support took place today. I spent another 2 hours on the phone following the instructions of the Arlo guy. He had me change about every setting in the App and many on my phone, even one's that logically couldn't possibly affect the notification function. Result - no change. My impression is that he was reaching in the dark and didn't seem to have a logical thought out plan of trouble shooting. At the end of the call he told me my case will be elevated and they would contact me with any updates - exactly the same process, result and empty assurance I had been given in my call with Arlo CS back in April. Now I have to go back into my phone settings and try to remember all the things he had me change so I can change them back. NOT HAPPY!!!!
title: The Arlo phone app is terrible, as is Arlo customer support

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Dave
content: I’ve had these cameras for about half a year now. After customer service help and readjusting the setting on the cameras, I’ve accepted  the faults are due to poor quality. For example, the camera in the back yard has no obstructions. No roads, cars, or any other background that could set off a false alarm. So on this camera I have the sensitivity on high. Through out the day I get alerts showing me light changes as clouds pass by the sun, but I can walk right past the camera when it’s armed and it won’t activate. I would say these cameras work about 70% of the time. Most times a person walking past will activate them, but 30% of the time they fail. If the price was less I would be more satisfied, but their high price gives the customer the allusion of better quality. But they are not.
title: Motion dectection and sound quality are poor

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Erik Okerholm
content: disappointing warranty. Cameras work great when they work. Very easy set up, but one of my (less than a week old) cameras had an issue and their support gave me an RMA. $10 charge to ship back a camera I received earlier in the week....(I had already thrown out the boxes or I could have a returned it to Amazon).  The App is sweet and set up a breeze. I was just disappointed that a brand new camera costs me $10 to get it fixed/replaced. I call BS. The Arlo App for the cameras was a breeze to set up and configure. Cameras seem to function well and get good quality pictures. The base unit was easy to set up with Syncing each camera. Support has been very helpful when there was an issue. I'm just dinging them 3 stars due to me having to pay shipping for a brand new camera malfunction. We set up 4 of these and an Arlo Q (indoor) with a breeze. I did like the outdoor covers I got from eBoot and you have to get the brick mounts for outside, which are nice too.  I didn't have confidence in the suction cup mount and returned it, as I saw that when the suction cup gives out, the camera drops and breaks. These are too pricey for that.  The wall mounts are easy to use and set up.
