title: Disappointed. Be prepared to pay shipping (even for a new camera) to get it fixed. Otherwise the working ones are pretty cool.

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: y0bailey
content: I've now purchased 6 ARLO camera (3 originals, 2 arlo pros, and one baby) and 2 base stations, and over a 3 year period only 2 cameras and 1 base station are still alive.  These things die like clockwork at 1-2 years.  Some of them before.  I have had 3 trips to the post office for warranties, which they did handle nicely.  But still, these are nearing a 100% failure rate by 2 years.  Not just batteries, ENTIRE CAMERAS and BASE STATION included. DON'T GET SUCKED INTO THIS ECOSYSTEM.  I am $1000 in and might as well spent the time and money to install a real commercial grade system. And this is just to monitor a house with 3-4 cameras at a time. Buy the cheap REOLINK argus 2 system.  Does the same stuff, half the price.  When it dies you won't die on the inside quite as badly. I'm a Netgear fanboy no longer.
title: These things die like clockwork after your warranty is out.

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Peregrine
content: Worked great for 2 weeks, then stopped noticing motion. I can live with the slow delay in starting up with motion directly in front of it, but to not notice at all anymore is unacceptable. So is having no phone support that I can find...hiding behind 'community' and 'blogs'. What a pos. No, not the camera, the company. Know that if you need any help, the support is in India. They try hard but know only the essentials. Could not help me thru FOUR long phone calls. Said everything looked great. But the cam never comes on by itself when armed. If I could return of course I would because I think it's defective...or the base station is. Who knows? No one at Netgear. TERRIBLE RESULT FOR $230.
title: It will fail and you'll get no help.

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: PDA
content: I like Arlo. I purchased my first product about 5 years ago and am now a paid subscriber with several cameras. Everything was fine (except for normal connection issues), until two months ago when one of my new cameras stopped working just one month after purchase. I called the support and they walked me through a few basic diagnostic steps, which I had done before anyways (disconnect the camera, reset the camera, log in and out of account, change wifi channel). Clearly it didn't work so after another call they said they would replace my camera. The CSA said he would send me an email with the RMA information. After 4 days I still didn't have the email so called again and the new CSA said oh the previous person made a mistake and that she would send me a new email. I received that email right away and it did have an RMA number, but the email asked me to check the status of RMA approval online. After one week, nothing had happened and I called again and they said oh sorry that email was wrong and you were supposed to send your camera in before we can send you a new camera (by the way, the email had Netgear's phone number, not Arlo's, and Netgear said we don't handle Arlo's issues). Yes, they expected me to pay for shipping for a faulty camera that was still under warranty. The next person said he was going to make an *exception* and send me a new camera and then I can send them my camera. I feel this has to be the standard procedure anyways when your product is not working. Two weeks later, I still didn't have a camera. I called again and the new person said oh sorry the previous person had made a mistake and our warehouse had trouble processing this request. He promised he would follow up with me the next day and send me the camera. Five days after that I still haven't received a call and I still don't have a camera---two months after reporting the issue to Arlo. This has been very frustrating. The first phone call should have solved the issue. While I understand manufacturing problems do occur, I do question Arlo's customer service practices. I am currently, as I write, on the phone waiting for a CS supervisor. I will update this review as the case progresses.
title: Great product; AWFUL customer service

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: dorinda
content: ok so after researching my battery situation more today, i'm seeing i'm at the boia that wasn't plugged in would get low, id move that camera to wear my charger was plugged in and the other one would stay unplugged. I have there inside, to moniter my dogs. I rescued a dog a year ago and was having trouble with her because of her seperation anxiety. The first week i had them i did use the 2 way audio to calm her down on a few occasions, but after that, the only camera activity on it would be for a few seconds each activation. several times a day. That seems like a really short life span no more than it would get triggered, especially since it was plugged in half that time. Neither battery will even spark a charge. i'll buy one more set of these batteries and a charger that will show how much juice the battery has but if i go through this next set as fast as this one i'm going to have to switch to something a little more reliable. i'm afraid to move it outside for surveilence. There's a lot more activity out side my house than there is inside.
title: super frustrated

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: lowkey2357
content: I have a 4 camera system of which 2 are the original cameras without sounds and 2 pro cameras with the pro base station. These cameras are great when they work. I have found that after using them for 2+ years that they have some shortcomings. First of all the biggest problem I find is the motion detection is very spotty at best. I have literally had one camera record based on motion and not far away another did not. So you have a very spotty record of what went on. For example I had a prowler on my property and of the 3 cameras the individual went by only 2 out of the 3 recorded something. I have seen this occur in multiple instances. So you end up with a spotty record of what went on but I guess it is better than nothing. Even when the cameras are set to 100% motion detection at times they will totally ignore motion. So be warned these are not perfect.
title: Motion Detection Spotty at Best...

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: JJ
content: I ordered two add-on cameras for my Arlo Pro to serve as “cat-cams” in my living room and kitchen. The installation process said to hold the button in on the top of the camera until the blue light blinked, but instead you have to press and release it; otherwise it won’t blink. I figured it out but the instructions should be updated. Also, Arlo doesn’t make it easy to learn which base model I had purchased years ago so I knew which add-ons to get - there should be a way to view that in the app, such as Help, About, or even just the camera description, but I had to go look up my original order. Again, I figured it out but Arlo should make it easier. Also, there don’t seem to be any good surface mount stands for these cameras other than the short little stubby ones offered by Arlo - you might as well just set the camera on the surface as the stands only provide an inch or two of height. But the cameras do stick and the mounts hold, and you can direct the cameras which is nice. However, Arlo should offer a stand that is higher - I wanted to put a camera on the top of my hutch and one on the top of my bookcase but due to the moulding at the top of both tall pieces of furniture, the mount was far too low and I had to use books or something else to give them height, which I didn’t really want to do. I don’t want to drill holes in my ceiling and I don’t want my cameras on all the time, so there should be a stand with more height to allow for aiming around the room from on top of tall pieces of furniture or cabinetry, which usually have moulding. Lastly, the app should be more user friendly - you have to click around to every available page to find what you’re looking for. I could easily “sell” these cameras to friends and family but I know they will come to me for tech support - Arlo should make their app easier to navigate and more intuitive so less techy people are more comfortable getting started and using them.
title: Good cameras but technology isn’t as user friendly as it could be

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: RRM
content: I've used this for three weeks. This may be good as an indoor camera, again if you don't care about clarity. Video clarity (even with the best) is horrible if you are placing under sunlight or in night vision mode. For example., you can see a man in red jacket, or black shirt moving. that's it. You won't be able to figure out faces or details. If deterrence is your purpose, place a fake camera. I've not used enough to comment on the battery life. Please don't get fooled by the positive reviews (PAID?).
title: Please don't get fooled by the positive reviews

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: St. Charles
content: Review update 8 momths in...reducing to 2 stars. Arlo Pro has it figured out. Add a sixth camera and you have to buy the upgraded package to get it to work. Rip-off! Worse thing, after the first charge that lasted 3 months, subsequent charges only lasted 2 weeks. Customer service is worthless, I don't speak Hindi or whatever language it is. I was on hold for 50 minutes waiting for a rep. Pathetic! Got no resolution after 2 hours on the phone. You will spend more time in keeping the system running than the $1,000 cost and not so convenience as advertised. The good...easy set-up, syncing, and installing. No wiring! Yay!  App and computer website is very good. Bad...Magnetic ball hangers are a joke to hang. Only one pivoting screw in type included. Expensive for what you get and here is why. You can walk directly at the camera and it will not capture your image. I am 6 feet-212 pounds and it won't capture me no matter the walk pace. Speaking of walk pace, if you cross the field of view quickly it will not capture an image either, car, human, dog, elephant. Arlo needs to correct that and quickly. It is slow also. It takes forever to download, update live view and view recordings. Convenient and better than nothing but Arlo needs to fix their customer service, camera motion detector, battery drain and speed up the processing.
title: Mostly bad, some good, just avoid

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: SierraTheWolfe
content: App Review: Overall I love these security cameras, but to speak through the microphone to output audio on the app is flawed. The microphone sensitivity barely picks up your voice and in order to get the speakers on the cameras to be loud enough to be heard, you have to raise the volume of your voice directly at the microphone area of your tablet or smartphone. However if you have a headset or headphones with a microphone where you can adjust the microphone up close it works slightly better. I think the app needs to allow microphone sensitivity adjustments.  The app also cannot format your data storage device such as an External HDD or Flash Drive without encountering errors. Thus you have to disconnect the entire data storage device and reformat it upon the PC. Website Portal Review: As for the website after applying proper web settings, I noticed there are no issues with the audio as long as you own a headset and computer. You can format the data storage devices without any issues. I am getting to the point where the website is far more better than the app itself. Camera Review: The battery life on these cameras are amazing if you plan to go wireless, but it all depends on your settings. The higher quality of recording and how long or when it should record means you will have less battery life. However, there are power saving features which is nice to have and you can prolong the battery life without sacrificing too much video recording quality. I can get roughly a month on a single charge when I set up power saving settings properly if I am lucky. However if you have kids and animals, expect these cameras to die quickly if they are triggered by motion movements within view. Again depends on your settings. I can also plug in the charger with usb cable Live streaming or viewing old recordings is a breeze through both the app and website. Additionally there is a few seconds or slightly more video delay when watching live, but that is to be expected and depends on your internet speeds. You also have the ability to take a screenshot of a still frame within a live streaming or previously recorded video.  The image resolution quality all depends on your camera settings, but at the highest settings there are no issues. Daytime and Nighttime video and audio recordings are crystal clear. You'll get the full RGB spectrum for daylight recordings while at night you'll receive black and white with greyscale recordings. Works in a variety of light conditions with no issues. You don't need to have a subscription to use these cameras and can use a storage device or network pathway to store videos and pictures. However the subscription route may be best if you need better security features and further camera support which vary from 2.99 to 14.99 a month depending on your needs. Push notifications and alerts are improved, option to dial emergency services as long as it is supported in your area or alert a friend with one touch of a button. All media stored can be downloaded, shared (share a direct url link to the video or image via email or on any social media platform or website) and donate (give Arlo developers your video, so they can research and make improvements on their devices and software). The image quality aka video resolution depends on your power saving settings and when or how to record. Camera accessories: There is a huge list of accessories such as tripods, protective covers, indoor / outdoor power chargers or cables, additional batteries and housings. So many that you are like a kid in a candy store. Plenty of options to choose from. I do wish there were more accessories that featured what Ring could offer, but maybe down in the future. I'd love a door bell or two way face to face communication. Charging Support: Sadly you can't use any random charger in your house because many or not all will be compatible with these Cameras. They require proper voltage ratings to be able to charge these cameras. However Arlo does sale an external charger with usb cable for 14.99 if you want to constantly go without charging or charge it every so often. You can however use almost any micro usb cable as long as it fits into the micro usb camera port. Using a different charger will prompt an warning error, but there are some third party chargers that will work with these cameras. You can keep the camera plugged in directly to the charger at all times, but the usb cable can be obstruct the mount slightly if you are placing your camera at a tight corner or at a certain angle. I recommend finding a right angle charging cable or adapter that will fit into the camera's charging port. Overall these are good security cameras and I love the portability. I can use these cameras for almost any purpose such as keeping tabs on the baby sitter or as a nanny cam or keeping my apartment or home safe from intruders. I guess you could use this to record wild life if you wanted to, but all up to your imagination. I do recommend these security cameras and there different versions of these cameras, so do some research on which one is perfect for you.
title: The App needs work, but the cameras are amazing.

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: DJC
content: Works amazing well during the day but outside at night not as well.  In the day mine will trip a car coming down the road from 100'.  Since the area its scans isn't square but in the shape of a cone, the closer you are the shorter the distance is.  I now have a total of 5 cameras up and on all 5 they seem to trip better from camera right.  All are a minimum of 7' in the air. I used an inline wifi extender under my front window and plugged ( Linksys AC1900 Gigabit Range Extender / WiFi Booster / Repeater MU-MIMO (Max Stream RE7000) ) and plugged the base station into it.  That allowed me to mount 2 camera's on the side of the house across the street from me (~200 ft/).  I have those set to trip the cameras on my house plus record from the camera that was tripped.  Gives us both a way to better track the car/person similar to "follow me". I have added Arlo smart to all cameras ($39 per camera, per year). As of 9/16/17 Arlo Smart is basically in beta but once trained it does quite well with people and animals close to the camera and cars during the day from quite a distance. At night car lights tend to trip it but Smart does not register it as a car.  Once trained you can set it to send push notification for only for 1 or all; animal, person, vehicle.  If it can't detect what it is, you will still get the motion notice.  It will record all motion detections. The batteries will last much longer once you start to trust it and don't use live view very often. To save battery also setup a schedule so when you don't need one or more of the cameras active they are suspended from tripping.  They are not off so you can still use live view.  From the app or the browser you can completely turn off one or more of the cameras.
title: Works amazing well during the day but outside at night not ...

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Jeremy Oates
content: I bought this the day after my car was broken into while parked in my driveway. Wish I would have had them earlier as they appear to work a deterrent. The only thing I've captured besides my families comings and goings are the occasional cat, neighbor pulling out of their driveway and package deliveries. If you have teenagers they work well as a sneaking out deterrent. Quality: The quality of the video is great. Day obviously being the best, but the camera performs well at night too. Sound: I don't listen to the sound very often in the video but every once i a while I will mention something my to my 5 year old that she said while in the driveway to mess with her. For a while she believed me when I said I was hiding on the roof. So the sound quality is good enough to mess with your kids. Battery Life: Battery life depends on how much the camera is recording something. At first I had a schedule setup which only recorded at night and the battery lasted a really long time. I've since moved to having the camera active to motion 24/7 and the batteries still last several weeks.
title: Twelve month review

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Barbara Allen
content: This product is terrible if you want to use it outside and if you have any walls!!  This sounds funny, but it is just what the Netgear rep said to us when we complained about the product not working after a full day off from work trying to set it up-three pretty smart people.  What I can recommend is to read the "real" product reivews online about having to constantly re-sync the cameras, how open spaces are needed with good lighting for decent results and how "weatherproof" really means weather resistant.  I am a netgear fan, but this product is awful.  I have heard the wired product is better.  Do not spend money on this product!
title: This wireless system does not work!

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Sylvain
content: One year later, very disappointing. Seems like an experimental product, immature. Most important concerns on my side are: * The geofencing, i.e. the ability to arm/disarm the system according to the geo-location of your phones, does not work correctly. Either because of custom settings in your phone (permissions, battery optimization, etc.) and the app is totally clueless to help you. Or because of bugs in the app that the support team cannot really solve (check the support forum), probably under-staffed. * The delay for alerts. Recording starts after a few seconds, variable depending on your situation, but we are talking about 3-5 seconds, which can make the recording just useless. * Notifications are terrible. It has improved a lot in 1y, but still not at the expected level, you cannot trust the system to assume whether notifications are correct.
title: Product is just not mature

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Caitlin B.
content: We searched for many months for the right camera for our home.  We landed on arlo pro because of the reviews and the ease of installing.  The benefits of these cameras are that they are wireless, withstand weather (we live in TX), and there is an app.  We have had the cameras for a few months now and still love them! The pictures are VERY clear and we have it on the medium setting to help with battery life.  So far we have not charged our outdoor camera and it is always picking up our flag blowing into frame.  It starts recording before someone even walks up which is awesome! It will even pick up sound from our neighbors house clear as day, and we are not that close to them! We also have a camera in our dog room.  It has been a great addition although it will not pick up motion by them, I am not sure if it is because the room is 9 ft deep and only 4.5 feet wide or what.  It does pick up every time they bark though.  I have all the setting on sensitive so I have just settled with the audio and no motion. The two way voice is to die for! I can hear very clear and usually my pets can hear me too. The night mode is great and picks up stray cats walking up our patio and even bugs flying around.  My husband and I both have iPhone and the app works most of the time.  Every once in a while it will say that it could not log onto the cameras or there is a problem with the connection, we just reload and try again.  The one downfall to these is that they are fed off of wifi, so if the power goes out you are kind of screwed.  We will definitely be purchasing more of these cameras in the future!
title: Great for the money

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Garrett S. Aihara
content: I've had the system going on 11 months now. Cameras work good but quality control and Netgear support is terrible. The system came with a defective charger that was basically good for 10 battery recharges before it crapped out. The good thing is that the charger was covered under warranty. The bad news is that they charge $16.90 shipping and handling which begs the question of why bother? I ended up buying a 3 pack of 9V usb quick chargers for basically the same price as Netgear S&H charge but now I can charge 3 batteries instead of 1. If you plan on buying these cameras just avoid Netgear support altogether and solve the hardware problems yourself. @Netgear step your game up, do right by your customers, and stop being penny wise, pound foolish. I'm done purchasing your products because you can't eat a fraction of a % point on your margins and do right by your customers. The cameras are good but I won't support you based on principle. Your warranty policy is a joke, I'll take my business elsewhere and support companies that do right by their customers.
title: Poor Quality Control and Terrible Warranty Policies

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: AJ
content: We purchased Arlo Sep.2017 and all we did is to put it outside in our backyard located in Richmond city. It’s convinence to have the cordless camera that we are able to move the camera around to get different angles but as to quality of the video is not close to professional and plus the camera doesn’t work right after six months. During these couple months I covered the camera with silicone covers from the beginning but now it seems that the camera will record 2-3mins of nothing and the image is ....... well you can judge for yourself. Although it’s 1080p but the video can only let you know whether there is movement but you won’t able to make out either license plate or faces over 10ft and if lighting is bad than good luck! I had Nest cam around same time I got Arlo, and downsides of Nest is it needs to plug in all the time and it will go offline for time to time if the wireless internet is not stable. It’s 1080p just like Arlo so similar problem with seeing the face clearing and license plate when make report to police. However the image quality is never as bad as Arlo whereas all your see is blur of color blocks on your screen. If your are away from your house, and received Arlo alert, you have to wait 5-8mins for the app to download the images whereas Nest you just wait 3-5sec for the app to open and you are able to see instant images right away. Anyway, I am done with these ‘toy’ cameras, none of them provide enough image quality to identify face or able to make out a license plate from 70ft (which is how long our driveway is) I lived in the city and gets people wondering around the neighborhood a lot so I will definitely consider 4K camera and self recording system after these experiments.
title: Broke down after six months

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Joseph puleo
content: Arlo pro  batteries  seem to last a lot longer time do you original  arlo
title: Arlo pro works great

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: YaquinaHead
content: Read the reviews on Mandatory Two-Step Authentication on the ARLO forum before you purchase.  A lot of very disappointed customers.  Arlo is implementing two-step authentication the end of September, 2020.  The cameras are very good, but they are a bit slow to respond on mobile devices, PC or Alexa.  The new two-step will only further delay access to viewing cameras.  This is very critical when something goes down and you need immediate access.  The two-step should be an option, not mandatory.  Arlo says you only have to do it once.  That is not an accurate statement.
title: Mandatory Two-Step Authentication

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Patrick
content: Great camera, motion detector works great and the sound picked up is amazing, I can hear whats going on at the building across the street with my phone.At first I had problems with the base and camera  disconnecting from my modem and had to re-boot the base station 3 or 4 times a day. I called Cox and had them put me on a different channel, turns out I was getting interference from other wi-fi- in the area, now It works flawlessly. Need to be a little bit techy to navigate but once you use it, it has some options you will like. I turn it off during the day so the battery lasts a very long time.You can take pictures or video like I said nice options with this system. The camera is at least 60 feet away from the base and modem, operating  through walls and works great.I also bought the mounting stand which has a great range of positions, and the skins that give it more protection from the weather, also the stand and skins are black for stealth. Arlo has a user forum  to use should you run into problems that gets a very fast response from other users rather than calling Arlo for help.
title: Great System

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Colleen Ann
content: This is the worst option out there. Please learn from my costly mistake. First, IF the base is actually online & hasn’t gone offline on its own, chances are the camera won’t actually connect the first, second or third time you try to watch it. It might work IF you manually turn the camera off and then back on via the app. And oh, you think it’ll stay on when you turn the next camera off/on? Well that’s just silly. This is probably why no more ratings are allowed with the package that includes the base. Oh and how to you reconnect cameras if your internet goes out?  You have to manually remove the battery from each & every camera. Seriously.  Run. Don’t buy this.
title: Always offline

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: railfan
content: I like the Alro Pro system.  At first I was a little hesitant.  It is very pricy.  The range is ok.  But it does something that nothing else does.  It is fully wireless.  Not cables for signal or power.  We originally purchased these so that we could set them up away from the house looking at the house.  Then we would know if something broke a window (like a speeding bird). I have found an additional use for them that is great.  I use them as test cameras for my wired in cameras.  Before I run a cable, I setup an Arlo camera at the location to see if it will is a good setup.  That lets me tweak my setup before the expense of running cables.  Why don't I just use Arlo?  1 - cost, 2 - it doesn't work with Blue Iris.  So where I can cable a camera, I do.  Where I can't cable a camera I use Arlo Pro. Battery life is also fantastic.  If you place them where they have a decent signal to the base station, and they are not constantly triggering motion, then the batteries have been lasting me about 5-6 months.  If there is lots and lots of motion, my battery life was down around 3 months.
title: Costly, but very flexible and easy to use.  Wife loves them.

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: JH1986
content: I did a lot of research before buying these cameras.  After deciding that I didn't want the hassle and all of the work to install a wired system I closely compared the Arlo Pro to the Nest cameras.  I ultimately picked the Arlo Pro because there is absolutely nothing else to buy if the 7 day cloud storage is good enough (which it is for me).  I believe the Nest camera requires a fee for cloud storage.  I didn't get the newer model Arlo with higher definition because my understanding is that it needs to be plugged in to power for HD, and that defeats the purpose of having a wire-free system for me. I have one camera looking at my porch and another camera looking at my driveway.  I used the magnet mount for my driveway camera because I can reach out my upstairs window to remove the camera for charging.  The magnet mount is very sturdy.  I purchased an Arlo mount for my porch camera because I didn't want someone to be able to easily steal it...even though it is bit of a reach to grab. I spent a lot of time playing with the sensitivities, and my cameras get 15-30 hits a day.  Part of that is due to a sunflower by my porch that moves in the wind and also due to the fact that there is more activity at my house in the summer than there is the rest of the year.  Even with all of that activity I've had the cameras up for 2 months and am still at 32% and 22% power.  I am very impressed by that. All in all this is a great product and I am very happy. PROS: 1.  Super easy to set up both the cameras and the software. 2.  Software is very straight forward and there are a lot of you tube videos explaining it if you get confused. 3.  Battery life has been great so far. 4.  Night vision is great. 5.  Sound from the cameras is very good. 6.  Being able to remotely view live video from anywhere (phone, PC, etc.) is very nice. CONS - And these aren't really cons, because the cameras work exactly as advertised. 1.  Image quality is just OK.  You can't read license plates with these cameras, but if you need that you need the HD model. 2.  There is a couple second delay and the speaker on the cameras is not very loud.  If you are trying to use one of these as a video doorbell and have a conversation with someone it is not ideal. 3.  The cameras trigger by motion going across the field of view, but won't trigger if you come straight at the camera.  The Arlo instructions are very up front about this, so you have to take that into account when you mount them so you are catching things crossing the path of the camera.
title: Good cameras for a wire-free solution.

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Brian95624
content: I've wanted cameras outside my house for a while but didn't want to spend the money because I would have to invest in electrical to get power on the eaves of the house and have to see the ugly wires after they were installed. The Arlo Pro resolved both of those problems. But I still read many verified user reviews before I purchased because I didn't want to invest in something that either didn't work or didn't have high quality video.. Installation was very simple, it took me more time to get out my ladder and put the screw into the eaves than it took to plug in the base to my router and sync the cameras.. I'm happy that I don't have to go back up the ladder for six months to recharge the battery. That's amazing technology, that makes my life better. It's so relaxing that I can see what's going on at my home from miles away. When I was out of town last weekend and my friend came to stay at the house, I freaked her out by saying hello when she got out of her car. The system is easy to access by either using the app on my phone or on a PC so I can have live views whenever I feel the need. I'm very happy with my purchase but I might add another camera and even though they are weatherproof, I think I'll buy some silicone skin covers to further protect my investment. I definitely recommend for someone like me who wants the latest technology that is also convenient to use.
title: Excellent Camera, Great Value

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Leese
content: The cameras came fully charged and with chargers and cables.  When we needed to recharge them the app said the chargers were not compatible with the cameras. Upon further inspection it appeared that neither the chargers or cables were made for Arlo devices. We requested a replacement and we finally got what we initially were looking for. The difference from what we originally got to the replacement is night and day. From the box to the finishing screws it looks like the replacement is actually made by Arlo.  We tested the charger and cables immediately and everything worked great. The picture was even better as well. If you choose to buy I recommend you test the charger immediately. I’m giving this a 3 because the product we initially received didn’t appear to be a true Arlo.
title: Replacement was better

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: swaminathan
content: The ARLO Pro wireless security camera system with two cameras ,siren and rechargeable batteries units made by Arlo Technologies  were working till last month. I thought the batteries would have discharged. So I connected each of them one after another to the mains through the adapter supplied . Both the batteries were not getting charged even after 6 to 8 hours of charging. I am disappointed with this purchase though I spent about 275$. I would like the manufacturer to give me new batteries if that is the problem or  replace any defective item. . Had a chat with the manufacturer on 17/6 and after testing the units on line said the fault is in the adapter and cable andthat they would replace in 3 days and gave registeration.No 41739541. No replacement received to date. Again called to remind.This time they asked me to remit 17$ towards postage and also that I had to return the adapter first before they would ship me the replacement. It is regrettable that ARLO has such a bad return/replacement policy.  Also if item is lost in transit they are not responsible.So for giving a replacement for a $10 adapter I had to face these problems. I would suggest customers be careful while purchasing ARLO products as their warranty policy is disgraceful. After spending a lot  the product lies idle with you. Please be aware.
title: Bad warranty policy

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Cliff Washburn
content: I have 5 Arlo cameras and use to love them but started having problems.  First the base station would randomly go offline sending all of my cameras offline and I was not able to reset them until I was home which left my system blind for that time.  So with this continued problem and no help from Arlo support I purchased 2 Nest outdoor cameras to use with my Arlo cameras and WOW...Now I get to see everything that the Arlo cameras are missing.  I knew that the motion was iffy on the Arlo but had no idea how much happened that it didn't catch and now I can go back and see everything that happened and how and where it started from not just a worthless glimpse as something exits the camera view.  Arlo wireless is nice for placement but you don't know what your missing until you miss it.  Customer support is lacking as well..
title: Use to Love but now I don't

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Crnn21483
content: The cons outweigh the pros on these. The are super easy to setup and mount. The app is pretty easy to work once you play with it for a day. But... the motion detection and image quality is pretty poor. I have one mounted at the entrance to my driveway and sometimes it'll send me notifications all day from cars driving by about 75 feet in the distance. Then half the time it won't record me pulling into the driveway 10 feet away. This is also advertised as an HD camera but you can't read license plate numbers or tell who anyone is unless you know them. I am still contemplating returning these and just getting a wired setup with dvr.
title: Inconsistent and unreliable for the high price tag

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Seraphim
content: I brought these cameras because of the outstanding ratings that I saw here on Amazon as well as other sites.  The picture quality on the cameras is very good however for unknown reasons the picture on two of the cameras would switch to black and white only.  I called tech support a few times.  Not only because of two of the cameras showing black and white only,  but also because the two way listen and speak button was not available on the app they provide.  Also noticed their website and videos featured a camera positioning button that could be used to set up the cameras. When I called Tech support, it was disappointing to find that my call had been shipped off shore to tech support staff where English is not their first language. I had trouble understanding them and them me. When I asked questions they did not seem to know the answers particularly when I told them the app they provide does not support the listen and talk feature as well as the fact that the camera positioning function is simply not there as indicated on their website.  They seemed genuinely confused and didn't really have an answer.  They also said there would be an app update biut did not know when.  So..sadly..I am returning the cameras (I bought the six pack) and going with the Nest Cams and the Ring Stick up cam.  Netgear..you can do better than this!!
title: Very disappointing for a Netgear Product

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: fg1132
content: Arlo pro camera picture quality is  not bad at night but better during the day,  this is 720,  I bought a Arlo pro 2 camera  to compare  together and there really isn’t much of a difference,  In my opinion it is a slightly better camera but not worth the money they are asking way overpriced. I wouldn’t waste my money getting the Arlo pro 2, sound is not good it is hard for people to hear and talk  from the cameras outside,  The sound from your phone or computer is pretty good but the sound from the cameras is not too good. The Arlo pro is a decent wireless camera system and the price isn’t bad I paid $450 for a 4 camera system. I’ve seen them slightly cheaper and a free 7 day cloud is great almost nobody offers that,  almost everyone else charge a fee.  The batteries will last a few months if they are not set off by motion a lot or used as live.  We arm them when we’re not home and  when we are in bed at night,  sometimes during the day if we’re not going to go out side.
title: Arlo Pro is a good  wireless camera system for the price with free 7 day cloud

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: David
content: The hardware work fine.  The app sucks!!!!  We use 3 different devices to access Arlo: Iphone 7, Moto 4x and a brand new Lenovo Tablet.  The Iphone can't always turn the system on or off, Moto works fine, the Tablet does not receive any notifications.  Arlo will not help.  When they update the app, you loose all your settings, and they disable the alarm. NOW we get Ads, every time I open the  app, EVERY TIME, we get push notification, that at 1st look like an Alarm went off. Buy something else,  There is NO customer support.
title: Software sucks

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Kendassa
content: I won't say don't buy them. They are decent. They have poor battery life even on battery saver and since they are high up I have to have someone come help me take them down and charge them to put back up. Also the one that is not under my carport has gotten knocked down by a squirrel and the hurricane (I am not near the ocean but we did get around 60-65mph gusts from Michael) so the magnet isn't as strong as it could be. Picking the camera up off the ground is no fun. I do like being able to monitor my house when I am not there. The con is the stray dogs that love my house, like to trigger it, which beeps my phone and makes my Shichi bark.. because she knows something is outside. They have nice clear pictures day and night... But overall, the main thing is batter quality.. needs to be better and last longer.. I shouldn't have to charge it before 2 months is up.. on battery saver.
title: These are okay cameras

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: N.
content: I needed to replace an 8yr old system that doesn’t have notification capability & better video quality & vivid color. Once you get over the insanely inflated price & lie to your wife, it’s definitely worth investing in BUT this is NOT a system for live monitoring. It’s not capable of running your settings if you’re monitoring a camera in live mode 👎. The system does not come with a user manual so your left researching what the terminology & meaning of settings are. The slickest option is your can use any camera as a motion sensor to tell the other cameras to start recording. The battery life is way way over rated. At the minimal settings I had to recharge all 4 cameras with in 10 days so I purchased 2 outdoor power adapters, plugged those into a iHome smart plug & established a schedule via the iOS Home app to turn on the smart plug every Monday for 60 minutes. Now I can optimize my camera settings on my 2 primary cameras & not worry about the battery. I highly recommend purchasing either 2 thumb drives or a external hard drive to expand the memory storage to eliminate paying for monthly service.
title: Great video quality, intuitive app packed full of options...

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Brian McDermott
content: Pros: Can set up your cameras on a schedule to start monitoring for activity. (i.e. start monitoring every night from 11pm to 5am automatically) Camera battery life is fantastic. I have put them in my vacation house for 6+ months without any worry about needing a recharge. If for some reason they lose power to the base station, however, they will die very fast as I suppose they will constantly search for the wireless signal. Motion detection algorithm seems good. I've never had a false alert and have these constantly monitoring for months at a time. I love the magnetic backs - they make it extremely easy to place the cameras. Cons: Cameras run through Arlo servers and when the servers go down you lose your connection to the cameras. This has not happened often as far as I have noticed but when it does happen it is obviously a big security risk. Overall I am very satisfied with the purchase. Bonus: I turn my android phone on Do not disturb at night, and I keep it so Arlo can still notify me of events, but sometimes I sleep with earplugs. If you get the Fit Notifications app and have a fitbit smartwatch you can make it vibrate your smartwatch when the cameras get triggered.
title: Great portable security system with long battery life

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: A. Hauser
content: We like the fact that Arlo allows for a video storage plan that does not require an additional paid subscription.  However, we have had ongoing problems with the Arlo.  The motion sensor, even at its least sensitive setting, captured far too much - every time the wind blew and a tree in our yard moved even slightly, the sensor would start recording which drained the batteries quickly.  However, the low overall score for me comes from the terrible experience we had when our Arlo stopped charging.  We were easily able to diagnose the problem as the camera, not the battery or charging cable.  However, the Arlo tech support insisted on sending us a new battery and then new charging cables to try, taking over a month of back and forth to confirm the camera was broken.  Then they required a convoluted return process where they issued an RMA but made us call to confirm the RMA, then want us to send the defective camera back at our own cost.  They have dragged us around for nearly 2 months to repair the camera, using lots of red tape and delay tactics.  It is really frustrating and would keep me from buying another Arlo camera in the future.
title: Does not stand the test of time & customer service is terrible

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Z. Shopperson
content: I purchased the 5 camera Arlo Pro system. After taking an entire day to install the system and all cameras, one of the cameras turned out to have a problem with motion detection (does not detect motion at all which makes it practically useless since these cameras turn on by detecting motion. After more than 1 hour of wait and talk with Netgear support, they conceded the obvious which is that the camera was defective on arrival. They issued an RMA but they expected me to pay for the shipping of the camera to them which does not make any sense. So the bottom line is, if you order these cameras there is a possibility that they will be defective and you will have to pay for return shipping.
title: Defective on arrival

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Rob P.
content: Yes, these cameras are the cat's pajamas.  No cables neeeded.  Easy to position (and move), rechargable long-lived li ion batteries, free 7 day cloud storage, several ways to control when they are active.  I mostly use the "schedule" mode.  There is a location mode that uses your smartphone location to activate/deactivate the system, but my wife is often in the house when I leave, and I also found that occasionally the system would activate when it thought I'd left my house when I didn't.  Since these are so portable, I have a couple that I don't mount so that when we go on vacation, I can just set down (and disguise) in locations for which I don't when in town (such as in a bookshelf in my home office).  Nice to know if the house cleaner/pet sitter/house watcher is going where they shouldn't.  The email alerts work great (with a snapshot of the triggering scene and link to the cloud video), and the app is fast and robustly featured.  These have their own dedicated wifi base station which must be wired to your router.  Since it has limited range, I located it centrally by using a  NETGEAR PowerLINE NETGEAR PowerLINE 1200 Mbps, 1 Gigabit Port (PL1200-100PAS) adaptor to simulate ethernet connection to my router.  If you have a large house with cameras quite distant, you may need to get two controllers.  Saying that, I'm not sure if you could link cams on different controllers to the same free cloud account.  Worst case, you create two accounts, and just have to login/out when you want to switch. I wish I had the 1080p version, but those cost about twice as much at this time so I don't think it's worth it.  I've also had a problem when using my outdoor cams during daytime when the sun is out.  I THINK moving shadows created from wind-blown tree branches will cause it to activate.  I ended up turning the sensitivity way down to avoid lots of false alarms.  I'd have to spend more time to trouble-shoot to know if it actually was the shadows or if there were unseen blowing leaves or something of that sort.
title: Best home security cams (for 720p)

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Mike
content: If you MUST have a wireless security camera, this is probably your best choice.  But, there are MANY downsides you need to accept: 1.  You will be changing/charging batteries about once per month.  (Your mileage may vary.) 2. You will NOT get all of the action.  The cameras don't start recoding until the action has already started, so you will miss 2-5 seconds of action.  This does not sound like a lot, but it often causes you to miss something critical. 3. The range of motion detection is VERY limited.  I would say 20 feet at best.  Again, this will cause you to miss a lot of action. 4. The quality of the picture, even at the highest setting is just OK. 5. The distance the cameras can be from the base station is limited.  With the base station at the back of my house, my front camera could not connect.  It is VERY picky. If you are OK with all of that, then the Arlo Pro is an OK system.  Its biggest selling point is obviously that the cameras are completely wireless.  But, I feel the trade-offs are still to great for this system to be useful. I tried the Nest Outdoor cameras.  They only require power.  Once seeing how good that system worked, there was just no way I could accept issues with the Arlo.  Sure, running power is a pain, but the camera system is AMAZING.
title: OK System if you MUST HAVE WIRELESS

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Successest1982
content: BEWARE: I purchased this camera June 2017, It worked fine until October 2017, it wouldn't hold a charge and kept going offline. Which is exactly what I need during the holidays. Anywho,  I called netgear twice and asked that they refund or send a new camera. I was told that they had to troubleshoot the item  first. I informed them that I had already gone through the troubleshooting process and the issue did not resolve. I called a third time and was told a supervisor would call me back within 3-5 hours and that if one did not, I could call back and I would automatically be routed to a supervisor. Well, surprise, no phone call. I called them back the next day and they stated they called me but the number they claimed to call was not my phone number. I was placed on hold for 25 minutes and was told that the supervisor authorized an exchange for a new item but I would have to pay the shipping of 16.00. I then asked why I had to pay to return a defective item that was still under the manufacturer's warranty. I was then placed on another hold and told they would waive the shipping but I had to give them my credit card information as collateral, in case I never returned the defective camera. ****** Will update with the outcome *****
title: Works fine if product is not defective

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: reality
content: I have had Arlo cameras for over 2 years.  I was happy with them in the beginning; geofencing worked all the time, picture quality is relatively good, etc.  When my iPhone updated to v13 I lost all auto genfencing capabilities.  I have to open the app every time I leave the house to get the cameras to arm!  Many tech related products experience issues from time to time with software updates and dependencies.  That is no the main issue, it's the way Arlo is handling the situation.  Many customers have opened tickets on this problem with practically ZERO response from Arlo on what the issue is, when it will be resolved, etc.  I was confident in the beginning that the issue would be fixed within a few weeks, but it has been a couple months now and it's still not working.  I have recommended these cameras the past couple of years to friends and family and no less than 5 households have purchased them based on my recommendation.  I feel bad doing that now as all of them are experiencing this problem.  I CAN NO LONGER RECOMMEND THESE CAMERAS, DO NOT BUY!
title: Disappointing Customer Service on Geofencing Issues

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Jack T
content: This camera gets pretty good reviews on some of the tech sites, so I used that as a guide.  The cameras have been installed for about a week or so (June 2019).  In any case, the install was pretty easy and the setup process is fine.  Now for performance.  I have two cameras on my front porch.  Camera one (right side) has great night vision, but poor audio and motion detection.  It rarely detects people walking on the sidewalk - maybe 20 feet away, and if a car drives by at anything over walking speed, all I get to see is the back of the car.  Running about 8 hours per day, the battery in this camera will probably last about 14 to 21 days.  Camera two is opposite side of the porch from camera one and supposedly covers the other side of the front (left side).  Motion and audio detection is not very good, and equal to camera one.  The battery on this side is just awful.  In two days it went from 100% (indicated) to 41%.  After one week it went to 12%, so I shut it off.  One thing I noticed is that this camera has a solar light that illuminates a flag.  That light fools the camera into thinking night is day, so there is no night vision, just daytime like color vision.  Not very useful, so the camera is not shut off.  Given the very limited battery life, and not wanting to get a ladder out and charge  camera one every two weeks, I am thinking about the solar charger.  It gets terrible reviews becuase it doesn't seem to be able to actually charge the cameras, but I already have $300 USD invested in it, so if I throw away another $80, so what.  If it works, 50/50 chance, I'm ahead.  Reading the reviews of Netgear's off shore customer service has convinced me that I'm on my own, and I don't need the aggravation of dealing with someone reading a script, but the ultimate answer of "no".  I'm going to change position of camera one to see if it actually detects motion.  If I find that this whole exercise is a waste of time, I'll put the whole thing on eBay and see if I can recover any of my expenditures.  Bottom line to this is that it is a very expensive piece of not very good engineering and as someone else pointed out, the user is the beta tester.  Buy something else.
title: Not very happy with it

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Gary R.
content: This camera is the 2nd type I have tried.  The first one was too complicated to setup.  I really like how easy it was to setup and the image quality is fantastic.  This camera is 100% cordless.  What I cannot get over is that the battery is still working great after being out in the AZ sun all this summer when it has been over 100 every day.  How is that possible?  Why can't they put this technology in my cell phone battery? I only have 2 complaints which is the "only" reason I give it 4 stars instead of 5.  When it detects movement and notifies me by email on my cell phone.  It takes so long before I can see what is happening or talk to the person who is at the door, they have already left.  It takes a while minute which doesn't sound like a long time but long enough for the person at the door to assume nobody is there. My other complaint is that if I talk to the person outside from my cell phone, they can barely hear me but I can hear them outside at the camera as clear as day.  Now on my laptop they can hear me fine so it might just be my cell phone but I have tried everything possible.
title: If you like easy to setup, this is the camera for you.

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
