Every time I clicked their link it didn't work. Sometimes, when trying to retrieve video, it would freeze and quickly booted me out with the message "your request timed out". AND, they do not tell you that if you want constant recorded video, you have to pay for it with a subscription. The camera will record short clips of motion, and those you can retrieve for free from Cloud, but if you want constant recording you have to pay for that. In general, I did not have a good experience with this product and had to return it and get something different.
title: Had to recharge batteries every 5 days!.

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Susan P.
content: I am not real impressed with the Arlo system. I know a hard wire system would have less lag time with the motion detector, but even after purchasing  a Netgear range extender to aid in the lag time, it did not help much at all.The battery lasts around a month and push to talk does not work at all. I speak slow and clear and you maybe get the end of the last word I say. Just playing around with it to test it I tried saying "What do you want?" It came out as "aunt". I tried several times with different phrases too. The good? The microphone on the camera so I can hear the people outside works great, unless you have tried to use push to talk, which like I said before does not work. I do like that you can store your recordings for 7 days for free. The video quality is okay.
title: More annoying things than good

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: TJ
content: I wanted to like this so badly. The hardware is well built and sleek looking. However, the bottom line is that it's functionality is so limited and unreliable that it simply fails to fulfill it's purpose. The connectivity to the camera through the app is sluggish and spotty. The app crashes a lot, too - read the reviews for the app. Because the smartphone based app does not work well, it doesn't matter if the picture and sound quality is good. It doesn't matter how many features there are. This just doesn't get the job done, and the app/software does the cool design a huge disservice. Very disappointing.
title: Does Not Get the Job Done

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: fresh
content: This is a complicated review to write because this camera system has many glitches. At times works great and other times doesn't work at all so I guess inconsistent would be the key phrase. The delay is quite aggravating and is inconsistent with each camera at any given time the delay on One camera could be 4 seconds why the delay on the other camera can be 10 seconds or any variable. The clarity is pretty good but I wouldn't say very high definition. Often times it captures the tree blowing and but doesn't capture me walking by. I do like the programmable features such as recording times sensitivity and ability to view live footage while anywhere via the app. I have found that battery usage doesn't even compare to other viewers reviews. A fully charged battery within 3 days will be down to 45% so the one camera I have hard-wired to eliminate the aggravation of getting to it while the other two cameras are easily accessible and not much of a hassle to recharge which happens quickly.
title: Inconsistent

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Tuscon Red
content: I purchased this (with add-on cameras) about 5 months ago and it all worked for a period. For the last 2 months, I would periodically get a disconnect between all or some of my cameras and the base station. I did not start screaming immediately because they would come back in a few minutes to hours. However, about a month ago, all cameras lost connection and nothing I did would bring them back. I even connected directly to my router and the base station was undiscoverable. So, I experimented by buying another base station with a new camera (I now have 6). Well, not to my surprise, the new base station was discovered immediately and I am in the process of reading all of my cameras to the new base station. It appears that the ethernet and wireless connection in the base station failed. All of the cameras are perfect. Since the base station was out of warranty, I have to eat the cost of my experiment. But, I wanted to let the community know that it is not always the camera that is failing because they are a simple piece of hardware. The base station is the key. I'll continue with my new base station but I have a new doorstop with the "Arlo" name plastered on the front. Just consider this when buying. Other than that, I have been pleased. If I get some base station satisfaction with my new doorstop, I'll revise the overall rating, if anyone cares.
title: Base Station Failure

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Dklingler
content: UPDATED REVIEW... DO NIT BUY!!  These cameras are junk..glitchy as hell. Half the time I log in to see what is going on, the camera won’t connect. I have these cameras installed at my mothers house so we can check in and make sure she’s okay, and I can’t tell you how many times I’ve not been able to check on her...useless! We’ve been using these cameras for almost 2 weeks and they are perfect for what we need. One is installed facing the front door and the other is inside the house. My only complaint would be only one person can access the Arlo app at a time, so sometimes when I’m looking at the video feeds I get bumped out of the app because another family member is looking at it.
title: Complete junk...I’m soooo disappointed

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: zsines
content: I debated on spending the extra $100-200 for the Ring system.  I don't regret my choice at this point, going with Arlo to save a bit of cash.  So far, after 3 weeks, I still haven't had to charge either of the cameras after the initial set up and they are riding around 60%.  Pretty impressive, considering how much we check them.  I added the door bell as well and it's working great. Software is awesome and the set up was easy.  I do suggest you get a security mount if using one of the cameras for your front door, as it's easy to just pull these off the magnetic mounts. Great product! UPDATE: I've had these around 5 weeks now and haven't had to charge them...they are still at 50% with moderate usage.  I'm literally amazed by the battery life and the responsiveness of the app when accessing the cameras.
title: These are Awesome

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: KT
content: Received and installed the product however the router crapped out on us and it stopped working after less than a month of use. Called Arlo support to have them replace, they went through the standard procedures even though we knew that it was not an internet or restart issue. It had to do with the Ethernet port being burnt out or loose in wiring. Finally, they said they’d replace the unit but that took several days to email us a packing slip. And that’s just the thing. It was JUST the packing slip and no return shipping label. They want us to pay to ship their faulty product back to them before replacing the unit. We have yet to receive the replacement. We’re just a bit miffed by the level of customer care from Arlo. We expected more. I think the lesson here is to just go through Amazon.
title: For Support/Replacements, Go Through Amazon

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: george figueiredo
content: Although the product works as advertised I’ve decided to return as th customer service is absolutely dreadful. Actually it’s the worst of anything I’ve ever seen. One of the 5 cameras wouldn’t connect so after 2 hours on the phone they basiaxally said return it. I should have listened. I actually ended up discussing it out in my own but still needed the camera replaced because it wouldn’t stay connected unless it was plugged in. After two more phone calls of over an hour each I was told that I had to return the camera first before they would send me the replacement. Really? Was it my fault the camera didn’t work? I had no faith that they would execute on their end of the bargain so a supervisor (James) would do me a favor and send me the camera as long as I have them my CC# for a $2 hold.  They then would ship me the camera and Refund the $2 once the camera was return returned. I’d the camera wasn’t returned they would be able to charge my CC for the retail cost of the camera. It’s was their collateral he said... are you kidding me? They need collateral to send me a working product after over 2 months of their incompetence? Yeah, I’ll get a Nest...
title: Worst customer service ever!

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Brittany
content: The Arlo system is very convenient as far as installation is concerned. However, I am noticing that my camera doesn't always record when it should and when it does, it records in 15 second increments. Sometimes the recording doesn't begin until the subject is almost out of the frame. I worry that if someone were to steal packages from my porch, that the recording won't kick off in time. I hope that Arlo releases a software update soon. To Arlo, please release an update extending the record time or to record when all motion has stopped. I did enable the setting to record until motion has stopped - but it doesn't work how it should.
title: Great but with a few bugs

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: B. Braun
content: The batteries on these Arlo cameras are a joke.  I purchased the set at the end of January, charged and sync'd the cameras the first week of February.  The batteries lasted until May 23rd before they needed recharging.  After recharging on May 23rd, without any change in use or how they were deployed, dropped down to below 10% by June 12th.  21 Days, Are you kidding me?  I went to the Arlo support page which is actually a community page and discovered this was a known issue.  Back on June 3rd, Arlo posted the fix was in QA, stay tuned.  So far NOTHING!!! You'd have thought Arlo (Netgear) would have emailed all the people who registered their cameras to alert them to the battery problem. Do the right thing, Arlo!!  REPLACE ALL OF THE USELESS BATTERIES, FREE OF CHARGE.
title: Batteries ARE WORTHLESS!!!

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Thomas
content: The only way you can arm/disarm this is through an app that's unreasonably slow and buggy. Today I came home and COULD NOT DISARM my security system because the app stopped showing it in the device list for no apparent reason. The only way I was able to fix it (after several minutes of troubleshooting) was to reboot my phone. Even when it's not completely broken, the app is so slow I've often had to sit in my driveway for more than a minute before the UI would load to let me arm or disarm it. This is somewhat mitigated by using IFTTT integration, but sometimes that stops working until you open the app and log in again. Maybe the iOS version isn't as bad, but the Android experience is just unacceptable.
title: Only controllable through a badly broken app

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: David J. Mastrianni
content: I bought this one year ago on speculation that it would someday be made HomeKit compatible.  When that day arrived it’s been a huge disappointment, especially for people trying to figure out how to get it to work - have a look at their Community posts.  Other than acting like a HomeKit motion sensor, there is no way to change any settings without using their online App and no way to trigger the siren using Scenes or Automations. If you use the App, the only HomeKit integration is the ability to destroy your HomeKit accessories!!  I have Apps from Eve, Schlage, Philips Hue and iDevices that are well integrated with HomeKit and none of them force me to have an online account but the Arlo App does.  I’m using this as an over glorified baby monitor to get some use out of it but not for home security.
title: Terrible HomeKit Integration

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Michael Rivett
content: These cameras work really well, good picture quality, and free 7 day cloud storage (compared to Nests 10$ a month +5$ for each additional camera) Decent range on the cameras, I have the base station in the basement and can have the camera on the front of the house and the back yard without any problems.  The only thing I've noticed so far is that the iPhone app sometimes needs to be force-quit to get the cameras to respond quickly. The only feature I wish it had was a way to silence motion alarms for a period of time (for example: I have one on my front porch; it would be nice to be able to silence the alarm for an hour, so I don't get alerts every 30 seconds when my kids are playing out front.
title: 95% of the features for saving $15 a month over the competition

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Renee
content: This is perfect except I cannot speak to whomever is standing outside.  On the flipside: fabulous pictures; free 7 days of cloud; perfect audio reception; and great software.  I highly recommend this product, providing the speaker function (owner speaking to intruder) matters not.  It doesn't matter to me as we have an alarm system and this is used to gather information about intruders.  I can record audio from pretty far away with great quality.  Additionally, if the camera portion is stolen, I still have the automatic video and audio in the cloud and evidence of the person who would have taken it.  Many devices have an SD card, so if the unit is stolen, so is the evidence.  Love my Arlos.
title: Love it!

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Mark
content: Very pleased with this system. I'm using these cameras as an Alert system for my home... I know when anyone is moving around our house and can respond as needed... In my opinion picture quality is plenty good enough... I did also purchase rubber boots and exterior mounting brackets for outside installation... I set the motion detection to the max setting... We have a miniature 9 lb. Weiner dog and he sets off all motion detectors... Battery life: I installed cameras 20 days ago. Weather here is in the teens at night. 3 back cameras are in the 93% range. 2 front cameras are activated quite often coming and going and are in the 85% range... I expect warmer weather will improve battery life. I'm not a tech savvy type person and set up was truly simple... We also have a home Alarm system should we have a break in... No buyers remorse at all..
title: Great camera system!

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: IT professional
content: The camera and base worked well for the first 3 months. The app, camera, and base did everything as advertised. I then brought the camera inside one day to charge and it lost sync to the base. I tried forever to get it to re-sync with no luck. I then contacted Netgear support, which is where the real issue starts. If you call on the phone, the wait times are ridiculous. I never once was able to hold long enough to speak to someone. I then contacted email support on 8/18/2017. Each time, someone new would respond to me and ask me the same questions: did you reboot it, is your internet on, did you follow the directions... I was asked the same thing by many different people. Then, finally, on September 12th, I think they got tired of me and simply closed my case without resolving it. I have since filed another case. I bought a camera because someone attacked my wife at the doorway of our house. Having downtime on a camera I just paid over $200 for is not an option. This is a cool setup and a nice camera and online app... BUT, if you have any problem, consider yourself screwed out of $200+ or whatever you paid. I highly suggest using a company that cares about their products.
title: Nice setup and hardware, but WARNING: dealing with Netgear is just not worth the hassle

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Barefoot In The Backyard
content: I love these cameras. The video quality (day and night) is great - you get high clarity video and crisp photos.  The sound is great too - although maybe a little too good because we actually turned the mic off on one camera because we didn't want to hear our neighbors conversations.  The whole system was super easy and fast to set up.  Wireless was a key criteria for me because we have zero attic space to run hidden wires and I hate the look of wires hung on walls. The only reason I call the system nearly perfect is I wish there were more screw-in mounting bracket options or an adjustable height one to offer more flexibility. The basic magnetic mount is amazing, but we needed something with a similar range of motion in a screw-in form because we have low roof lines.  Overall it has been a great product.
title: Nearly perfect - great video, easy setup

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: David Ahlers
content: Poor setup experience. 1. When I plugged in the unit and followed the pairing instructions, it couldn't find the unit from either my phone or laptop 2. I then followed the instructions to do a factory reset, which failed 3. Then I search the Google oracle of wisdom, and determined that: a) The device I received must be a previously return item and previously activated by another customer, so MUST be factory reset before I can use it b) The factory reset was failing because the app, the website, and the paper instructions all stated that the Sync button on top and the reset button on back (using a paperclip) must be depressed for 10 seconds.  Apparently this is no longer true.  Now only the reset button should be pressed. The unit is now working.  Perhaps I'll upgrade my rating if I don't have any further problems, but the out of box experience was not great.
title: Inaccurate documentation, unit was not new

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Rich T
content: I’ve had the Arlo Plus system for a few weeks now and I love it! The camera clarity is fantastic! The install and set up was so simple. I purchased the adjustable screw on mount for the camera above my front patio. The audio is ver very good, as a matter of fact it is so good I had to adjust the sensitivity so that every sound wasn’t alerting my phone. The ap is really good and works well on my phone. The only thing I can say that’s even slightly negative ( and it’s nitpicking) is I want my wife’s phone to have the same “master” capability as mine, and for the most part it does because I have her administrative rights, but unlike my phone ap she can’t “shut off” the notifications when there is movement so she gets dings on her phone throughout the night. I’ve heard others state there is too long of a delay before the cameras catch movements but on the ap you can turn up or down the sensitivity. I have mine set almost all the way up and it catches movement from my curb all the way to the house with no issues! I did a lot of research before buying this system and I am NOT sorry I did, it’s fantastic!
title: Fantastic System!

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: russruss
content: Bought the Pro.  Didn't realize that it has to connect to the base.  Wish that it could connect to my wireless access points instead.  Must place the camera so that the object is crossing the screen.  Those are my two cons to the camera.  I do like the wireless never the less.  I was still able to place two cameras where I wanted.  There was another position that I would like but out of range of the base.  Image quality is good but not great.  So far battery life has been great.  I was expecting it to drain quickly but it hasn't.  An setting that I wish it had was recording length setting.  Recordings are typically 15-20 seconds. I wish I could lengthen that time or have it continuously record as long as there is movement.  Arlo Pro is good for what I needed.
title: I do like the wireless never the less

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: J&D Reed
content: I recently bought a 6 camera Arlo 2 system. Overall it was easy to install and the system was straight forward to set up. Instructions were clear and concise. I would recommend this system to anyone wanting better security at their home. Images on the camera are clear and even night time images can easily identify anyone in proximity of the cameras. Nice product and good quality !!! I recently bought a 6 camera Arlo 2 system. Overall it was easy to install and the system was straight forward to set up. Instructions were clear and concise. I would recommend this system to anyone wanting better security at their home. Images on the camera are clear and even night time images can easily identify anyone in proximity of the cameras. Nice product and good quality !!! I recently bought a 6 camera Arlo 2 system. Overall it was easy to install and the system was straight forward to set up. Instructions were clear and concise. I would recommend this system to anyone wanting better security at their home. Images on the camera are clear and even night time images can easily identify anyone in proximity of the cameras. Nice product and good quality !!! I recently installed a 6 camera system.  Directions were concise and accurate and the system works well.  If you need  a boost to your home security this is  a good option.  Good quality images - even at night.  Sound is good as well however background noise can cause distortion issues.  I would recommend this system to anyone looking for  camera security system
title: Easy to instal and works well

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Punie
content: This camera in my opinion is amazing.  The video is not 1080p but is clear enough at 720p to see faces, vehicles and all images clearly.  In my case it works nearly flawless.  The night vision of the Pro camera is great for myself,  no issue at all with night vision.  I can see everything as if daylight.  I changed  out the cat5e cable for a cat6a cable everything working without any issue, only slight buffering and no camera drops.  I am using 4 pro camera and 1 original camera.  The rechargeable battery life I am getting is 4 month in high traffic areas and 6 month in less traffic areas.  I purchase a duel battery charger along with a spare battery this way I always have a charge spare battery ready.  I have not tried charging battery inside camera feature as of this time.  I must mention, high speed internet makes a world of different of these camera ability to function at their best.  These camera are expensive however buying add on camera on Amazon can save you around $32.  This was a great purchase for survailance around my home.
title: Reliable security survailance

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Chad L.
content: I'd been looking for a camera solution for our front door and garage area (where UPS and Fed Ex tend to leave packages) - mainly to ensure that if someone decided to steal a package - I'd have some kind of video/photo evidence, and possibly be able to stop them by speaking live through the camera set-up.  I was so twisted around by the various options out there, each with their strengths and weaknesses - and with mixed reviews for all of the brands/product options.  I finally decided to roll the dice on the Arlo Pro system (2 Pro wireless, battery powered outdoor/indoor cameras with a base station) to see how it went.  Got installed (quickly, no big problems -- both cameras and base station up and running in about 20 minutes, took longer to decide where to mount cameras than it did for the tech to be happy.) That was over three weeks ago - WOW!  It has blown away my expectations by far, here's details: 1.  It's been three weeks - I haven't had to recharge either camera yet.  The camera on front door/main entrance says 90% battery remaining (you can see that through the app) and the secondary camera (less traffic) actually says 100% remaining.  Granted, we live on a private drive (postal carrier only comes to door if they have a package for us) so we don't get as many 'triggers' on the cameras as some people would --- but just coming and going through the course of the day my better half and I are still triggering the main door camera at least 8-12 times a day - so the battery life is 'crushing' my expectations so far (the Arlo Pro generation must be a big step up from the prior generation and some people's comments?) 2.  When a camera is triggered -- I get notification through my smartphone extremely fast.  (Like, within 2-4 seconds most times, 8-10 seconds at most.)  This is fast enough so that I can check the notification and talk through my phone, through the camera -- to speak to a would-be thief.  I was skeptical that the system would be able to work that fast such the the microphone/speaker thing would be of much help in an actual attempted-theft -- now I'm pretty sure it would be.  (My better-half and I have tested the microphone/speaker tech -- pretty cool!) 3.  The videos and even the audio are surprisingly high quality/clear, I love the fact that I have cloud storage and access for free, but that I have also put a USB drive in the base station so I have my own local copies of the audio/video.  (I like the cloud backups because -- if someone broke into the house -- they'd probably damage or steal the base station thinking it could help them cover their tracks?  This way I've got backup.) 4.  I feel more confident that I won't lose any packages to common thieves, and I actually just feel more secure in general at night knowing how fast the system turns things around...  if anyone was even just creeping around the house I'd know about it almost instantly.  So far I still just have the two cameras, but plan to buy 3 more to place strategically around the house to have an even more complete sense of security and confidence. This has been a purchase that has far exceeded my expectations in features and performance.  So much faster and more reliable than I could have believed possible (I will add here:  we have 'blast' speed internet service bandwidth, I have a Netgear AC5300 Nighthawk X8 router, and a Samsung Galaxy S8+ phone that I run the app through -- so most of this gear is fairly 'up-to-date' and high quality, which may be a factor in performance speeds.)  I highly recommend anyone to give the Arlo Pro system a try (in other words -- don't get too hung up on comments that might be referring back to previous generations/versions of Arlo gear - this Arlo Pro equipment is doing a great job.)
title: Wow! - Extremely happy with this purchase after 3+ weeks of use

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Dawn
content: I still own and use my original Arlo camera but wanted a new one with the rechargeable batteries (my old one only takes standard batteries and goes through them so quick this camera pays for itself in about a year just on battery savings).To my surprise the other great item about this camera is it doesn't record every car that drives by. My old Arlo camera was on my porch.  It would half the time not record a person walking on to my porch but every car that drove by more than 30 feet away it would record. This caused recordings in the mid 50's each day.  This new camera has not recorded any cars driving by and only records people approaching my porch.  I HAVE TURNED ON NOTIFICATIONS AGAIN! Literally I only get 1-2 recordings a day and that is only if I am expecting a package delivery. It is great.  Would highly recommend if you are using an old battery operated Arlo camera to upgrade today!
title: Great Upgrade

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Kc Elliott
content: Love the Pro cameras. Overall very happy with all of it, but I have seen some problems with software. I would love to say it's a wifi problem, but the camera is only one room away from our router/system. Two way audio is great, but the speaker needs to be a little louder. I know no one wants the cameras to be to big, but some improvement would be nice. Also to be able to have more than one person signed into your account at one time. My wife and myself get the alerts, and go to check on it only to find we keep kicking the other one off the system. Would also love to be able to block motion from some areas to keep the alerts down (example, flag). I know they offer a package that will do that for you, but who wants to spend more money on a system that you own (per camera might I add). Only allowed 6 cameras on a free account as well. I use my cameras all over. One for a baby monitor, out door camera over swing set and pool, and have set a system up at my parents house. My Father's health is not the greatest so when no one is home with him for a short time we can check in on him, or get an alert if he is up and moving. Awesome for that, and the system setting only turns after you leave your house (or in this case when my Mother leaves). Great part of the software, and you can share with other systems which is perfect for my use right now. Like a said before very happy with the system, but does have a few minor problems. Glad I bought it, and would buy again and may buy more cameras. Almost forgot to say set up is VERY EASY (did have to do a firmware update right away, BOO), and batteries has been great so far. We have had them up and going for around a month, and most cameras are still in the 80 percentile.
title: Arlo Pro is the way to go...

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Patrick Ryan
content: I’ve had this for about a year and a half. Worked great and had it outside our house and maybe had to charge it 5 times over that whole period.. but now it’s not lasting more than a few weeks and just won’t work or charge now. Tried resetting everything per online troubleshooting. Too expensive for this level of reliability... $50 to roll the dice that a new battery will solve the problem is too much. Have Arlo system with the CR123 batteries too but don’t recommend. Replacement batteries are expensive and don’t last.
title: Just doesn’t last

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Bentfam
content: First impressions: 1) great packaging, but reduce plastic would make it perfect 2) ease of installation.  Close to being plug and play. 3) app functionality is very good 4) should provide fixed, threaded mounts 5) definitely need 1080P for Pro 6) Looovvve the free recording.  It was a deal killer against Nest 7). Keep improvements coming.. After 6 weeks.... We have this camera located in a cabin 165 miles away.  The critical flaw that renders this device totally useless is that fact that either a power glitch or internet interruption causes the Base Station to go "offline".  It is NOT possible to restart Base Station from a remote location.  The "Restart" button in the App only works if the Base Station is "on line".  Tech Support acknowledged that this is a known issue that has been forwarded to Engineering, but no solution timeline or commitment could be made... Very disappointing that a huge company like NetGear, who should be absolutely subject matter experts to Engineer fault tolerant or fault recoverable devices.  It's worthless to me as a security device at this point....
title: Don't buy Arlo unless you want to be it's "baby sitter"

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: S. Johnson
content: I recently purchased a 4 camera system with the base and added on a camera via purchase direct from Amazon. My thoughts after a few weeks of use. Set-up starts by powering the base and directly connecting into your internet  router via ethernet cable.  Following that, set-up is a breeze and involves pairing the cameras to the base individually. Only takes a minutes or so per camera for the pairing and recognition. The cameras have been installed for a few weeks and the batteries have barely inched off full charge. I really liked the mounting options (via magnetic base) or via a more traditional screw fitting for an add on mount that can be purchased separately.  Once everything was linked and mounted, on-line access and operation was a breeze via the Arlo app. Several thoughts on camera set-up. 1)  The motion detection field of view works over a relatively short distance.  You need to really determine exactly what area you want to observe.  For areas where you expect the camera to be triggered and the subject to remain in a location (i.e. the front door) these work great.  if you aim it at a walkway then you have to ensure the total time to cross exceeds 3-4 seconds, otherwise the camera triggers and you only catch the back of the individual.. 2) The resolution on the camera is great for overall field of view but is not clear enough to pick up a license plate number for a car parked in the driveway (unless really really close to the camera) or provide a good picture of a person passing through the field of view. If you are checking to see if someone in your family arrived home or the dog sitter came by then these are great and hardly ever suffer from false notifications. As for overall improvement: The delay on the motion recognition (widely discussed in the various reviews is a challenge) and needs to be factored in to camera placement.  In my experience the camera takes 2-3 seconds to kick into capture mode.  I resolved this by leveraging a trigger camera and the "Mode" logic that allows you to leverage motion in one area to trigger another camera. All in all it fits the bill for my needs but you'll need to appreciate the cameras for what they are. A well designed, completely wireless system for capturing event based recordings.  If they had 1080P resolution and were able to speed up the lag to start the capture sooner these would easily be 5 stars across the board.
title: Very Impressed but can't wait to see the next generation

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Gary McDowall
content: Purchased camera's in 2018. Product support none existent to terrible.  Weekly problems usually caused by the company's system. Support is terrible to none existent. Techs are polite but cannot resolve most problems, which are not due to camera but companies technological blunders. Hours wasted on phone, chat, and setting resetting cameras and base station when problem is on company end. Check out their community support pages. Latest app upgrade caused cellphones to be unable to see videos/use cameras.Several days into problem, no fix no info from company. Don't purchase. Get a different system.
title: BUYER BEWARE!

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Nathan L. Anderson
content: Overall, the system is great. You have 7 days free storage but have the option to add an external hard drive to the base station that will allow you to have additional storage. The quality of the picture/video is pretty good. You can even zoom in. The app is good but could use some more work. There’s been a couple of times that I have been alerted to movement but when I open the app, it doesn’t load the video or allow me to “live stream” the camera. This has happened a couple of times so far. Luckily, it wasn’t a criminal. The different arming modes fit all life styles. I use the geofencing which goes off your phone. If you leave the radias of the home, the system will automatically arm and disarm when you return. The different variations in arming is pretty impressive. Overall, really happy with my choice. It’s also home compatible and can not get hacked, unlike some other systems out there.
title: Overall a great system

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Reggie Dye
content: Happy to say that the problem described below has been solved and I'm back to a 5 star. Have Arlo Pro wireless system with two cameras. System is at a vacation home where I monitor via the app. Cameras are outside and mounted under patio/porch coverings. I was very excited about them at first but have become very disappointed given a rapidly declining camera battery life that renders the system useless. First four months, battery life was fine, even with several motions triggering 10 sec filming. Recharged after four months even though not quite drained and both cameras were at about same level...20% or so left. Then batteries on both lasted about two months before getting to 14%.. It was about 80 degrees during the day and less activity. Then I charged again during July 4 weekend. About a month later, both batteries are on 0%! No motions triggered at all during this time. Batteries consistently seem to drain at about the same rate each time. Power is on. Wi-fi signal is strong. Cameras have not gotten any farther from the base station. and aren’t that far since place isn’t that big. I can’t keep making the 2.5 hour drive to charge cameras.  Battery life appears to be dwindling more and more. Headed back on Labor Day weekend to try again.  I left my cameras fully charged on Sept 3rd. Now it's Sept 15 and one camera is at 57% and the other 56%. Each has only been triggered once, by a bird and a fly. Have reached out multiple times to Arlo/Netgear for help.  No solution. I also see in the Arlo Community that others have had a similar problem.  I now have a system that I paid a pretty good amount of money for that helps me sometimes. Too bad and watch out.
title: Started Strong, then Declined...But now back

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: ALCO S6
content: I thought the Pro would be better than expected. The ten second record time with no pre-record or post-record is kind of limiting. The range is also limited to way less than 60 feet. The system does not stitch together events that happen in the same time span which means portions of the video which would tell the whole story are left out entirely. The answer to this is to buy multiple cameras of course. It is super simple to setup and does most of what I need but it's the few features that as a "Pro" user I've come to expect in lesser systems that makes me not want to give this system at least four stars. That said, one of the best features is the battery life in each camera, which I understand is only attainable due to the shortcomings mentioned above.
title: I thought the Pro would be better than expected

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Steve King
content: Bought a 2-Camera System many months ago. (Sorry, Amazon, on this I got a better deal elsewhere.) Arlo Pro is outstanding, in my opinion. Great Motion Detection, haven't even toughed the sensitivity, and haven't needed to set up 'zones'. Night Vision is good enough for me, with some light where my cameras are. Picture Quality is Great. But the most impressive thing? BATTERY LIFE! My first two camera's batteries lasted over 5 months, and they did not have a 100% Charge when I installed them. So unless you're putting these on a two-story house, you'll be able to take these down, and charge these, no more than three times a year. ALSO, unlike RING, you own the videos. ONE SUGGESTION, buy a better mount, Especially if you're mounting this outside.
title: Added on to Great Camera System

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Nick Musti
content: I've owned these cameras for about 11 months.  I really liked them when I first installed them.  I wished and still do that the image resolution was better.  I also loved that I was getting about 6-8 weeks between battery charges.  With that in mind I added 3 more cameras over the next several months. Fast forward 11 months and I barely like the system, what used to be 6-8 weeks of battery life is now down to 1-2 weeks and this includes a camera that was bought about 4 months ago.  Keep in mind that none of these cameras are in high traffic areas.  I also noticed that I'll get notifications of movement but no recordings, although that doesn't happen too often. I will re-evaluate my rating if I see the batteries are only lasting a few days.  With a cost of approx $50/battery,  replacing 5 batteries within 12-14 months of purchase could mean I look for a new camera system.
title: Not liking the system so much after 11 months

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Andrew
content: We were in need of a camera-based security system that could be used both indoors and outside in rainy PNW weather. The Arlo Pro system looked like it would meet these needs well. The setup was a breeze, and overall experience has been mostly positive. Images are clear, even at night, and the sound element (mic + speaker) are a nice bonus. That said, there are a few quirks: 1. Connection via the app (Android) hasn't been 100% reliable, which can be frustrating for a home security system. 2. It would be nice to have an installation system that was more permanent, especially in instances where the camera is only barely out of reach. 3. Not the biggest fan of the cloud-based storage - it would be nice to be able to bypass this entirely and just use local storage (or my own cloud/server storage). 4. The video delay is, admittedly, incredibly frustrating. The fact that the video isn't in real-time isn't a dealbreaker, but dramatically diminishes the effectiveness of a home security system. I can set up a remotely-access video camera using an old Android phone that broadcasts in real-time, so why can't this $$$ system?
title: Good potential with a few quirks

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Steven Miller
content: Easily set up and they work well. Right now I only have two complaints. They will not charge when the weather is too cold outside. It was about 32 degrees outside and they won't charge when plugged in. The settings will tell you that it's plugged in, but not charging until it warms up. The cameras themselves work in the cold but to recharge them the temperature has to probably be in the upper thirties or in the forties I'm guessing. Just make sure they are charged enough before a long cold streak or you can bring unit in the house and charge it anytime. And number two, I think the speaker volume is too low. Even set at 100 percent, the volume doesn't seem very loud for speaking to someone or the dog outside.  But as far as picking up video and sound, they are satisfactory.
title: Good So Far. Just A Few Negatives.

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: AL
content: Purchased on Dec of 2016 of single unit then added on 2 more cameras. On 2017 April & June, there are 2 cameras has be replaced because defect and under warranty. Till today, all camera functioning perfectly as Netgear promised, but only one thing got the really issue---Battery life. Their battery life span is getting shorter and shorter, even Netgear commercialize implied 6 months, but it never last that long in real life environment. Even now, there are 2 camera batteries after fully charged, it will only last for 1 month without any mode or motion alert adding. The one which put indoor also getting shorter battery span but longer than the others. So I will conclude the battery of Arlo camera is not as Netgear described. The new one will last only 3-4 months will be idea situation. Netgear really have to correct their pitch of selling point!!!!
title: Great Product but battery life going down quickly in normal conditions

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Just Cass
content: Geofencing needs alot of work and has been in Beta for over 2 years. When I leave my home, geofencing doesn't set the camera to away. I actually have to open the arlo app before it will recognize I have left my home. What good is geofencing, if I have to open the app for it to recognize I have left? That is no difference as is almost the same as me manually turning it on. What happens if I leave and I forget to open the app? If I am burglarized, Arlo doesn't accept responsibility correct? So, Beta testing for over 2 yrs and not resolving issues is not good. That is entirely too long to Beta test a product. In addition, when I do return home, Arlo doesn't recognize I am home and stays in the away position. Once again, I have to open the app for it to know I am home and for the camera to change automatically "after opening app" to the home position. I would not recommend this until Geofencing is actually working properly. Everything now says works off geofencing, including alarm systems, thermostats, etc. Arlo is setup to recognize distance by 3 distances and I have it setup on the shortest distance. It should work and I have tried everything.
title: Geofencing needs alot of work and has been in Beta for over 2 years

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: MLBR
content: Purchased 2 cameras with base  then 2 add on cameras.  Very nice overall.  I like the fact that there are no monthly recurring charges. I use a USB drive with the base to store videos locally (if needed beyond 1 week).  Night vision is so so. Update after 9 months of use: After 6 months of use, the batteries started to run out of charge every 4 weeks or so.  This became a major issue since the cameras has to come down, get charged for hours and then re-mounted & adjusted for accuracy every time.  Not fun.  I tried to email customer support but it was difficult to do so. After 4 calls to customer support they acknowledged that the base is defective.  Making a long story short, they agreed to replace the unit after sending them a proof of purchase. I had to pay $16.50 to get a replacement (for their defective unit).  Hoping this is the end of the issue. Bottom line: While the product is good, the need for charging, remounting & adjusting for accuracy gets to be annoying.  I'm considering a wired Ring so I don't have to worry about charging.  I don't like to pay Ring's monthly fee, but that's the trade-off.
title: Great System

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: scrivener
content: I installed a two-camera Arlo Pro security system in the condo where my daughter lives after an incident where a brother/sister team attempted to break into occupied units to steal prescription medicines. I chose the Arlo Pro because it saves a sliding 7 days of videos to an internet library free of charge, and because the wireless cameras are easier to install than camera systems requiring an outdoor source of power. The Arlo Pro application, installed both on her iPhone and my iPhone, provides alerts whenever motion is detected. After five days of use I have seen reliable detection of human motion, and only one false detection (at least I could not tell what triggered the alert from the recorded video). The intruder's image is recorded long before he/she can get to the camera to destroy or disable it. Because "wireless" cameras contain batteries that need to be recharged, I installed Solar Panel chargers by Wasserstein https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B074KFZYJJ/ref=oh_aui_detailpage_o03_s01?ie=UTF8&psc=1 to charge the cameras daily. So far, through a heavy rainstorm day, two cloudy days, and two days of morning clouds giving way to sunny autumn afternoons, the solar panels have recharged the camera batteries to 100% by day, going down to about 90% overnight. Very pleased with this setup.
title: Netgear Arlo Pro cameras enhance our security

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Dusty Harris
content: I've been searching for home surveillance systems over the last six months and have struggled between several different brands. Netgear's Arlo Pros are almost perfect. I love the fact that I'm not bound by wires and they are weather proof.. I love the fact that I can set IFTTT programming for individual cameras. The resolution is incredible and mobile app fairly easy to navigate. The only gripe I have is that the two way volume (specifically being able to talk through a mobile device or computer) is terrible. I can hear what's going on at my home perfectly but have great difficulty communicating back. If Netgear could duplicate that of the Nestcam, I would. be thrilled.
title: Almost perfect

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Mathew Howard
content: I wish I could say this is your last stop in searching for a home security camera, but its not. When it works, its great. But that is just it, it doesn't always work right. I'm not sure what factors play into this, as my front driveway camera worked great for several months, but then stopped works well after I recharged the battery. The wireless connectivity seems fine, even with the farthest camera to the base unit. The battery life is very acceptable for a wireless camera with no power cords. The night vision is clear in most cases. The app is fairly simple and functional. The motion sensing is lacking. It might be a great idea if they would offer motion sensors units, similar but smaller than the camera, to add to the trigger list. The web interface still uses Flash Player, which is notoriously insecure and soon will be abandoned from all updates.
title: Mixed feelings right now...

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Technical Artist
content: I'm an early user, so factor that into my rating.  But initially, I give this system 5 stars for ease of setup, and general deploy-ready configuration.  A few things could have been made a more integrated part of the setup process, such as turning off email alerts when you have the mobile app installed, or guidance on infrared settings when setting up a camera indoors pointing out through a window (doesn't work so well, which is understandable, but not explained). Overall I like this system a lot.  Battery life appears to track with predictions others have made so far.  Well done Netgear.  Well done. Note: Still a nice system, but I lowered my rating to 4 stars for two reasons:  1) Mounted inside looking out through a window may not work if you have modern thermal-resistant windows.  Motion detection is based on a heat signature only (no motion detect option), so these cameras won't work in that situation.  2) Outdoor magnet mounts are strong, but not secure enough should a bird decide your camera makes a nice stopping point.  Having to reset the camera position due to small environmental factors can be frustrating, especially if your camera is mounted high and requires ladder climbing to reposition.
title: Overall I like this system a lot

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: WW
content: So I installed this Arlo system and the camera can never stay connected when the power cable is removed. It might be good for some hours but eventually it will fail. I tried fixing it through all of the steps outlined on their website because good luck getting a hold of a human. Still fails. I ended up buying a different camera which does work a little better regarding it staying connected. It's not an issue with the wireless reception either as that is fine. The video compression can be bad and the motion sensor seems like it should pick up things that it sometimes misses. I tried getting a hold of their support via email to try and resolve the problem by getting a refund or a replacement for the camera. I was ignored. The extra camera I bought does work better regarding connection but I should not have had to buy an extra camera. Do not buy. To Arlo: I have seen you respond to some bad reviews to try and resolve the issue. Don't bother here. You are getting the rating you deserve. :)
title: Pay Attention to the Negative Reviews

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Andrew J. Pace
content: I researched many of the top inexpensive security systems.. Many good ones.. But, I picked Arlo because it was on wifi, battery operated, easy to move if needed, could see any and all activity on my cell phone, i could turn on a piercing siren in the house with the touch of a button on my cell phone, and I can talk through and hear on the camera. And, I get an alert on my cell phone if motion is triggered, like when I am not home.. In the event of a break in, I can easily call the police. The resolution is not great, but they make a better camera if you wish to buy that one.. And, it's infarred, can see in the dark. And, you can add 4 cameras or more I think. So easy to sink.. It needs only 1 camera and a central station, 2 devices total. about 250 total or so.. each camera to add is another 100 but wow what a deal. Anyways, it is doiing exactly what I wanted.. wished I would have done this before now. And, you can see the image "real time" if you want.. so much more.. Merry Christmas!
title: excellent camera for home

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Scott Turner
content: SECOND UPDATE: Well, even though I've been unsatisfied with Arlo I also chose their products to protect my new house given that I already have an investment in the system. I ordered a new base station with a single camera for my new house with the plan to bring over the rest of the cameras once my old house sells. After using the new camera for a couple of weeks it stopped charging. I chatted with Arlo support and their best offer was to send me a new charger even though it was unclear if the issue was the charger, the cable, or the camera. I only have one camera/charger at this location and my request was that they replace them all to get me back up and running. Arlo support refused and said the best they could do was send me a charger and see if that worked, basically troubleshooting via USPS/Fedex/UPS. I'm sad to say that I'm forced to look at alternatives at this point. FIRST UPDATE: The Arlo system software has degraded to the point where it simply cannot be trusted as a 'security' system. Arlo/Netgear could fix it in an instant with rigorous software testing and updates, but they do not, and things are spinning out of control now that Netgear is spinning off Arlo. I'm an IT guy, and the mess they have made of their software breaks my heart, because the hardware is *great*.  My advice is to look elsewhere, and maybe check back on Arlo in a couple of years to see if they've managed to fix their basic functionality. I'm sure some exec somewhere is getting their bonus because they launched a doorbell, meanwhile people like me who have invested thousands in their existing products sit around trying to figure out why our systems are spontaneously disarming and our schedules are being deleted, and they've never gotten geofencing to work reliably. Just check the support boards for a litany of issues. ORIGINAL REVIEW: I'm a safety/security guy in that I focus on minimizing risk for myself and family, while still being flexible enough to live life - a balancing act, if you will. I have previously resisted getting security camera systems because of the 'Big Brother' aspects of it, however we recently took an extended road-trip vacation, and I wanted to be able to monitor things on the home front. After doing extensive research, I opted for this wireless, rechargeable system, and man, am I glad that I did. I got the five-camera system, thinking it was overkill, but even my wife remarked that "we could sure use some more cameras" after spending some time using it. Pros and cons as follow: Pros: Cordless and wireless: the cameras run on batteries and wifi and can be placed virtually anywhere that can be reached by the wifi signal Long battery life: so far we're going months between battery recharges, and highly recommend getting a spare battery and charger so you always have one ready to go without dismounting cameras Day/night vision: the cameras automatically switch between day and night vision as appropriate Motion detection: the motion detection feature means video is only recorded when there is detected motion Live view option: you can use the app or web to view/record any/all cameras live any time you want Audio: audio is also recorded, and two-way audio is available via the app/web App system: the application has a lot of options and is easy to navigate and use Vibrant ecosystem: there are a *lot* of OEM and third-party add-ons and accessories Cons: Video quality: the video quality does not quite seem fully HD, although it's still good Recording start delay: when motion is detected there is a few seconds of delay before recording starts, which can miss fast-moving action Sound volume: using the two-way audio to talk through the device results in a pretty quiet audio stream from the camera's speaker, even at the highest volume levels Arlo Smart is extra: NetGear has developed 'Arlo Smart' which attempts to recognize objects (people, cars, pets, etc) and allow you to use the object designations to refine the system logic - this is great, but should be included, not a monthly, per-camera fee, which is ridiculous That last one is the only negative that's giving me pause, because it indicates that NetGear is looking for create a monthly monetized stream for the system by withholding functionality for ransom (my interpretation). Given that these are *security* systems, anything that increases security should be included, particularly if it is software/firmware based. This price-gouging (my opinion) is what caused me to take off one star. Other than that, this is a good system. I hope NetGear comes to their senses on Arlo Smart.
title: Second Update: *REALLY* AVOID ARLO! Original: Not sure how I lived without this system...

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: JAKE
content: Great Concept for a wireless camera. BUT here are the following issues especially if you plan to use outdoors: 1. Once temperatures reach freezing the camera will not work since the battery will go dead due to temperature. Even if you buy the outdoor charging cable, the camera may not fully work during the winter. At least it may be tempramental. 2. Even during mild to warm weather, over time you will need to charge battery more frequently even after few months of use. 3. Recording of events will not occur until at least 5 seconds after motion is detected. This can result in missing the crux of the recorded event. In other words it may not record a crime, trespass, or the dog owner you're trying to catch who's destroying your lawn. I would only recommend for indoor use. Good luck.
title: Great Concept for a wireless camera

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Tiffany
content: We've been using ARLO for about a week now and have been mostly satisfied. This is a great system for anyone who needs the wireless option, ability to easily transport to a new location, and ease of access in connection with your smartphone. We still have a couple tweaks to make to our camera in order for it to function the best it can for the place we put it. Currently, we notice that the motion detection isn't working as well for the top half of the screen. If our rotation of the camera does in fact improve this issue, we will certainly be purchasing 3 or 4 more to cover the entire outside perimeter. It's great to have easy and quick access to visibly see our front door no matter where we are.
title: Great Wireless Camera Option

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Stephen S.
content: SO, I read about problems with the system but I have people locally who have had good luck.  Bought the system (and warranty thank God) and it arrived yesterday.  Right off the bat, the base station will not connect to the internet.  No status light at all regarding internet connection. Disconnected, reconnected.  Followed all directions.  Used the provided ethernet, provided my own, no luck. Restarted my router, no luck.  Contacted Customer Support (India) and was told they don't know what is going on and cannot help me. For those who have it, and can get it to connect seems to be a good option.  For those who cannot get it to connect (like me) it is a boat anchor. I'm from Missouri, and we use Spectrum (formerly Charter) for our internet provider.  When I told the CS rep my download/upload speed she asked me twice; she said it was unbelievable compared to their speed.
title: Base Station Wont Connect to Router

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Justin Bland
content: I bought this for my apartment. I was shocked how easy it was to set up! It is 100% wireless, which is what I need. The picture, is HD. The night vision and motion detection work extremely well. The battery for the camera lasts a very long time. I bought my system a month ago and the battery is still at 70% on it's first charge! The receiving sound quality is great. The sound to talk through the camera is not as great. I love the geofencing mode, where it automatically arms when I leave the home. The siren on the base unit is extremely loud! It will definitely get your neighbor's attention and hopefully scare away the burglars. I will definitely expand on my Arlo system. Hopefully, Arlo will develop a video doorbell compatible with this base unit.
title: A great foundation for a wireless system

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Dorene
content: The camera picture is usually OK. The company has a new website and app, as well as a "software update".  It now lags, skips, and has a recording delay.  It no longer displays colors properly, especially in very bright light, or low light. The site and app are so slow loading that it takes almost 5 minutes to connect using a 200+ meg connection. The batteries do not last as long as advertised. It does not come with a mount that is suitable for outdoor use, especially if you get strong wind. The company makes one for outdoors to be purchased separately, and it is poor quality. It got seized inside the camera making it impossible to charge the camera. Customer Support is nonexistent. You cannot get in touch with anyone through any means. I have been trying for months!
title: Camera is fine, new software is Terrible, NO Customer support!

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Eugene
content: The Arlo Pro it comes at the same price as a later model (Pro 2) and is missing critical feature support. When I purchased this product, I expected to have the option to subscribe to a plan which enables CVR (24/7 recording), which Arlo listed as a service that is supported by their cameras. Once I decided to upgrade to the plan, outside of the return period, I was informed that the Alro Pro cameras do not support CVR, only Arlo Pro 2. The Arlo Pro and Pro 2 listings were not distinctly labeled on having or lacking CVR support, and are listed with the roughly the same price on Amazon (~$10 difference). This is highly misleading as a consumer can easily buy an outdated version of a security camera that has no capability of constantly recording video, leaving significant gaps in the purpose it serves as a security camera in the first place.
title: Do not buy this product

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Zed
content: I loved the cameras.  I bought this to accompany my other two cameras. Then one stopped working, and I'm trying to deal with their support.  OH MY GOD. It's a friggin' nightmare.  HOURS on hold. Hour on a chat, with 5-10 minutes between responses when you finally get connected. After waiting an hour on hold, I was told I'd been sent to the wrong group, and it was going to be another hour, so someone would call me back. Nothing but crickets for days since... It's absolutely miserable. And now it looks like the second camera may be having the same issue. This is a nightmare.  Worst support experience I've ever had.
title: Cameras are cool, support is terrible.

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Tom C
content: The hardest part of the setup was drilling into concrete for an exterior mounting. Took off 1 star because I had to buy outdoor mount separately and because there doesn’t seem to be a way to turn off email alerts as well as iOS notifications (I don’t need to be told twice). Otherwise it’s a good camera/WiFi security system. One other complaint that several people have made (that I agree with) is that there’s a 10 second delay on video motion capture- for example if someone walks by your house on the sidewalk you’ll get an alert, then when you watch the recording it doesn’t show the person because they’ve already walked by. But it’s in front of my garage and I figure if someone messes with my cars they’ll probably be longer than 10 sec so it’s not a problem yet.
title: Easy to set up and use

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Heather McKechnie
content: We love the Arlo! It's been great to be able to utilize a wireless camera and move it when necessary. Depending on your sensitivity settings, you can get at least two months worth of battery life. They provide you with a multi-fast charger which is compatible with our phones, notifications stickers and a very long charging cable. This does not come with an outside mounting bracket, just an interior mount. We purchased this for use in our backyard to overlook our pool. We love that we can initiate/record videos from our phones, but wish that it would record more than 2 minutes worth of content when auto-triggered by motion. Another great feature is the ability to communicate with people over the camera. We communicate with our pool representative every week after we receive notification of their presence from the camera. Other benefits include email warnings when the battery is getting low, and the ability to add USB sticks to copy the content locally, while it is being backed up to the cloud for a week. In case your Internet goes down, the Arlo still communicates with it's base station and records locally. You can also remotely trigger an alarm if necessary. A great investment!
title: Great Investment!

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Mindy Nielson
content: I have 4-5 Arlo cameras and 2 base stations. I really like how these work. The picture quality is good and the motion detection works pretty well, albeit on a 1-2 second delay. These are easy to set up and mount where you want them. The battery life is nice too, as in battery saver and not "armed" 24/7, then they easily last a month or longer before requiring charging. I have a couple where I use them in a garage and then I can plug them in directly not draining battery. I can't really comment on the level or video or audio quality, as that's not my main purpose, but they do work really well to alert me of potential dangers to my property, which I appreciate. They were highly rated and I am very satisfied with my purchase.
title: Love my Arlos

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: AMBIE
content: Up front news: PRO2 system is out with 1080p wireless. Awesome. ArloPro system: I like the camera and system functions, such as wifi, remote alerts and viewing, and cloud memory, all without running cables. I hope the next level of camera will improve the HD pixel count for improved clarity and night time vision. Arlo also needs to reduce the price of its swivel mount; $20 each is stretching one's logic to purchase. Otherwise, I am satisfied with the system operations and have not found a better wifi (cableless) security camera system on the market. Yes, I have checked extensively. I bought a two camera security system (Model VMS4230-100) from Best Buy, as one would not save money purchasing online (still had to pay $25 state tax). I did purchase through Amazon two iABLER metal swivel mounts, which I will provide reviews when received and installed. I have read good and bad reviews on these particular mounts, but the plastic mounts have garnered many negative feedbacks, so I avoided the plastic units. Overall, I am pleased with the operations of the Arlo security camera system.
title: GOOD SECURITY CAMERA SYSTEM

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Burm
content: I bought the Arlo Pro to replace the Wansview 1080P ProHD camera. It was very inexpensive but had many disadvantages. The major annoying disadvantage: the "motion detection" trigger is triggered by changes in the ambient light, and not movement.  I got 150 email alerts a day as the sun rose and set. This might be fine for a "baby cam"  but certainly not for my small business.  It does have remote pan feature in x and y axis, that's very useful for remote viewing.  The software is HORRIBLE. Conversely I'm very, very happy with the Arlo Pro. The software is intuitive, well designed and very easy to install and pair the base station with the cameras. It took just a few minutes. The totally wireless cameras are exactly what I've been looking for.  Haven't had to recharge them yet but that's one of the main reasons I switched to Arlo.  I can place the cameras anywhere without having to be in proximity to an outlet, including outside.So far so good, I'm very happy with them (I have two cameras). One complaint.....I feel the range for motion detection is too short.  For my purposes, it's not an issue but it would be nice if the cameras could be placed a bit farther apart for wider coverage. I'd buy them again and recommend them highly
title: Very Happy With Arlo Pro

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Bob C
content: Having had a close circuit security system for nearly ten years dealing with wires, crimping connections, crawling under the house and into the attic, standing on tall ladders and hollering at my wife to ask her if the image is capturing the right area Arlo is a breath of fresh air!  The Arlo engineers have addressed nearly everything I could think of.  My home WIIFI suffers the same limitations as Arlo though.  Distance.  I want outside cameras facing the back of the house but that is a bridge too far for Arlo.  Most of my cameras are within 30 feet of the base station.  Venture beyond that and they drop offline.  Arlo will compliment but not replace my CCTV system for now.  Thanks Arlo for making my life so much easier.
title: Life is so much easier with Arlo

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Cristina C.
content: At first it worked GREAT and even helped police on a car break in case but now a little over a year and the out door camera started to white out. I have reset it multiple time which work for about 2 weeks then starts doing it again. Also noticed it stopped recording after midnight at different times (no schedule set and not consistent) sometimes record all the way through other times not no day specific just random.  Started with a high and ended up with the police knocking on my door to ask if I caught anything and had to tell them sorry camera is just for show now. Wont even charge now. Absolutely disappointing
title: BEFORE YOU BUY!!!!!
