I saw my neighbor walking off with 2 of the 3 packages. I called 911 from my work to report it. My husband received another notification less than 10 minutes after the first one that the girlfriend was taking the 3rd package and another empty Amazon box that was on the porch. After telling the 911 operator of the second robbery and telling her that we would be home in 10-15 minutes, we set off to meet the police. The police showed up a few minutes later and we were able to notify them through the camera that we would be home in about 5 minutes so they didn't leave. As we drove up, the cops were saying that they were interested in getting a camera like that. I think that by itself is a good thing. The cops watched the videos, knew who the thieves were, and went off to find them. Less than hour after the first notification, we had all the items back in our possession. Considering some add-on cameras so that we can get full view around the house. But overall 10 stars and highly recommended product.
title: the cops were saying that they were interested in getting a camera like that. I think that by itself is a ...

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: irie
content: Too much money for security aggravations i.e.on memorial day there was a global blackout (you can google this and see), leaving many of us without the security protection most of the day that we paid for. Also defective batteries on arrival that was resolved but inconvenient. Problems with cables ordered from Amazon (that were stated to be compatible) that initially worked for a few months and now error messages that have shut it down and has to be replaced. product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Matthew Sharp
content: These are great until something goes wrong.  For example, the Arlo Pro cam I have had maybe 5 months.... the internal battery is already dead.  The replacement battery is $50. I didn't find anything from the manufacturer about this happening when trying to sync the camera, so I was forced to the Q&A of other people with problems, to guess my way through it. The software interface is sophomoric in that they advertise what a great deal the setup is; however, the interface begs you to upgrade so it is fully functional. Not having full functionality requires that you jump through extra hoops to do varying tasks such as deleting several videos in a group which becomes cumbersome if you have several cams in high traffic areas... this is suppose to push you to investing more on a monthly fee to have access to a long term video storage and little functions such as mass deleting videos.

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: doogalbeez
content: The Arlo Pro is really great for a quick and easy installation to monitor your house or small business. The video isn't the highest of quality, it's HD but not 4K, which is pretty good for a home surveillance, it's definitely better quality as the cheaper wifi cameras. I even bought a second camera and was able to add it to the base in under 10 minutes. I also bought the outdoor mount, which is "good enough" to use with the camera but can be a pain to get the camera back on the threaded mount. Find it here NETGEAR Arlo Outdoor Security Mount The configuration settings are ok, easy enough to follow along and set things to what you want, the only downsides are that it doesn't prompt when you make changes, so if you forget to hit Save, you'll have to redo it. A bit frustrating for me at least. Right now I have a schedule running to set the camera to a lower detection rate during the day, and then at night to bump up the detection settings and the recording length as well. I also have it set to be deactivated when my kids usually are playing out in the front yard. Arlo Smart has introduced a month ago, its free for 30 days on one camera. I set it on the front door and bumped the detection level to see how it works.It works fairly well for what it does. I've noticed that it does think shapes are people, which it will alert you if there might be a movement that it just doesn't understand what it is. This leads me to the negative bits. The battery, the one concerns I think most have. IF you have it record on movement in places that are not going to have your kids playing, then the battery will last a whole lot longer than it would by having your kids play outside and you be alerted as it records every time (1-2 minutes based on how you set it up) sections. I had to recharge the camera a couple times due to this. After the configuration for the schedules, the battery lasts a lot longer. If it had "fences" or "grids" to set how the camera starts recording, then that would also be very helpful. I would like to click a fence on the viewport of the camera on my phone or the web view, of where to record and where not to. An example would be to point the camera at your mailbox from the house, but click a fence or grid around the mailbox and not the street. So if there's movement next to it, the camera will record, if there is a car driving by, and it's not in the detection fence/grid then the camera won't record. Something to wish for I guess. The app is kinda slow and clunky. When I am trying to turn off the mode when my kids are playing, it takes it time to talk to the base station on the same network. If they allowed for local storage, rather than their cloud service, I would think more would buy in. Some rural locations don't have the network available to sync the footage. Overall, I keep telling people to get one.
title: Excellent camera system.

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: M
content: I have had the Arlo Pro for 2 months. Pros-they work really well. Video quality is excellent and I just recharged them for the first time and they were only down to 40%, so battery life is better than I expected. The live feature and sound is exceptional. Even speaking to people works really well. The only Con, the motion sensitivity. I would like to be able to zone them but you cannot. I had to adjust my cameras field of view from the road so it didn’t go off every couple minutes from cars. Other than that, it does go off every time someone or something goes across my yard, sidewalk or driveway. I’d like a zone though so when it does record when someone is on my property it records a larger area, where maybe a car would be. If that makes sense. Update Battery life after 7 months is awesome. I’ve only charged these twice now since I received them. I changed the location and even without zones, I messed with the motion sensitivity and they work exactly how I wanted them to. They even pick up when a raccoon or something walks thru my yard. Changed from 4 to 5 stars
title: They work!

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: none of your business
content: have to deduct major point s for false or misleading advertising among other things. I you have done your home work as i did you may have concluded these systems have come a long way in a few years and this one seems particularly good. In many ways thats correct. Problem is its not quite true.So being told that the battery would last 4-6 months but not reading anything about the camera having three quality settings until I was setting it up I was surprised and felt a little trepidation choosing of course the highest quality setting. the arlo is not the very highest quality camera available i reasoned and how much difference could the setting make to battery life. The very next day I was having to dig out the ladder to get to the battery and change it, although i had charged them before installing them aand they claim to be pre charged i decided to use a different camera and battery, this time i chose the middle quality video setting, well its less than a week and it just notified me its dying again.So now i am wondering how long the lowest quality will last two weeks?so I know whats going on i live in a city and it uploads about five seconds of videa when ever its triggered which can be every few minutes to every twenty or thirty minutes. Well im sorry most people live in cities so if your product only last six months  staring at a suburban drivway but is useless in cities and the country  then you need to be plain about that not brag about six months battery life have some other problems with the product they are inexplicably proud to not supply a manual and expect you to read on the internet, then you find on the net only the barest details and links to their fan club. basically they expect you to read through a labyrinth of user comments about their journey of discovery its retarded you know its a pretty good product but there is a lot of retarded presentation. If you have read about the two way talk and alarm and thought oh i can use this as a video intercom think again. Its really  frustrating when you realize this wont work and they dont sell a doorbellcam to integrate into the sytem and you will have to go to another brand or hope and wait for them to wise up. Heres why it wont work as a video doorbell.which include several of the bugs that make it less than it first seems and again most of this is not spelled out in the promo descriptions. the alarm is super loud and will be triggered anytime the camera detects motion and or sound.(in most situations see above} that will be a lot of false alarms.the camera  and alarm have a huge lag, all signals must go through netgears server you cant bypass it even in live view which is really unnecessarily annoying and should be fixed as an option for live veiw and as a local network,but it also inexplicably  just takes a while to start recording at all,you often only catch the tail end of someone walking past the camera.when you see features actual video doorbells have you realize this isnt a substitute the camera is too far away from the door and the person at the door will be in side view and of course theres no door bell feature that say rings your phone as i said if theres any chance of the camera being triggered by passers by you wont use the alarm, and i set up text alerts at first then got one every few minutes and turned them off. when you look at doorbell features you realize the difference and you really want arlo to make one to add to the same system. You can hardwire the cameras that will pick up a lot of movement and hopefully the other cameras really last that long when seldom triggered.and wait assuming arlo will figure out it has to  make a doorbell and fix the lag issues. or you can return it all and wait another year or two for someone to get it right im debating i like some features but it was a lot to buy so many cameras and have the most important one really not do their job as advertized.

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Jamie Cope
content: The cameras are performing veRy well. Battery life is very good - so far. They have been up and running for a few months and the units show fully charged (on initial charge - I have not recharged the units yet since their initial charge after purchase) . I rarely set the cameras to motion mode. I typically log into the system a few times a week and don't continuous run them. The motion sensing functionality is excellent. Very cool to know when anyone comes by especially when traveling. The audio quality is just good too especially given they are wireless. The two way communication is challenging given the delay. There is a good 3 to 5 second delay in video on my network. Not certain if it's an issue to my local network or not, but the delay can be an issue in communicating with someone from my iPhone or computer to the person on camera. The process is a bit - awkward. I start my conversations with - please wait 3 seconds before beginning to respond/speak due to the lag.  It's not that big of a deal given my use case, but may be an issue for others if seamless two way communication is expected to be like a phone conversation.  The two way communication is more like a walkie talkie with a delay. The limitations in two way audio is easily overlooked given the units are wireless, compact, efficient, color, night vision, motion and audio trigger/sensor, easy to create program modes for different scenarios (like motion sensors on exterior cameras at night, but leave interior camera motion sensors off). Audio is very sensitive. You can create workflows to record based on sensing sound as well as sensing motion. I have a mix of older Arlo wireless (w/o sound) and they operate together w/o issue. All in all I am very satisfied with this system. I have 5 cameras as of this writing and will be adding a couple more units soon.
title: Battery life is very good - so far

author: MR M W JENKINS
content: App v2.6.0 (releases October 2018) has made this system far less useful and far harder to rely on as a security product. Far harder now to review battery, connection and movement information across multiple cameras now meaning it’s harder to monitor your system, ensure your batteries are charged etc. The button to talk through the microphone now gives much less visual information that you are connected - important, as these work like a two way radio and you need to know a connection has been made before you can start talking. product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Gordon
content: The equipment is unreliable.  I tried an Arlo system first (non-pro) and ended up having to return three of the five cameras under warranty because they did not work properly.  When the fourth camera quit I returned the entire system and tried the Arlo Pro.  I haven't had much better luck with it.  Two of the cameras frequently only record in black and white.  One camera is hit and miss whether it picks up motion five feet in front of it.  I have had to reboot the system, disconnect and reconnect the cameras, etc. to get them to work properly.  If it was reliable, it would be a great system, but the equipment is not reliable.  Also, Amazon says you can record from six cameras for free.  That is not the case.  You can only connect five for free.  You have to pay for a subscription if you want to connect more than five at a time.  The system is not worth the headaches.  It worked great for the first couple of months, then one problem after another. - Update - five months in and one camera is dead and a battery in another is dead.  I have been online with Arlo support for 90 minutes.  They want you to do all kinds of trouble shooting, some of which is utterly useless, before they will do anything.  It is under warranty and I am still fighting with them to replace the defective camera and battery.  DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT.
title: I haven't had much better luck with it

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Kermitt
content: I wanted something on my front porch to let my kids see outside without opening the door and to prevent theft of packages Originally I opted for the RingPro doorbell with its low profile.  However, due to my existing wiring, I could not get it to work.  Sent the Ring back and bought the Arlo Pro and an Arlo Wall mount.  My biggest hesitation was that the battery would drain quickly and and the Wifi would not pick up very well.  I was wrong both accounts.  I installed this camera on December 20th and I still have 61% of the battery left.  The video and audio is crisp although you do get a little bit of a delay.  Probably 1-1.5 seconds.  Not a big deal for my purposes.  The best part is that it saves all recordings for a week for free.  Unlike the Ring where you have to pay $4 per month to videos.  I installed the Ring on my mom's house and she has been happy with it, but if I was doing it again, I would go with this camera.
title: Exceeded all expectations.  Opt for this product over the Ring Doorbell

content: We have had this system now for over a year and it has performed very well. We liked it so much that we recently bought a second generation system for our city apartment. There is much to like about them. The batteries last very long if you don't keep checking in.  The newest version  has a rechargeable battery,  wider lens and the ability to converse and listen through the camera. The latest  one also has an alarm, which is an improvement. We like this for security purposes and  it doesn't frighten  us with false alarms as too many security systems do. It's very easy to install and get running. We only wish that the cameras could be wired for power but Arlo does now offer a battery charger for the unique and expensive batteries. The only other fault is that there is a delay in what you see and hear on your computer, which is not a big deal. The newest version also allows two way conversation with the camera. You can place the cameras anywhere. We haven't used them outside so I can't give you an opinion except that the batteries won't last as long in cold weather.

author: Just Another Reviewer
content: Pros: Easy to install, good pictures, love the instant recorded video, easy to charge. product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)

content: Motion Detection is not good and seems to be getting worst. I've even noticed angles that used to capture motion no longer capturing motion without the cameras having been moved. product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Liam
content: Okay, first: Don't go with those "Security Monitoring" programs. Problem is this; you have a break in, alarm goes off, they try to yell at perp but perp runs away and they're yelling at Fido, and perp runs next door and steals from them because cops show up, don't have witness or description of perp. This alarms you ANYWHERE you are thru your phone! You SEE perp (even before perp gets in because you were smart enough to place over front/back door), you scare crap out of perp, perp runs, you call 911, you email/text pic of perp from wherever you are, "happy jail-time perp!" Second: Extremely reliable product. You can discriminate between Fido and a person. You can even set a "zone" area within frame for alerts in areas where you know you can get immediate alert captures. Third: Free cloud storage! Up to a certain number of days, but I pay for the extras at an immensely low cost compared to those "Security Monitoring" guys. Fourth: If you want to protect your home and family, it's really not that expensive if you think about it. AND no annoying chords everywhere. Just some batteries. Fifth: No, Fido! Don't eat that! (While I was at Disney and he was at home. Worked. But the looks I got though. LOL) **Just think of the value for a small business owner that doesn't want to pay THOUSANDS of dollars per year because you're a business and not residential.
title: Best security investment I've ever made for my home. And I talk to my dogs too!

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: StevieG
content: A great system for our home. I toyed with getting the Pro2 but it the cost difference vs the added features just didn't seem worth the price. The 720P seems to be just fine for viewing the zones that I would like monitored.  The night vision mode does work very well and provides clear video in that low light. Glad to have received the tip on not trying to mount near a window in night vision mode. There is major reflective light that comes off the camera and white's-out the picture. If you need to mount the camera quite a distance from the monitoring area, you might want to consider using the Pro2 with its 1080P resolution. Otherwise, the Arlo Pro will work just fine and save you some acquisition dollars too.
title: Secure and Safe

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Mach
content: Love our Arlo Pro system. Haven’t had any issue with ours for over a year now. We’ve been impressed with the battery life. They’ll easily last a month with minimal activity, on the flip side it’ll last only a couple weeks in an area with a lot of activity. The app makes controlling the system easy and it’s convenient to operate our home security from our phones.
title: Great system for do it yourselfers

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Jim Rea
content: My first Pro 2 lasted just outside the 1 year warranty when the battery stopped charging. I bought another battery and it still wouldn't charge. Support, at that time you could get someone on the phone without paying for it, said it was so close to the warranty date that they would send it on to the warranty department to replace it. They never got back to me. Guessed it was just my bad luck. So I bought another Pro 2, figuring that I could charge the battery on the new one and have 2 cameras. But the problem with the old one was actually the camera itself wouldn't work. The new one is 7 months old and doesn't sense motion anymore. I have to pay for support now. Or use Chat, which apparently doesn't have anyone on the other end of the line. There is no email for support anymore either. Expensive, unsupported junk.
title: Two have failed in different ways, support is terrible

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: TDNP
content: Great for apartments By Gg1 on Jul 8, 2017 7:47:28 PM  It easy to install the piece that connects to the magnet.  I am not allowed to screw anything into the outside of my apartment building, but near my door,  I was able to tuck the base unit into some soffeting and the magnet attached to that.  The pics during the day and night are very clear.  I feel safe knowing if someone is approaching my door or not when I am not home.  I keep it on even when I am home to deal with unwanted sales people, etc.  I like the two way speaker function and the siren.  I have not needed to use the siren yet, but tested it and it is LOUD.  I won't hesitate to use it if someone is stealing a package off of my porch.  I highly recommend!
title: Great for apartments

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: rob
content: Purchased in 2018, I can't count how many times it sent a notice that motion was detected, but nothing recorded, then up to 10 mins to get a camera up to see what ever set it off. And if something is setting off camera(s) repeatedly, forget about getting to see it on your phone. I've had $300 systems do a better job. Arlo is way overpriced.
title: not worth the money

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: roostertail
content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video. As the recent owner of a vacation property that was abandoned for 3 or 4 years, we knew we had to do something about the constant traces of uninvited visitors to our 8 acres. Each week we'd find soda cans, beer cans, and other trash strewn over our yard. Thankfully our alarm system appeared to deter anyone from entering the house but people had no problem driving down our 1/4 mile driveway to hang out. I research quite a few alternatives but landed on the Arlo because it's wireless and seemed rather easy to install. So far, we've caught a car of intruders in our yard and watched them get arrested live on our camera. We've also caught other more welcome intruders like many deer and a fox. Sometimes I just go "live" on the camera to check the weather at our cabin. It's awesome! Batteries have lasted over a week without hardly dropping in power at all. I do want to invest in the optional solar charger but they are a little pricey. Siren is loud but should be called a beeper since it's more like a smoke alarm than a true siren. It would be nice for them to make the "siren" sound come from the cameras, rather than the base station as well since my base is approaching the 100 ft maximum distance and it can hardly be heard from there.
title: Bought based on reviews but surprisingly worth the money

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: S. Merritt
content: I would give it 5 stars but there are a couple of improvements that could be made to really make them stand out. They are great for being able to mount about anywhere as no wiring is needed and they are small enough to easily mount to about anything, but they aren't so small they don't produce a good picture. The battery life depends a lot on how far from base they are and what materials the signal need to go through to the base. The 300 foot limit they talk about is strictly wide open area and little blockage of signal by walls of wood, concrete, brick, and so forth. The system is a great starter system which can be built upon by adding cameras and the fact they only allow 5 before a monthly fee is in place is a little bit of a let down but again, all in all a fairly decent product and with some exploring and working on adjustments and all you can pretty much set up the system almost anyway you would like with motion and noise activation of recording and alerts. Well worth checking out if interested in providing some security for your home, office or out buildings.
title: They are great for being able to mount about anywhere as no ...

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Jay B.
content: I have 720 which is adequate but will go 1080 from now on. The base always works. When offline, it's always easy quick to get up and running again Delay in audio video is bad even if cam, base & strong WiFi are right next to u. 720p ok but no 1080. Angle view too narrow. Goes off inline constantly but still 1 of best ranges I've found after trying 5 brands. Wireless Cams WITH Base is the way to go. Siren function: loud, excellent, useful.
title: It's ok. Should come with protective waterproof cover

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Jon and Colleen
content: The camera quality day/night is wonderful on these. There is only about a 1-2 second delay from when someone goes in front of the camera to when it notifies you on your phone. The reach these have for motion detection is impressive, but beware, it’s sensitive. The cameras kept picking up my neighbors across the street when they would pull in their drive. I just had to adjust the sensitivity and set it lower to fix that problem. My wife loves these as well. She now gets to see how many stray cats wander by our house every night.
title: Excellent camera quality

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Ryan
content: This camera is one of the best in its price range hands down.  sound and motion detection, ifttt integration, geofencing and a recharable battery.  improvements could be made to increase range of motion detection and through windows.  if you aim this out a window it wont be able to tell if someone walks up to it but when i placed it outside it had no trouble with motion detection at around 15-25 ft.  For some reason the arlo pro cant use sound as a trigger for ifttt even though the arlo q can, but it can use motion as an ifttt trigger and the sound notifications still come to your phone as regular app notifications.  geofencing worked fine when it was just my phone but it couldnt seem to work when i shared access with my roommate.  indoors i would reccommend the arlo q unless you want to put it in a place where a cord isnt parctical. But outdoors this camera cant be beat. tends to be slower connecting to live feed and modes then other cameras ive owned but its stable and reliable plus the battery means the camera will run even if the house looses power. Even with some of the bugs and room for improvements, would reccommend.
title: a great outdoor camera

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: KG
content: We've had two of the regular cameras up for about 7 months and love them. I've been wanting to add the pro version to our existing set up for awhile now, I really wanted the voice feature. I finally bought one and I'm so glad I did! The picture is so much clearer, especially the night vision. This camera went on our front porch and I can monitor packages and even speak with whoever is at the door. I can even hear what people are saying as they walk past our house! I also love how we get email alerts when something triggers the camera. We can monitor our house from anywhere! We use a screw in type mount to lessen the chance of someone stealing it. This camera works perfect and we'll be looking into adding another to monitor our backdoor too.
title: Perfect!

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: SJT
content: I loved the Arlo Pro cameras (5) I have until I installed them. When viewing the cameras, they lag significantly. After reading others complain about 2 or 3 second delays, I was surprised! My delay is 10-15 seconds of not more!  I live in a Townhouse with quite a few 2.4Ghz access points nearby, I haven't worried about it before as I use 5Ghz for everything. I am absolutely shocked that the cameras do not have 5Ghz capability! Especially from a networking company like Netgear! So now I am really frustrated. The cameras and app are better than most so I don't want to return it, but it infuriates me when I use it. If there is 5ghz hardware in the cameras, I really hope they add it via firmware update. Until then, I'm going to have to deal with the slowness and unstable connections until I get to shell out more money when a 5ghz capable outdoor camera comes out. (Dang indoor-only Arlo Q)
title: I almost love it.

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Zack Byrnes
content: Others have covered the technical specifications and quality in sufficient detail, so I'll only add this: These are the cameras to buy if you want/need to avoid wiring a system.  Yes, you sacrifice some video quality, but for most purposes these are more than adequate. We have five configured around our home, and in conjunction with IFTTT programming they're an incredible security asset.  The wireless system permitted us to hang two from trees and capture the entire front and back of our home and driveway.  The motion sensors on those cameras picks up very little, of course, but we've used IFTTT to tie them to the other cameras and independent motion sensors.  We get a beautiful, complete view of any activity occurring around our home. The battery charging is somewhat of a hassle as-is, but I'm not docking my review of the cameras for that.  Netgear sells additional batteries and a docking charger separately; otherwise you have to plug the cameras in to recharge.  My experience with battery life has been superb - with relatively regular recordings, I expect to recharge every 6 months or so.
title: Best Wireless Security Cameras on the Market

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Elena V.
content: I bought the 3 pack of arlo pro cameras after moving some a small city to one of the biggest cities in the US. Needless to say I got a little paranoid and wanted to take som safety precautions to keep my mind at ease. So far this has been a great investment. Installation was easy and the quality of the cameras is pretty good. The two-audio is quite loud and clear which is perfect. The alerts are pretty quick to come in and accurate. I like that the email alert gives a quick snapshot of the motion it detects. That way I can see if it is just my dog tripping the motion detector. The only downside is the delay in the recording when motion is detected and that it only records in 10 second increments even though the motion detected goes on quite a bit longer. However, I did read that in the reviews before buying this set but it is something I can honestly live with.
title: Great cameras to keep the mind at ease

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: KEO
content: Update: 1/22/17 I updated this review to 5 stars because I thought the night vision was not very good. It turned out that one of the cameras was not working properly and Amazon said send it all back for a new unit. Received it in 3 days and works PERFECTLY now. I can't say enough about this system. Very user friendly. Anyone can set this up. Works great! Original Review: This camera was by far the easiest to get up and running. Simple for anyone! I set my cameras up outside and the range is pretty good for motion and audio is interesting to hear what's going on around the house. It worked perfect all through a week long storm. I am still learning everything this can do but the software is very straight forward and I can monitor my cameras on any device. Iphone, Android and PC . This is a excellent security camera the only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is the night vision is all black can't see anything. My previous camera had great night vision but recording and remote monitoring never worked correctly. Anyway, great camera easy to use! would be nice if the night vision worked.
title: I set my cameras up outside and the range is pretty good for motion and audio is interesting to hear ...

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Jason
content: I really wanted to like this product. I bought it for myself as a christmas gift and was super excited to set it up since package theft has been an issue in our neighborhood. 1. The setup was fairly easy, took everything out of the box hooked up the base station and synced the cameras. First step was to download the mobile app and update the firmware. *firmware would not update via the mobile application, you would click update and nothing would happen. I had  to login to the arlo account via my laptop web browser and then the firmware would finally update. 2. Post firmware update I set the cameras up in my desired locations (2 cameras for the front door and garage door both about 10 -20 feet from the basestation. Everything seemed to be ok at first then about 20 minutes later one of the cameras disconnects. I reconnect and this keeps happening it will stay connected for 5 - 20 min only then losses connection, only way to get it back up is to remove battery and put it back in. plugged in the cameras to ensure both batteries are fully charged, moved the camera right beside the basestation in case it was a range issue, swapped new batteries, reset the system numerous times and re-synced the cameras, reset my cable modem and router, etc. etc. Camera still would not stay connected. 3. I have a very technical background & wasted most of my Christmas day troubleshooting these cameras trying to get them to work. Finally contacted Netgear support only to waste another several hours of my time on basic steps like turn the power off and on. That was the extent of the technical knowledge the representative on the line could help me with. After 3 days of messing with the camera trying to get it to stay connected I give up and returned this faulty product. The fact that I have to monitor Arlo every 15 min to make sure it's still online left me with no confidence that I can trust this to actually monitor my home when I'm away.
title: I really wanted to love Arlo

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Opo Herrera
content: I always want to use wireless products because I hate to drill and wire stuff. In this case, I think I made a huge mistake. My points: 1- Arlo doesn't support Quad view. (4 images or more in one fixed screen) 2- Only supports five simultaneous streams. (To bad if you want to see what is going on everywhere) 3- The live view delay sometimes is up to 10 seconds, (if you are using the microphone then is a huge deal) 4- The battery is not good when you have the system armed (Motion Sensor) 24x7. My kitchen needs to be recharged every two weeks. The product is good in terms of quality (nice picture and sound) but is not yet at the Digital Video Recording system level yet.
title: Not happy about this product as an DVR/NVR? Lack of everything.

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: 7 Watts
content: I an above average user. Have built multiple high-end computers, Use a variety of OSs, Configured many networks, and Know my way around code. Installed in a 50'x25' one-story office -- very simple setup Very disappointed with this system (Software and UI) -PITA to set up -SLOW SLOW SLOW in every possible respect - Geofencing randomly switches into "away" mode, so it keeps clogging up with random videos of me working at my office when the cameras should be off --VERY annoying -2.4 Ghz radio only, no 5G -2.4G radio keeps switching to the same channel as my router( tons of forum posts on this issue exist) and Netgear does a piss poor job of explaining why - UI is oversimplified and feature-poor - The whole UI is just very frustrating and annoying to use, the opposite of a good user experience. On the plus side - I like the hardware -- the physical aspects of it seem and feel to be constructed very well and thoughtfully, really too bad its not backed up by everything else
title: More Wrong Than Right

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: bigbeatsss
content: UPDATE: The model I purchased started to crack around the screw mount in the back. This exposed the sealed battery compartment.  My camera was used outside, but luckily it was under a covered area.  This happened after 3 months so i was not happy, but I contacted Netgear Arlo support and said it was a known issue on this model and are replacing the camera under warranty.  So although I had to take the camera down for a few weeks, Arlo support was awesome and replaced it without hassle. I really like it.  Works as described.  I dont have any issue with motion being triggered by sun glare or car passing by, but it could be how my is setup under an overhang. When setting up I did notice there is about a 3 second delay.  I have not yet had someone come up to door or a package delivered to know if it will capture them right away or it will catch them walking away - I have read that is an issue on most other cameras like Ring and Nest. -Night vision is great. -The speaker on the camera is not that loud and I have it set to 100% volume. The microphone picks up really well though and I can hear the person on the other end clearly -In the app is great. I was able to "invite" my wife to have access and setup her own account. -I am able to setup when the motion is on.  I was able to setup geofencing AND schedule. So when my wife and I are BOTH(you can also setup just one phone for geofencing) not home during the day it will come on, but it also comes on when we are home at night.  This is great so it doesnt pick me up while sitting out front or in my driveway. -My ISP puts a data cap on my internet(since I dont want their shitty cable) and with me viewing it a couple times a day and a few motions detected at night it does not eat up a lot of data. -It has a web portal so I dont need just my phone to view and edit settings The rolling 7 day cloud storage is free, you can get more if you want, but the 7 days is perfect for me.It takes a video of what motion detects and not just a picture like NEST.  You can download the clips while they are available.  The base has some usb ports for I assume downloading to an external drive, but I have not used it yet. -The base is also nice because it hard wires directly to you router and then broadcasts its own wifi.  Netgear makes some good networking equipment so I trust the base wont have any issues broadcasting wifi. I will try an update this review every month or so.
title: Wire-free, Free 7 day cloud storage, Motion settings customizable - Overall great security camera

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Timothy D. Taylor
content: I started with Arlo buying pieces individually and putting it together and I needed to add one camera outside, so getting this 1 camera pro plus base was very affordable, even more so than buying just the camera. Now I can take my old Arlo and put it outside and use the new one to replace in that room and enjoy audio as well. Have to figure out how to swap out the old base, but Arlo support should have all the answers there!
title: Easy and Affordable!

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: NK
content: Had the Arlo Pro 2 camera system at home for a few weeks now. Set up wasn't too hard but after a day noticed a duplication of cameras in the device list. Tried to delete the duplicates but ended up needing to do a full reset of the system. Even tried to create a new account but the duplicates returned after a day. Interesting note is that the duplicate of each camera shows a battery in the red while the actual camera is full. Software UI is generally pretty easy to navigate. Dissapointed with the lack of zone motion tracking and linking of the cameras with either home automation through Apple or IFTT. Can't remark on battery life yet but still appears to be in the >95% after a few weeks.
title: Some software issues

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Karen E Rhorer
content: I initially set these cameras up indoors to look out through windows onto my front porch and into my backyard. However, I quickly found that the motion detection wasn't working at all through my double-paned+screened windows. In hindsight, I should have just returned them when I realized this. Given some of the other comments about the cameras working inconsistently when directly exposed to the elements (which they would have been in the places available to mount them on the exterior of my house), I decided to repurpose them to use as, essentially, webcams to use inside my house when doing separation anxiety training with my dog. They were working fine for this purpose - okay, but not great - for a few months until recently, when the cameras stopped staying connected to my phone, failed to reconnect when I tried to reconnect, and in general stopped working entirely - no audio, video, motion detection, recording, etc. I've had them more than a year, and Arlo only provides a one-year warranty on the hardware, so now I have a hub and cameras that, because they have no functional use since they don't consistently work for any purpose now, are going to become waste in a landfill, which isn't a thing I feel great about. Save your money (and the environment!) and don't buy these cameras.
title: Motion detection inconsistent and stopped working entirely after two years

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: M&A Shopping
content: I have bought 10 of these and 3 of them died in less than 6 month, so it lost around $500. For every 5 camaras you will need a hub and they connects to that hub Wi-Fi not to your existing one so you need to find a good place for the hub or they will produce pure video quality. For the price I was expecting better hardware quality.
title: Don’t waste your money.

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: W. T.
content: Easy to setup but picture quality isn't that good. Ordered the Arlo Pro 5 camera system and one camera was faulty. Talked to NetGear and they said the same after testing and to return the whole system where I purchased it. Turned out to be a blessing in disguise because for 800 bucks I was expecting a much better picture. I've installed analog camera systems with better picture quality. It looks pretty good on a tiny phone screen, which most do, until you view it on a pc. Then you really see how poor the quality of the picture is. I really wanted this to be as good as it's ratings but it falls very short.
title: Easy setup/Poor picture Quality

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Pamela Helton
content: I had wrote a good review previously about these cameras but, since have had 2 cameras stop detecting motion (one was a replacement for one of the original cameras that had also stopped detecting motion) and then endured a call to Arlo technical support. I have no idea as to what happened  during most of the call as I could not understand the woman I was dealing with. I had to ask her to repeat herself numerous times  and still could only make out part of what she was saying. At the end of the call (which solved nothing) all I got was a case number and hung up on. She literally hung up on me!!!!  The ONLY saving grace was the Amazon employee that finally just sent a replacement camera. I believe his name was Karol and he was awesome through the whole ordeal. I would NEVER encourage or recommend anyone to buy or waste a moments time on Arlo. AVOID......
title: Camera stopped detecting motion and TERRIBLE Customer Service

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Oliver
content: Other than one of my cameras not syncing out of the box, these cameras perform as expected. Video quality is good, cameras are small and sleek, and the mounting hardware is nice. Some issues: the 2-pack wire free Arlo Pro only comes with one AC adapter and charging cable for the camera. As a product that touts the ability to stay plugged in if desired, they don't provide enough accessories to accomplish this. Since it only comes with one AC adapter and cable, you can only plug in one camera at all times. If you want another charging adapter and cable, it appears the only way is to buy another rechargeable battery, which does you no good if you don't have the battery charging station. And in theory, a truly wire-free option is nice, but unless you buy extra batteries and a charging station, you will need to remove the battery and camera at some point to charge, thus leaving you without any security for the time it takes to charge. Not ideal! And this may be the case with all wire-free/IP cameras, but there is a noticeable lag. I have my camera pointed at the stairs to my door and I almost get to the top of the stairs before my camera starts to record. Wish it came on sooner. And the reason why I didn't give it 5 stars was because one of the cameras didn't sync. Amazon had to send me another camera to swap out, which worked. This appears to be a problem with a lot of other Arlo owners. But Amazon came through for me again. Thanks Amazon!
title: Works for me

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Martin S
content: It was an easy set up and the video quality is excellent if you sacrifice battery life.  I do wish the lens had a wider range but it's pretty good for the price.  I've not had them long enough to complete an in depth review.  I am having difficulty configuring my cameras with the Samsung SmartThings Hub 3rd Generation.  I have not determined whether it's a problem with Samsung or Arlo.  So far so good!
title: Easy setup!

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Richard E
content: I’ve been in the market for a long time when it came to security cameras, and by far this has been the best choice I’ve ever made. I love the ease and functionality of the cameras and the ability to move and place them as the situation needs without the hassle of wires. The programming is also a plus and love the fact I can set up and program them to my needs. Set up is very easy but can be time consuming in order to meet individual needs. If your in the market for cameras for personal or professional use I would HIGHLY recommend the Arlo cameras
title: Absolutely the best

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: -A
content: I haven't used any Arlo products before but they seem pretty well made and thought out. Setting up the base station was easy, and the position mode makes camera placement easier. I wish that the speaker in the camera would be louder b/c the person on the camera end has a hard time hearing.  The modes and customization is nice but the geo fencing only seems to work half the time when I'm home since it says I'm outside and away the other half when I'm really home. The notifications from movement or sound are quick which is nice but I just wish the recording was a few seconds earlier. A nice feature on the Arlo Pro is the usb back up option. Since I elected for the free 7 day cloud option I plugged in a 1 TB external hard drive that will record everything, even if the internet goes down. Just make sure your external hard drive or memory stick is formatted to FAT32. So far the positives outweigh not having cameras, but am definitely hoping they will as Arlo Pro support for Wink.
title: Arlo Pro System

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Amzn
content: I bought this system to be able to keep an eye on the front of my property. The picture quality is dismal, and the motion detection even wise. The settings are an overnight development after thought so don't expect to set recording quality, active zones more complex than a horizontal rectangle plumb only. Its like as user friendly as can be to the extreme... As planned aa can be. Wherever l they've sorry on marketing and modern startup appeal 98% and only 2% on actual development and features. All hype and no guts.
title: More Hype less developed

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: EEGrad
content: I got the two camera Arlo Pro kit for outside front door back door mounting.  Wanted a continuous power connection to charger to avoid recharging manually.  I thought I could cut the USB cable and then feed it through a simple plastic coax cable bushing and splice the cable on the inside of the house/garage.  It turned out the cable wire was so thin and the coated strands made it near impossible to easily splice. Don't cut the USB cable - you'll be sorry.  So I looked around for some kind of weatherproof feed through bushing that would accept the USB cable including the connector at the end without having to cut the cable. West Marine sells a nice round plastic wire feed through bushing that comes apart so you can feed the wire and connector through it. It has a rubber washer that seals the bushing to the mounting surface.  the bottom of the bushing is still open and in some cases you might need to apply silicone caulk to keep out the rain and bugs.  See attached photo. Cost is $7.49 for one bushing. Comes in white or black.  A little pricey but good quality construction and it does the job. As far as the Arlo Pro cameras go, for me the 720p resolution is more than adequate. No need to spend the extra money for the Arlo 2 in my opinion. I tried using the shorter outside mount but was unable to get a steep enough angle down to view my front door.  I'd recommend the Wasserman mounts for the Arlo Pro. You get 2 for about $11.  I like the two way voice communication feature, but on my cameras the speaker volume is very low even with the App volume level turned all the way up.  I have to practically yell into my phone mic for you to hear any voice coming out of the camera.  The audio from the camera mic is fine on the phone.
title: Tips for running USB power cable through outside walls

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Kathleen
content: Very easy to set up.  Excellent product, works as advertised.  I am using the cameras outdoors.  You give up some camera clarity but for me, the wireless nature is worth the slightly grainier picture. Had I gone with "wired" cameras, then I would have had hire an electrician to come out and wire 5 different outdoor locations in order to install the cameras.  As it was, I was able to do the installation completely myself.  I did order additional Adjustable Indoor/Outdoor Camera Mounts (also Netgear Arlo Accessory) and used these to install more securely because I am using in an outdoor environment.  The app works well and I was able to adjust the notification protocol for each camera individually.  Have had problems figuring out the "scheduler" for individual cameras.  The user manual indicates that you can put the different cameras on different schedules but so far I haven't figured that one out.  Where I will use this, if I can figure it out, is that during the day, high traffic camera views like the street and sidewalk with lots of traffic, I won't have the video recording armed, but at night I will.  The camera will still be live, it just won't record or send notifications when it detects motion.
title: Very good wireless security cameras.

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: CCNurse
content: I bought one camera set to see first if this will fit my needs. It was easy to set up the connections between our wifi network and the Arlo unit and camera. I love the fact that I can move the camera around where I need it. The quality of picture is great. You get a FREE 7day cloud storage or use a flash drive to store your images or you can opt to buy extra cloud services. I would definitely buy more cameras when I have the money. Something to consider: -there are motions that were not captured but maybe it's how I positioned the camera. So make sure you test it. -the wall mount that came with it could be better, it needs to be a little extended. -do not install outside the house that is within arms length otherwise it can be just taken away by other people but you will have their face on your cloud storage.
title: Easy to set up and use

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Baldy
content: I wanted to be able to view the (blind i.e. no windows) approach side of my home for quite some time but could only find devices which would require running wiring to the outside camera.  No need to here!  Amazing.  I am a (retired) mechanical engineer and am amazed at how well this device performs.  My first experience using it outdoors produced a notification of an email on my phone that indicated the camera was triggered by motion.  I watched the video it had recorded and sure enough, a (presumably) large bug had had the audacity (at night) to fly by the camera!  A quick adjustment of the sensitivity, using my phone, eliminated the (bug) detection but reliably triggered the camera when a person was in view.  Ha!  I love it!
title: Super!

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: nolansc
content: Arlo pro system is the best I've tried so far. I've try dropcam and blink as well. Setup and install is a breeze. Picture quality and features are fine. Battery life is undetermined because I have only had them for a week or two. This system has what you need to guard your home. Sensors, camera, recording and siren. The distance from cam to hub is great. I've went out double the distance compared to my blink cams. Now for the negative. The iOS app doesn't offer all the same features as the pc web interface. Mode setup is easier on the pc browser. Next the lag between sensing and recording is real. There is easily a five second or so lag. This is probably the case with most battery wifi camera systems. People want more features and more power yet they forget these are battery powered wifi cameras. Buy a wired system if you want instant access. Four stars.
title: Close to perfect.

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: James Larson
content: Have used Arlo since the old netgear days and have always wanted the option to listen and talk back. Love the new options but there is a few seconds of lag so talking back and listening can miss a small bit on communication. I have setup other cameras as motion detectors to start the new camera before visitors walk up and that works great. Love the ability to schedule, set cameras to capture photos or video, set length, and other settings. The cameras are small, powerful, and really like to be able to place them anywhere I choose. (Not just a door bell) great to capture wildlife and other things in the yard and around the house. Highly recommend for above abilities to use them. Keep making the improvements!!

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Photovideogo
content: It has never missed motion detection, the app is easy to use. it can be implemented into smartthings and iftt. The only con is that the video quality is not the best. The fact is none of the other brands have good video quality. We will have to wait a couple years before video quality improves in this segment. It is not the cheapest but it is the best overall. Update 3 months later; battery is at 15 percent and I got a notice indicating low battery. I am very happy with the battery life. So far I am very satisfied as it has not missed any incidents. Last night I got someone sneaking up my steps so the Arlo is a huge hit in my house. I feel much more secure knowing I have video coverage of anyone who comes to my door.

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Jay
content: This is a great product that clearly captures movement and sound and automatically uploads it to the cloud.  Simple installation with the ease of just plug and play. I personally love how convenient and clear the video capture is when viewing through your smartphone & PC. Since it automatically uploads footage to the cloud, the free 7-day, 5 camera recording is the best.  The plus side is that you can easily view those footage anywhere and download it and post it on social media right away.  There is an option to setup an alarm when motion or sound detected which is ridiculously loud.  So far, battery has been good but i'm currently waiting for the outdoor charging plug which plugs via micro usb connection. This device is great but there are flaws.  While setting up, the owner will get bombarded with email and push notifications to your phone which will be annoying but once fully set up with the right scheduling, it will be less bombarded.  Very quick movements far away will not be detected and when nearby, it will briefly capture that quick movement if passing by.  This device will not automatically capture outdoor movements while being positioned through a Window indoors.  This device only automatically records up to ten secs of footage then detects again if there is still movement and sound. This will continue to record another ten seconds of footage but because of this process, there is a delay in between. Overall, even with the flaws, I personally recommend getting this Camera system.  A person can easily spend on expensive professional equipment as well as paying someone to professionally install that system but if you just want to avoid all that, this product will be quick and easy.
title: Quick and Easy Protection Right Away

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Jacob Groome
content: The wireless camera system is great! The quality of the footage is pretty good for being a wireless camera. I really can't complain about the system. Some people argue that it wont pick up license plates.... but most camera systems won't pick unless you buy a camera specifically for that (license plate recognition cameras) which for one camera it costs more than the price of this entire system. The motion activated feature is really nice. I wish you could watch all clips continuously. Going through all the footage takes forever even if the clips are only for a few seconds. It would be nice if I could just press play all and watch them in order, one after another. Then I could go back and delete footage as needed.
title: Great system! Just needs a watch all button.

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
