product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Koko
content: I've recently purchased the Arlo Pro single bundle set to test and see if it was worth purchasing additional cameras. This was my additional camera purchase for a single Arlo Pro Security Camera from Amazon Arlo Pro Security Camera by NETGEAR - Add-on Rechargeable Wire-Free HD Camera with Audio [Base Station not included] | Indoor/Outdoor | Night Vision (VMC4030) . Listed below are my pros and cons about this device. Note that these devices are placed outdoors. IMAGE QUALITY:  720p Resolution is good, but not great. You can capture objects in good detail IF you place the camera close to the object/area of recording. If you place it further away from object/area the quality will become pixelated/blotchy. I currently have this eight feet above and two feet away from my door. I can see whoever approaches my door at fair to good detail. I also have one facing my driveway, but the quality is very average and I cannot see details of a person walking by or even my vehicle license plate. Again good up close. Currently, Netgear has just released their newer Arlo Outdoor cameras - Arlo Pro 2 which records at 1080p. You can find it here: Arlo Pro 2 by NETGEAR Add-on Security Camera, Rechargeable, Wire-Free, 1080p HD, Audio, Indoor/Outdoor, Night Vision, Works with Amazon Alexa (VMC4030P) [Base Station not Included ] NOTE: This is a very new release and there hasn't been enough reviews yet. The reviews there are currently not about the product itself, but more about their disdain with pricing. Best wait after a month to see actual purchased reviews. Complaints about the differences between 720p and 1080p not making much of a difference is completely illogical. As a person who works with video editing this is like saying DVDs and Blu-Rays visual quality look alike. They do not. There is a great significance between detail. Unfortunately, as I'm waiting to test the Arlo's 1080p product, I can't say for certain if this is going to capture the quality I want, but on a technical standpoint 1080p should raise the bar on these cameras, and I'm willing to spend $220 to buy them over these 720p versions. AUDIO QUALITY: When viewing this on my smartphone or computer, the audio is great. I can hear everything crisp and clear from my recordings. However, in regards to the MIC function for speaking with someone outdoors, make sure that it's close by. At the max audio level, I tested audibility by standing outside my door and talking using the microphone on my smartphone. The audio was very audible from where I was standing which was probably about 3 to 4 feet away. However, anywhere beyond that will be difficult to hear. NIGHT VISION: Love the night vision on this, but again same thing happens with Image Quality as listed above. If it's too far away, you're not going to see much detail. At a closer distance I was able to decipher raccoons walking across our door. Just note, when placing these near any area around the house, make sure it's away from any motion sensor light. The initial flare of the light automatically turning on will cause the image of the camera to blur out a bit until it stabilizes to accommodate for the lighting. This means you may lose a few seconds of recording. RECORDING SENSITIVITY: You'll need to play with the sensitivity function on each individual camera. I've tested cars passing by about 15-20 feet away and they will set it off. If I were to reduce the sensitivity under 50 (This is out of 100 max) then it'll ignore some of the cars passing by. NOTE: There is a three second delay on the recording as many have mentioned in this review. So be aware that you may lose two to three seconds before it starts capturing anything. BATTERY LIFE: Yes, the batteries do last long (Potentially 3 months) IF you leave it at a default setting of 10 second recording and not watching LIVE mode for too long. If you set your recordings at 60 seconds, then the battery life may only last about 1 month. So be aware of this. You can also set your camera to record only when motion is detected. SMARTPHONE APP: Great App and works well. Pretty user friendly and not difficult to maneuver to find things. Just make sure that if you're viewing your videos live to have your phone using WIFI and not your data plan. If you have a limited data plan (Mine is 2 GB only) on your smartphone, this thing will guzzle it in a matter of just a few days. My mobile carrier currently is throttling my bandwidth down even though it's unlimited. This can happen to you too if you're not careful. OVERALL: I'm happy with my Arlo Pro system. The only down part was that I didn't wait long enough for the 1080p cameras to come out which isn't too big of a loss. I still plan to use my 720p near areas of short distance recording while the others down the line will be at 1080p.
title: Arlo Pro Security System - Cameras are Good, but Not Great.

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: I. Costner
content: I've had 5 Arlo Pro cameras for about two weeks now and just ordered 5 more.  The first kit I purchased at Best Buy, the extra cameras I bought on Amazon.  These solved the biggest problem I was facing with outdoor cameras - wiring.  I bought a few IP cameras a couple of years ago and never got around to installing the wiring necessary to operate them.  They would have had much better video quality and would not have required a subscription or broadband data usage, but the wiring obstacle is a big one. First, the not so good:  There are a few compromises, but not deal breakers.  For starters, the video quality is so-so.  It really doesn't look like 720p on the "optimized" mode, but I assume this is a compromise for battery life.  Also, when I put two cameras within a foot or two of each other, the signals get scrambled about half the time.  They must be spaced out, but not more than 300 or so feet from the base.  I'd make sure they are at least 3-6 feet from each other as well.  I also do not like the fact that the motion recording will not stop when the motion stops, or continue recording as long as there is motion.  You must set a specific time for each clip (5-120 seconds, I think).  Each time motion is detected, it will record for that length of time only.  If the motion is a bug that flies in front of the camera for one second, and you have your video clip set to record for 120 seconds, you are going to have 119 seconds of unnecessary recording.  Also, if you have it set for 10 seconds and motion continues for 60 seconds, you will have a few very disconnected clips with several seconds missing between each clip.  I have read that the developers are working on a mode that will capture just motion, regardless of how long.  I hope they implement that soon.  Battery life has been pretty good on my cameras.  In one week, they went down about 3% (and that is with a lot of messing with them).  Of course, eventually, I'll have to go take every one of them down and either charge them (which is pretty fast) or buy an incredibly expensive charger and expensive extra batteries and swap out batteries one camera at a time.  I suppose that is not too bad since I didn't have to run any wires. The good:  They are SUPER easy to set up and manage.  They install in seconds anywhere you want to put them.  I really like the magnetic connection because it makes adjustments very easy.  The cloud recording is really fairly priced for what you get, and if you buy 10 cameras you get a lot of value out of the cloud service.  They also give me peace of mind while I'm away and that is really all I wanted. Overall:  Even with the compromises, I would buy these again without hesitation.  If you are looking for simple and cost effective home monitoring, Arlo Pro is the way to go.
title: The first kit I purchased at Best Buy, the extra cameras I bought on Amazon

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: phil
content: You can't record and playback or watch a live feed from a local device like most other camera systems do. There is a serious lag time in recording and when using the 2 way audio. There is no actual live feed due to the lag. You have to buy a cloud storage subscription and you can't bypass this. No continuous recording unless you pay an extra $20/month in addition to the minimum of $100/year subscription fee. Arlo cloud constantly goes down for many hours and you won't be notified. I truly regret paying over $1,000 for this p.o.s. system.
title: Do not buy Arlo products!!!

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: P.Scully
content: I'm up to 5 cameras now, a mix of arlo pro's and q's. First the cameras are more than adequate for me to see what's going on in and around the house, I can't read a license plate but that wasn't a requirement. I do know when my amazon delivery shows up or the cat gets on the counter, after some time tuning I have false positive alerts down to a minimum. The price of both the cameras and the free cloud service make it one of the most affordable I've seen. The geolocation arming works pretty well for me to turn on notifications, I still have issues from time to time with doing geolocation based on two phones, but mostly it works. The integration with the Echo Show makes it easy to ask for a view of any of the cameras, handy when the dog is barking and I'm in the basement office. I have it integrated with my Wink home automation, so I can also react to motion detected from any of the cameras, with Stringify and IFTTT I've got some pretty cool automations going. I also invested in a couple of replacement batteries and the charger. Makes easy work of it when the batteries are low.
title: Good cameras with minimal hassle/expense

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: S. Whitmore
content: We have had these cameras for about 3 weeks. We fully charged the batteries before we installed the system. They lasted for about 2 weeks before we needed to recharge them. We plugged them into the charger cord that came with the system and only one of them would charge. The other would not. We took the one that did charge back to our store and it has only been 5 days since and we already need to recharge it. I called Amazon and they were not really able to help us with this issue. The replacement batteries are VERY expensive. Another thing that we have a problem with is the time delay before the cameras actually start recording. It is at least 10 seconds after motion is detected that it will start recording and transmit to our phone. I do have to say though that the picture quality is amazing. The night vision works great as well. If we can't figure out what is going on with the battery charging issue, we may have to just return the system.
title: Battery quality, not the greatest. Picture quality Awesome

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Adam Thurston
content: The Arlo Pro is the only 100% wireless security camera system that is available as a fully developed and refined product that has been out in the real world long enough to be vetted.  Mine has worked flawlessly and I just added a fourth camera and got a charging station and an extra battery so that I have two fully charged spares at all times.  That said, my system has been running for a solid week with lots of motion, and I have set mine up to record for as long as motion is detected. It has made 20-30 recordings a day and the batteries are still in the 80%-90% range, so the battery life is excellent.  Very easy to install and a highly configurable app that is far superior to Ring. Set up was literally as easy as pushing two buttons.  I'm very pleased.  It is exactly what I hoped it would be.
title: Great System

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Georgia
content: Oh my goodness, this is a fantastic system.  I had it hooked up and working within 30 minutes and it probably could have been quicker.  The only tool needed was a screwdriver to put up the magnet that holds the camera.  :)  Simple!!!!  I've looked at security systems for several years but never got one …. SOOOOOO glad I waited!  This is AWESOME!  I plan to add one more camera.  I have already bought a second system for our business and a third system for my daughter's home.
title: Security Made Simple!!!

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Mitchiko
content: I love how easy this is to use and set up. If you don’t have good cell phone reception in your area, you’re not going to get the best reception with this either. That is my experience. I also don’t care for the short video it often takes, even though there is still movement about. I wish I could set the length of time it records for my own personal use. It has been a huge saver of information that I needed to capture. Like all things, it has it’s ups and downs for ever individuals needs, but I don’t regret buying it one bit. I love how I can see what’s going on at my house while I am at work. The best piece of mind money can buy in my case. (Going through a divorce).

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)

content: Overall I like the quality of the camera and ease of installation. However, the app is a bit awkward and geofencing sometimes does not work. product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Krucks
content: I've been using my Arlo Pro camera for a week now. I had no issues with the setup. The battery comes fully charged and the quick start guide is very straight forward. The battery level hasn't dropped from 100 percent yet with the camera setting on best quality though it may still be too early to tell. The motion detection has been working properly and sends push notifications almost instantly. My biggest concern is that the live view connection is very finicky. When I get a notification that motion was detected, I want to be able to go into live view right away to see what is going on. product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Chris E.
content: The Arlo gear is well-engineered. The free level of cloud service was the greatest differentiator from competitors. Though I really wish the cameras were 4K, the picture is very nice at 720p. I did not realize that motion is detected by infrared sensors on the camera, as opposed to a certain % of changed pixels in the frame.  This is somewhat annoying based on my previous experience, but in retrospect it does result in much more efficient use of recording/cloud time.  I do find it does not catch some events well, like pets depending on where they are physically in respect to the camera.  Pixel triggers do not discriminate but infrared ones do.  Both have strengths and weaknesses. What I'd really like to do is constant video recording locally while only using the cloud as determined now.  I don't think that's possible, but I'm not sure. The construction of the cameras and design of the ball mount is really clever.  It makes it very easy to install. The batteries have been only lasting a couple days for me, because power is consumed whenever the camera is "working" based on the sensitivity of the motion sensor.  I fall on the more sensitive side, so my battery use is far greater than "normal" referenced in marketing material... but now I get it.  They want you to be very selective in your trigger settings and only record/upload to the cloud highly significant moments.  Makes sense. In my case, I have been forced to buy solar panels for each camera to keep them powered at my preferred sensitivity settings.  This makes each unit fairly pricey, but I think the overall solid function of the ecosystem warrants it.
title: Clever Approach to Camera

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Lindsey D.
content: We've had our Arlo cameras for a couple of weeks and they have proved invaluable. We initially had them mounted outside of our house for security. My husband and I began noticing that the camera was frequently picking up the sound of our infant son crying inside the house. Because of the easy portability of the cameras, we decided to move one into the house and saw that our nanny was leaving our baby in crib all day while she napped and watched TV. We fired her immediately once we realized what was going on. Arlo's superior sound pick up is what initially alerted us that there might be a problem and without the video portion we would never have known what was really going on inside our house.  I highly, highly, highly recommend these cameras.
title: Security cam turned nanny cam

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: SmartBean
content: The cameras seem to work well and provide sufficiently clear images. The motion detection also seems to work well. The Android app is a bit confusing, but usable.  I have three main complaints about the product: First, the packaging is ridiculous for the 5-camera kit; taking apart the plastic dome that encloses the cameras is like solving a puzzle. Second, four of the five enclosed camera mounts are of the magnetic variety, which according to the Netgear website, are for *indoor* use only; why sell weather-proof cameras with indoor-only mounts? Finally, Netgear apparently refuses to provide Google Home integration, for reasons they won't explain on their forum; thinking about returning the whole $800+ package because of this.
title: Good cameras, bad mounts included for outdoor use, no Google Home integration

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Derek Schroll
content: Great purchase after a wealth of research on different systems, but this is my first system. Easy setup other than having to charge one camera to possibly update the software and worked fine a few moments after charging. Took me about 20 minutes to have 5 cameras working properly. Agree with others that blocking out areas for detection would be great. Had to adjust cameras for a flag blowing and cars driving by will set off the device, but I would want that if there was an issue. There is a delay with recording, but knew that before buying. It’s not an issue for me since I have 5 cameras to cover what I need. Four cover the outside and one inside. I only bought 5 because of cyber Monday prices and glad I did. I can easily move one inside based on my needs. I would carefully plan where you want to place the cameras before your start drilling. You also want to pre drill holes. Make SURE you listen to the reviews about recordings and triggers not working when walking straight at a camera. That is really my only concern with the camera, but I knew that before the purchase and set my cameras accordingly. It is easy to hear through the cameras, but talking through them is not perfect, but works. Not really planning on using the talking feature so not an issue for me. The sound is outstanding though. The batteries have held up well so far after two weeks and a lot of live camera action while I play with the system. I’m more than ok with having to charge the cameras in the future so I can move them where I need them based on my needs. I also avoided having to pay someone to install a system that may need fixing or adjustments later. Again, the cameras were ready to use in 20 minutes and mounted the same day and adjusted as needed the first two weeks. I also love the app and can give access to others based on my needs. I would not allow access to your email unless you want to delete tons of detection emails. The notifications on the phone is great and can be turned off as needed or you can turn off a camera that triggers cars driving by when you are not concerned about cars driving by. Yes, I would love continuous recording and unlimited recordings, but it’s not a priority with five cameras filming as needed or ready to go live as needed. I want to be notified of issues when I’m home or away so I can act accordingly, such as sounding an alarm, calling the police, or checking in at home. If more than one camera triggers there is something to check out and I can record it and have it on the cloud and a USB. You can also set modes based on triggers for recording and alarms in case you are not watching. Great purchase so far!
title: Great purchase after a wealth of research on different systems

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)

author: Turbopro
content: I purchased 2 Arlo Pro systems with 5 cameras during the 2017 Thanksgiving sales events and have had them installed several weeks now. They were easy to set up. Not having to connect any wires to cameras is great which is the reason I chose them. They do have to be within wifi range of the base station though. These have 720p video which shows great detail even at night. The motion detection works well, albeit a little slow at times. Battery life appears good - appears it will last at least 2 months and maybe longer. Sound is good, but two way communication has a significant lag time. It has the ability to add a jump drive so I don't have to pay for extra cloud storage. However, video from jump drive is only viewable by plugging into a computer. Overall, it is a good little camera system that I highly recommend.

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: WinpakBob
content: I had several D-Link indoor and outdoor cameras that worked "ok" but the recording was not reliable nor was it easy to view.  We now have three Arlo Pro's outdoors and two wired Arlo indoor cameras.  They are all easy to set up and the software makes it easy to view live or recorded video.  It takes a little time to create the right balance of motion sensitivity with battery life.  The more you record, the faster the battery is discharged.  Now I am averaging about a month on the most active camera and two to three months on the other two Arlo Pros.  We are not using any subscription plan and the cameras and recordings are perfect for our use!  Recommended.

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)

content: Good product By Matt c on Aug 3, 2017 8:57:16 PM  Performs as described. The picture is pretty clear even at night. And the battery life is unbelievable! product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)

content: We purchased the original Arlo system last fall and we are quite happy with it, with a few caveats.  The new system has addressed our complaints about the original system.  First, the rechargeable batteries seem to be holding up well in the great outdoors.  The battery charge is lasting much longer than the original system.  Time will tell.  Second, the new camera operates much better in low light situations.  Our original cameras did not operate well at night, which was critical since we use these as security cameras.  The new systems low light produces a clear picture in high resolution in the dark.  Finally, the new base station connects to the old cameras much more quickly and we do not have the buffering issue we had before with live streaming.  My only criticism and therefore awarding four star instead of five the process of recharging the batteries.  You either recharge the battery in the camera, which requires taking the cameras off their mounts or placing the battery in a recharging station, which is on back order for 1-2 months.  I wish Arlo had provided a package with the camera and a recharging station.

author: Just here
content: I am giving arlo  4 and a half  stars due to having issues with an older base station (non pro) and issues with one older camera. The base station works intermittently even after following all of tech supports list multiple times. The image on the one camera is often "green" even after multiple restarts, moving location, etc. Upside:  this system is easier than most to set up and use.  Being able to customize motion sensitivity and recording time is a definite plus.  The truly  wireless feature means you can put the cameras where installing power would be cost prohibitive. (spring for the battery chargers/batteries of the older unit and the pro).  The Pro system  is an excellent way to monitor my parents (mid 80 years old and living an hour and a half from me) from my desk top or the ap on my phone.  Image and sound quality are excellent.  An arlo anywhere will be next on my list for travel. IT IS IMPORTANT TO CUSTOMIZE YOUR RECORDING AND MOTION SENSITIVITY SETTINGS. If you are having wireless issues, check the assigned channels and move the cameras further apart.  I have three base stations (for the best coverage if you have a large area you may need more than one base) and 11 cameras. Some of the negative reviews I have read would be solved by folks just reading the manual.

content: This is my third arlo camera. I set this one up as an indoor pet came to keep an eye on my dog and cat. I love the microphone and speaker features. product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Vorlon
content: This best feature of the Arlo camera is it does not need any type of wiring including power (runs on a rechargeable battery). So it makes for quick and easy installation outside or inside. The picture quality is very good in daylight and good in night vision.  The Arlo Pro offers 2-way voice communication which is handy if you what to communicate to someone at the door (or remind the kids to do their homework). The biggest drawback that I found is it only records automatically when it senses movement. Unfortunately, there is a delay between when it does sense this motion and when it starts recording. Sometimes by then what caused the motion is no longer in view. So I would not recommend for those who need a true security system. But a great option for those who just need it to see when the kids get home,  when a delivery is made, or who is at the front door.
title: Good Wireless Option

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: L. McNerney
content: This system is a decent camera system with offsite cloud storage. However, it is not perfect. In fact there are a few bugs that can really destroy the concept if not worked out.  The following is a review of the Arlo Pro camera system, parts of it may not apply to other arlo systems. Camera: Decently heavy duty plastic that is well designed. With a proper cover this camera will last for years in an outdoor environment, Better mounting options should be considered, but you can use either magnetic or a screw in mount.  The picture quality is awesome, getting a high definition picture during daylight hours that most cameras would not achieve. The night vision is not very powerful, but still comparable to other cameras. The motion detection is decent, despite many complaints about it I have not had a problem. with it not working. It IS however slow to kick in, but this is normal for any camera. The delay is about 1 or 2 seconds longer, leading to about a 5 second delay before it records. This can be countered with using rules that turn on other cameras that may catch the entire movement when it is detected on a different camera, and any good setup will have multiple angles anyways. You can talk through the camera to someone, but I have not tested this. Access to the battery is fairly easy to get to, even while the camera is mounted. The camera cannot be used by itself and REQUIRES the use of the Arlo base station. Base: This is a small base with only one modifiable function, an audible alarm. However this base station is what all the cameras connect to. For those worried about the number of IP's used, your entire system will use a single IP because they all link to the base station.  Be careful though, the noise floor for 2.4GHz gets raised by quite a bit. Syncing and updating the base and the cameras can be a little problematic for a few days, but be patient and give it time...things settle down and the camera system all begins to work, despite the many errors you get in the app (often due to impatiently pushing an update multiple times).  The benefit of the Pro system is the ability to connect a USB hard drive as a backup for video.  For me this was the deciding factor. I would love to use my NAS so I can store years worth, but that is not an option with Arlo, so having a 2TB USB hard drive attached is the next best thing. This will store years of motion capture, despite my having only the free service. But this is a risk since it is on site storage and may be stolen. This base station requires a camera and an internet connection.  You will also need to have an account with Arlo. Services: This entire setup is designed to make you want to buy a subscription based plan.  Keep this in mind!  i disagree with their requirement for using the cloud and having their account, but this is the business model they chose (and I knew this before I purchased). You absolutely MUST have an Arlo account, or the system will not work. You can connect up to 5 cameras for free, and it will save 1 week or 1GB (whichever is smaller) of video.  This is pitiful! Take a 2 week vacation and get your stuff stolen on day 2, and you have no proof of anything when you get home! However, if you use a hard drive you may be able to survive this limitation.  They do offer other plans, and a weeks work of free offsite storage is not a bad idea.  But to be charged for adding 6th camera and now your required to pay monthly fees? Well, it is not the perfect system, and although I would love a couple more cameras I refuse to pay monthly fees....especially at the cost associated with this system. App: Here is the problem! The app is required for use, especially if you set up geofencing.  But recently I have been getting a slew of errors stating that geofencing requires the use of internet, which is fine if I lose internet....but I didn't. And the error does not disappear until you restart the phone. Also, geofencing has up to a 5 minute delay, so I can return home and the siren will sound (which is why i have it off currently) all before it registers that I am home and changes the running mode. The app occasionally will state that my systems is offline, yet i could have full access via the web or my wife's app. These errors are with Arlo support, and I am hoping they fix them.  If they don't they are severe enough for me to return the system. However if you do not use geofencing these would never be a problem for you. Phone Data: If you view the video a lot, and have a low data plan, it may be a good idea to look into a high data plan for this.  Especially if you use Geofencing! This is not a data friendly app, but it also has not completely obliterated my data either. Summary: This system could use improvements in the app, and maybe the motion sensors. But for a no wires system this setup has been outstanding! I am not a fan of being limited by the cloud setup, preventing me from using more cameras without a monthly fee, but I knew this going in. All in all it is a good buy so far.....and I will be VERY happy if they fix the geofencing data problem with my phone!
title: Pretty decent camera system, with a few bugs

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: public name
content: I curse the day I bought this system and will never buy another thing from NetGear.  Always troubles and it is impossible to get any support from NetGear...the chat line is continually busy and they seldom answer the help line.  It is difficult to understand the representatives who are from a different country so there is a language mis-connect.  You have to PAY EXTRA for telephone support. The batteries on the arlo pro have to be charged CONSTANTLY. I leave the system turned off 90% of the time because of the very poor quality battery life .  With  batteries off 90% of the time they still need to be charged at least every 3 months.  What good is a system that you have to leave off because it is so USER UNFRIENDLY.

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Jason Staffin
content: Since I have purchased these Arlo Cameras the service has been generally unavailable to me for three separate events.  There have been two week long periods where the app login was unreliable or unresponsive completely and now a three week period where something has gone wrong with my account on the Arlo servers.  I have been in contact with support and they keep telling me that they haven't seen this before and they will get back to me.  I wait and then call back in.  They have only ever called me back once.  This started on June 17th and is still not repaired.  Since this purchase I have been without the use of these cameras for 5 weeks total now.  I cannot recommend anyone purchase this product after going through the instability of their backend systems and the absolutely terrible support experience now.  If I had a choice I would be returning all of my cameras today, but unfortunately I am outside of the return windows and Arlo won't take them back directly.  Nor have they been able to refund my Arlo Smart subscription which I paid for.
title: Unreliable and terrible support experience

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Nadia S
content: I expected the battery will last 2-3 months(like I read before), but it lasts lest than a month. Very annoying to climb and charge it every 3-4 weeks. Especially it’s in the house I rent to tenants, I don’t live there. Quality of video is fine. Easy to install. Motion detector works when it wants. Looking back two years ago, I wouldn’t buy it again
title: Battery dies super fast

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Garrett
content: This is the worst customer service experience I have ever had.  Not only was the phone calls the worst experience I have ever had but what good does a warranty do if you aren't willing to back up your product. I can promise I will never purchase another ARLO product, and I will be selling my current system for whomever their competitor specifically based on the poor service they provided as well as encouraging anyone who asks for a recommendation to avoid ARLO at all cost. I have better customer service with Comcast/Xfinity which is almost impressive. You can't even properly read a chat transcript. Lastly, I have never seen a company so hell-bent on not trying to replace faulty product they sold.
