product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: RG
content: I maintain security survielence systems for a government agency and have a lot of experience supporting and maintaining them so I feel pretty comfortable speaking about my thoughts and experience with the Arlo Pro system. When it came to my home security there were a few key factors I was most interested in. I wanted a system that would allow remote access but with the IOT hacking concerns of today, the last thing I wanted was a zombie network appliance sitting in my home waiting for a DDOS attack to be launch using my own equipment. Netgear has been around a long time and I feel fairly confident they take security seriously and stay on top of new hacks with updates and security patches. This is something a lot of the fly by night cheap systems you can buy out there dont spend the time worrying about. Those companies are out to make a very low cost system and spending money on system security will often make their system cost more then their competitor. So you get what you pay for with those. A security system with little to no security. Seemed counter intuitive to me. The next thing the system had to have was alerts and playback. Since I don't have the time to sit around and watch my camera feed, an alert was pretty much a no brainer. I like Arlo for the fact that it gives you several options for alerts and also gives you a weeks worth of cloud based play backs with download capabilities with the cost of the camera. And for those who might be using this for a small business and cant afford a $50k system, you can subscribe for more storage. For me, and for most situations, you should he reviewing you alerts as soon as they occur in order to be proactive with calling your local Police with descriptions of what you see so a week of cloud storage is more than enough for me. One of the last things I needed in a system was simply ease of use and set up. I can say that this is probably the easiest system I have ever seen for both. I was up and running 10 minutes after getting the box open. The software is very intuitive and I have had zero issues. The camera being able to run multiple months with a single charge on a battery is also a highlight and makes for a very flexible deployment with the option to easily keep the bad guys guessing where the camera might be today since you can move it in a matter of minutes. As far as issues go... the only one has been thw two way speaker/microphone which is not the Arlo systems fault but rather my cell phone which has a noise canceling microphone on it which affects the volume and quality of my voice when speaking through it. As we all know, one size does not fit all. This system is probably the easiest and best quality system you can buy for the home for most applications. If you don't like the idea of your video on the cloud or if you are trying to cover a large area and signal strength for wireless is a concern then maybe you might have a little more searching to do but I can whole heartedly recommend this system.
title: The Best Option

author: Bombalo

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Todd Warner
content: The system is very easy to set up and install.  The delay in the motion detection and record is not great but is ok.  The ability to record longer than ten second clips should be added.  This is a nice system for quick easy surveillance.  The app is nice and easy to use.  The battery life is not great and can be a pain but it's the trade off for a wireless system.  Good video and audio quality in the pro version.  So far I'm pleased with the system.

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: T-Bone
content: Easy set up, easy to use and free 7 day cloud storage.  Also the rechargeable batter lasts for weeks so you do not have to deal with cords, cables and electrical outlets.  I also bought the Amcrest Ultra HD camera but no longer use it.  I say for your money this is the best.
title: Easy set up

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: James M. Johnson
content: I was looking for a wireless security camera I could put at the front door that wouldn't need constant recharging and I was really happy to find something like this out there. Once we found the right spot to mount it with the magnetic base I was happy to see it alerting me when there was motion detected on the app. We've used it to see when packages have been delivered, when people approach our front door and even raccoons at night. The only issues preventing this from being a 5 star review are: -Multiple recordings during nighttime. I first noticed this when viewing the Live View option at night to test night vision. I will get 6 extra recordings for no reason. It looks like this is a common issue. -Needed to resync when recordings would freeze after a few seconds. I'm not sure how much of an issue this will be, but once I resynced I was able to get recordings to work again.
title: ... that wouldn't need constant recharging and I was really happy to find something like this out there

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Matt Chapman
content: The Arlo, Arlo Pro, and Arlo Q are all pretty impressive cameras (I have used all these models)...reliable, decent image, durable, and have a wide versatility of use cases.  However, the one thing that I is lacking (which happens to be quite important), is battery life.  Whether I'm using manufacturer recommended disposable or rechargeable batteries, I find myself replacing them every 1-3 weeks (not applicable to the wired Arlo Q).  This is excessive in my view; I mean, I couldn't even take a long vacation and feel comfortable that these cameras would be functional the whole time I was away.  Definitely need battery improvement, but I like them enough to deal with it...
title: and Arlo Q are all pretty impressive cameras (I have used all these models)

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Uncleddie2U

I purchased my original kit with five cameras and the base approx. 20 months ago and two of the cameras have already failed.  When I reached out to Netgear, they did not offer any type of warranty or even reduced priced replacement options.  Not very good at customer satisfaction...
title: Marginal Reliability

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)

The only limitation, and I knew this when I bought the Arlo, is that it does not offer optical zoom.  I highly recommend this.

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Claype
content: Quick and easy setup with great video quality for the size of the camera. There are more than enough options to customize the setup to suit your needs with the free plan. The one thing i like over all other video systems is the size and relatively low profile of the cameras and base station. I also appreciate the ability to record and store videos locally with an external drive. The 2 way voice system works as expected and the night vision has a decent video quality as well. Being completely wireless helps make the cameras easier to place for full coverage. It would be nice if the kit included multiple options for mounting and dark colored silicon covers so that additional purchases aren't required.
title: Quick and easy setup with great video quality for the size of ...

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: P. K.
content: A great idea, but so far I'm disappointed. After a few hours of operation the camera now shows only a black screen. Apparently I'm not the first to encounter this issue and I'm pretty sure it will be resolved after I spend a few hours with tech support resetting, updating, etc. But the second issue is more damning -- the video quality is lackluster. I'm guessing the video compression is the culprit. There seems to be little user control over how much compression is applied. Too bad. I'm sure there are some situations where this camera is a good choice but not for me.
title: Not great, unless you really need a completely wireless mediocre-quality surveillance system

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Edward Weissman
content: Surprising me with the quality and ease of use, the arlo has notified me of anything near our front door (which is often unused) so we are able to redirect anyone who knocks, or if we are unsure of someone - we get a quick glimpse without going near it.  The quality is really good for a wireless camera and no problems with either setup or maintenance at this point.  Personally I am looking forward to getting a few more for around the house.

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: scott kosel
content: I've tried numerous ip cameras with 3rd party software and none of them were ever the "turn-key" security solution that I was looking for. I currently have a 2 camera arlo pro system covering my 1200 sq foot apartment, and can't really find anything to complain about. The only real "hassle" is that it can occasionally take a few seconds to change from armed to disarmed and vice-versa. I believe this to be an issue with my wifi signal and not the actual product. Maybe there's a better system out there, but I haven't used it and I'm no longer looking. Great product!
title: Maybe there's a better system out there

You can do it with the delayed image but its way harder.  I only discovered the set up mode accidentally but I'm glad I did.

title: I decided on the Arlo Pro and I have not been disappointed. The system has been up and running for ...

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Damon
content: Got the 2 pack and itching to get 2 more.  I can confidently say the Arlo pro will give you what security cameras should give you.  The 2 way audio, even though cranked all the way up, is muffled at best in windy conditions.  Otherwise, it works very well.  I have pretty good internet speed and wifi connection but there's still about 1-2 second delay at most.  This is completely understandable.  Afterall, it is a wireless system.  The setup is seamless and straight forward.  Got mine up and running in less than 15 mins.  I do recommend getting more studier mounts though. I would definitely recommend this for anyone looking for peace of mind and a realiable surveillance system.  My only regret is I didn't get this system any sooner and only decided to pull the trigger after an attempted break in.
title: Does the job!!!

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)

These will definitely be our surveillance cameras for our new home when it’s completed, especially since I do not have to utilize any wiring.

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)

But that may be affected by the distance from the base station and the internet speed of your phone. Overall, an excellent product.

Decided to try out the Arlo pro got everything setup and must say, for wireless camera system it works well.  I had CCTV wired setup before in my home, but now living in a condo these will do.  Overall great product and look forward to being able to utilize the recharge function with the pro carmera.  Would recommend this product!

author: James T. Gray
content: I had a security company over and offer to buy all of my arlo cameras, I wish I had taken them up on it. Forget about talking to someone at the other end of the cameras, the delay is so bad they will leave before you can get a word to the camera. Too many small issues to list, just wish I hadn't bought five of them before I figured it out. I have very good internet service but still have a lot of connectivity issues.

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Sean Newsam
content: I was looking for a wireless surveillance system and stumbled over this.  Initially I bought just one camera and for my porch and after two I decided to buy two more - one for the backyard and one for above the garage door. Set up is a breeze, took me about 7 mins to set up each camera.  Motion detection is pretty quick and clear.  I set it up to record as long as the motion is present and this is exactly what it does.  The resolution is very clear and the night vision is very clear. I hav only had the system about 2 weeks but no complaints at all. I would recommend it to anyone looking for a wireless solution to home surveillance.
title: Motion detection is pretty quick and clear

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Jonathan R. Rodgers
content: This camera does everything we need it to: Good night vision. Motion sensor triggers 10 seconds of auto-record which is sent directly to both mine and my wife's phones. The ability to watch a live, high-quality video/audio feed with only 1 second of lag time. Two-way audio (my wife scared me while I was at home once by speaking to me through the camera). The ability to trigger an alarm on the base unit remotely. Geofence capability for automatic arming and disarming of the system based on my location. MOST IMPORTANTLY: FREE VIDEO STORAGE FOR LIFE (videos automatically deleted after 7 days, but you can download any you want to keep). This makes this camera setup the best value by far. I just wish I'd bought more than one camera!
title: Best Value.

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: jmoc123
content: Overall this is really a great system. It’s so simple to set up. They give you free cloud storage, motion detection, alerts, great battery life, live view, night vision, and now echo show integration. I don’t regret buying this system at all. A few cons/wish list items I have. 1) I wish you could set motion detection zones on each camera rather than all or nothing as it is now 2) head on motion detection doesn’t work. So you could walk straight at the camera and not set it off. It needs side to side motion to activate. 3) there’s a small delay from when the camera detects motion and it starts recording.  I have it in my driveway but the view includes part of the road in front of my house. It will often record a car just as it’s leaving the view of the camera. I’m not really sure how they would fix this as you’d almost need a pre-record.
title: Excellent and easy system.

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: MB
content: Camera did not sync with the base station. I followed the instructions using the app, and then went through the steps with customer support on the phone. Finally the customer support rep told me that the camera was defective, and I returned it. I did not bother purchasing a replacement.
title: Did not sync

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: MacBHoward
content: Overall a really well made product that works. I gave it four stars because one detail should be better publicized by the manufacturer. The cameras time out at 30 minutes to preserve battery power, but there is no user option that will allow the user to stop it from timing out. I bought an Arlo Q and added it to this system so I could have one camera that doesn't time out.
title: Probably the best home system on the market for the price.

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Charles F.
content: I was initially unsure about how good the quality of the cameras would be since they were wireless. But so far I am nothing but pleased. The video and sound quality is very good even when I am viewing while away from home. There is a delay but that is expected. Good night vision quality as well. Cannot comment on battery life yet but it seems to be good for the week I have had the system. Setup was easy, and I only had to make small adjustments to how sensitive the audio and motion detection. Recording starts very quickly after detecting motion unlike other reviews I read. Cameras  have very good range, I was able to walk to the end of my street with it still connected and giving good quality video. Siren is pretty loud and can be heard throughout the house. I will be buying more cameras in the future.
title: Great Cameras, Very Surprised

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)

Would have liked at least 30 feet..

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: tedward
content: I've bought several different wireless security cameras over the years and have been more than a little frustrated with them. They either lacked features, connectivity or reliability.  I've pieced together a system out of varying cameras looking for the one that would fit the bill. Finally - I can say that I've found a "whole" solution with the Arlo Pro. It combines all the features that I've wanted and works very reliably so far. Setup was simple and the expansion process makes this something I will continue to use for years to come. I'm looking forward to the Verizon 4G mobile version coming out in Q2 of 2017. Being able to add a mobile option (to monitor my dog at places I stay while traveling) is just icing on the cake. Great product, does what it says and works like a charm!
title: Finally! The security system I've been looking for!

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: RAFIJ
content: jfprafij By Jeff Pautz on Apr 23, 2017 10:37:16 PM  I am a very meticulous and well skilled technician by trade. Upon doing lots of research having three prior home security systems that were mediocre at best. Having the Arlo pro security system for a few days now and very leery about putting the carriage before the horse having only for a few days have found that this is by far the best home DYI Security system to date . A very customizable, solid, high-quality, extremely well thought out System. A little pricey but worth every penny if it works solid and it does. Netgear did their homework on this one. product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Cristina Saunier
content: I can't say enough good things about this system.  It is everything, and more, that it claims to be.  I had some problems the first day with the cameras staying online and I think it is because I had them all sitting on the desk that i had the router and my laptop on while I was setting up the system.  But from day 2 on, the cameras have worked perfectly once I had them installed in the areas of the house and yard that I had decided upon.  The camera's clarify is perfect.  The motion detection works perfectly also.  My dad paid $9000 for a camera system for his storage units which he also has on his property.  He showed me the views from the cameras in both day and night vision and it is just poor quality.  The only thing that really works is the motion detection and the lights.  So when there is motion detected the lights at the units come on, but then the cameras are so dark it is impossible to detect what it is that is in motion.  He has had to replace the recorder box 3 times by the company and the cameras go out and frequently do not work.  Right now there are two cameras that are not working at this time.  Arlo states that their cameras will operate at a distance of up to 300 ft from the base system.  My dad's storage units are approx 360 feet from his house.  We took one of the cameras over to his storage units and the camera worked perfectly!  My dad had a lot of words to say about his existing system, of which I cannot mention, that he paid so much money for.  I think what I will do is purchase another system exclusively for his business since it states that each base will accommodate up to 5 cameras for free.  This way he does not need to spend any further money except for the initial purchase price.  The first night these cameras were in use, my dad's wife said the next morning that this was the first night's sleep that she slept peacefully knowing that she was safe and the cameras!!
title: Five Stars

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: dagmara
content: The first day I received this Arlo, I packed it up to send it back, the husband said, lets wait a few days and see if we grow to like it. I grew to like it after a couple of weeks. What I like about the Arlo: We have tried several other cheaper security cameras, they are a misery to set up. This is not easy but not horrible as most I have tried to install.  Instructions are mostly easy to understand and the app is user friendly. Like the ability to be able to view from different devices (But there is down side, see what I do not like below). Night vision is better than expected. Free secure cloud storage.  FYI folks, those cheap cameras from Aldi are easy to hack (Google "Aldi reports security risks in IP cameras sold in its stores"). Has a microphone to pickup sound, I do not use this feature but could see where it could be handy. Have this unit outside with one of the silicone skins covering it.  There was no place handy to place it on the porch so we purchased a suction cup stick on shelf attached to a window, and Arlo sits on that shelf, seems to be working well. What I do not like about the Arlo: Orginally positioned this so movement was from the front, did not pick up any motion.  I watched one of the Youtube videos and it said, best picks up side-to-side motion. Moved it to where entering the house was now a side-to-side motion and yes, Arlo began to detect motion. May want to think about this before getting a unit. Logging on one device kicks out every other device. So if the husband and I are not together and we log on to view Arlo, who ever logs on second kicks out the first.  Most of the video are about 30 seconds long so has not been an issue. Not able to individually adjust the motion sensitivity for each camera. I called customer support they had me adjust motion sensitivity at the base station. I was little surprised by this but its not a deal breaker for me. Have just adjusted that certain times of day arlo is going to ding due to light hitting on passing cars. Its offline sometimes.  This is annoying.  However, we discovered although "Live" is not available, we can usually go to "Library" and view from there.  It was little distressing being on vacation, hearing Arlo ding that motion was detected and not being able to view it for 10 minutes. Was just headlights but if had been a burglar, probably too late to do anything proactive. Resetting the base, resync the camera requires you to be physically there.  Power went out, base went off while out of town, and no idea if we would be able to access.  We were able to access, but after getting home, realized the motion sensor was not working so had to bring it inside and resync.  About a 10 minute job, but still thought (hoped) would be able to do this online. More expensive than I wanted to spend, but folks, with security systems, you get what you pay for.
title: Grew to like it

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: P.D.
content: PROS: - Free cloud storage - Good picture - You can use Google Home to view...and should...app is terrible for immediate live viewing (see below). CONS: - App has become trash.  The fingerprint login will usually close the app the first time or two.  No option to log in automatically. - Web version requires Flash. - App has ads now.  Hope you didn't need to see who was at the door right now. - The night vision can be dodgy.  Most night recordings start in color and switch to night vision (or vice versa).  Of the two images I included in one last night that starts in NV (the one where you can make things out), and after 4sec, turned into the color image. - You can resize/crop/zoom the view, but it will ruin the night vision.  I added three photos.  The first two I describe above.  The third (the only you can't make out) is what happened after I cropped the view. (EDIT: The support person I spoke to claims it is know and was broken in the last update...no ETA) - No volume control on the live video feed.  Loud and mute are your options. - Live video feed can often cut out, even with 100% signal to the router. - Does not allow unlimited streaming (will shut off live feed after a few minutes)
title: Like is not the same as love, and I like it (enough)...losing stars a couple of years out.

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: ravjr
content: This is definitely not a set and forget solution.  I'm having to work to make this work.  I'm constantly having to change out batteries for freshly charged ones every couple of days.  So unless you disable just about every feature, you might not have the coverage you are expecting.  As far as charging.  First, there is a wait for Netgear to produce more "proprietary" versions of their charging station.  Which I've been waiting a couple of months to get ahold of one. In the meantime, I bought an "extra" $200 camera just to act as a charging station.  And because of the way they have it setup, its not a simple swap out.  First, you have to remove it from the base, then add a "new" one, and re-setup the configuration.  Assuming you stick to the base subscription, else you are paying an extra $120/year to have the privilege of 4 extra cameras. So the simple solution is to plug them into the outlet.  1. the cable is too short, 2. not enough chargers for every camera.  Starting with 2.  You have to have a charger capable of quick charge, i.e., 9v with at least 20 watts.  Which brings us to 1.  There are even fewer USB cables long enough where its not complaining its not charging.  So, you'll need to bring the extension cord to the camera.  And pay $50 for an extra battery with power cord and charger to cover each of the camera that didn't come with one.  And if you are planning on using this outside... Operationally, its another item on the chore list.  Or it becomes really super expensive just to eliminate the problems.  Otherwise, assuming you do your chores faithfully, it works.
title: Prepare to add another daily chore

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)

content: I heard of all the stories where the camera does not detect motion right away or lags. I further knew that the batteries would have to be swappped out. In my opinion it is still easier than running wires and drilling holes in yoir house. So far the camera has been great. It takes about 2 seconds to detect motion and start recording. The video quality is great and push notifications almost instantaneous. It picks up sound and you can have a conversation via the cameras. There is a slight lag with that feature. Battery life was my great concern. So far both batteries still show 100% charge after one week with temperatures from the low teens to twenties both during day and night. Night time video quality is also phenomenal. Set up was a breeze and the app easy to use. To top it all off, seven days of free storage for one week for up to 5 cameras. If you need it for longer, you can download the video clip. Also sd cards or usb sticks will provide additional hardwire storage No contracts and no monthly payments. So far 4 stars, 5 if the batteries really last 6 months. Whats not to love!!
title: So far so good!!!

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: JP
content: Prior to purchasing this system I purchased a Ring stick up camera with the solar panel attachment but the camera arrived DOA. I sent it back and ordered this system instead. I found the Arlo installation and setup process to be far easier than the Ring setup. I also found the phone app to be easier to use and more intuitive than the Ring app. The setup and installation were fast and easy. The camera battery arrived fully charged and linking the camera with the base station was easy. The siren on the base station is extremely loud. I like the options available on the app to turn on and off motion detection as well as the live view and other features as well. The audio works well but it seems to be only one way in that I can either hear audio from the camera or speak through the microphone but not both at the same time. I haven't had it long enough to comment on battery life but I believe where you mount it and the number of times it gets activated has a lot to do with how long the charge lasts. The app shows the remaining battery which is a nice feature. Add on cameras are less expensive than the Ring cameras and you don't have to pay for cloud storage like you do with the Ring cameras. The cameras work well at night as well and provide a clear view. I would definitely recommend this camera system.
title: Arlo pro review

content: No note from Amazon/Arlo that the power supply voltage is incompatible with Australian 240v AC (many devices accept a wide voltage range including US/AUS and just need a travel adapter for the physical prongs). Tech support (both amazon/netgear) unable to provide an Australian adapter so amazon gave a partial refund. Fixed the problem myself using an alternative Australian AC power supply from my old netgear modem. Otherwise great device with useful security features and free cloud storage. A few seconds lag between camera and phone when using live view - not sure you could have an actual conversation with someone at the door.
title: Power supply incompatible with AUS 240v

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: A. Lam
content: Mixed review about the Arlo Pro so far.  I have 3 Arlo's and 1 Arlo Q working with this Arlo Pro and here are my pros and cons so far after 2 weeks with it. Pros - Video quality is slightly better than the regular Arlos.  Not night and day difference but the improvement is there Pros - Rechargeable batteries will save me money in the long run Pros - Slightly wider angle view Pros - Motion detection seems to be better than the standard Arlo cam. Cons - Battery life does not live up to my expectations.  Set on best quality recording about 2-6 40second videos per day it only lasted about 2 weeks.  It does charge quickly.  Took about 1 hour to go from empty to full. Cons - Using the alro app this camera always gives me an error when trying to see the live view.  Granted this is the furthest camera from the base station but it seems more problematic than the old arlo camera i had in the same position.  Hopefully a firmware will make it more reliable. Update - after charging the battery to full, camera set to medium quality doing about 5 40second clips per day the battery is already at 48% after 4 days.  I seriously hope there will be stronger 3rd party batteries offered for this because removing the camera every week to charge it is a pain
title: Better than the original but needs improvements

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: SrkErd
content: Here is a review after using Arlo Pro for two weeks. First off, no need for any wires and no monthly fees. Which is the reason that makes Arlo very interesting. However being completely wireless is also the cause for all of its short comings. - First thing you should know, I didn't realize until after buying and trying it. The individual cameras are not connecting to your wi-fi, they are connecting to their own base station. That means if you are trying to cover a large property you might have to buy multiple base stations. This limited where I could place the cameras - Unlike most of the, always on, competitors Arlo only comes on and starts recording after it detects motion with the IR sensor. In my use case that meant the camera taking too long to turn on and actually missing the cause of the motion. Example for this is if I walked ( not run just walk) towards the camera and past it from 30ft away it would only catch the last split second of me passing by it, which wasn't enough to see my face (camera mounted 8-10ft high) - The IR lights does not seem to be strong enough for my use case. I am trying to monitor a large area ( I will include the pictures below) that meant missing motion at night. This can be solved by adding IR light sources that turns on at night but I didn't find the cameras own IR lights enough. I am guessing this is again a result of having to survive on a battery. But I have been using competitors plug-in cameras that are able to cover the area I am looking to cover with its built in IR LEDs - Video  : 720p and manual exposure adjustment.  720p decision is probably due to battery life concerns. The video from the camera was not clear enough for me especially when trying to cover a large area. The manual exposure setting was annoying as well since during the day as the sun changes location, I found out I had to constantly fiddle with the exposure setting. At peak sun hours part of the image would be washed out or the shadows would be too dark to see anything. - No zones of interest selection to reduce false alarms. - I moved the cameras couple of times to see if I can get a better location that would cover the areas I am looking to cover but I wasn’t able to. One location would trigger way too many false alarms ( even though I reduce the motion detection sensitivity), one location wouldn’t capture me,  directly walking in front of the camera from 20 ft away. So as I sit in front of my computer with my iPhone getting way too many notifications, I have decided to return the Arlo. I think the direction Arlo has taken is the right direction but for my case it didn’t really work. - Oh and one more thing. The web interface for Arlo from a PC requires Flash!!! I thought the industry, including Adobe themselves are moving away from flash. Why require that? Please note that the images I uploaded are from a screen capture from the Arlo app on my iPhone 7S so the quality might differ from what you will see.
title: Great camera because of the wire free design but this is also the cause of all the short comings...

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Michael Martin
content: I'm very happy to talk about the small yet amazing arlo camera and the amazing features it has.  First its compact size and lightweight is a plus for the easiest mounting I have ever seen.  A four year old could mount them it's so simple and durable.  Too, the batteries coming fully charged amazed me as into three weeks they still have over 50 percent charged power.  The sensors picking up both sound and movement are very impressive catching the movements or sound and recording it on the easy to view and access website....great is an understatement!  Amazing clarity, color, field of view and distance for the tiny camera is remarkable.  I also love how the camera switches from incredible color to sharp infrared black and white at night and unlike some Infrared cameras at other companies having strong blacks and whites the arlo system looks like normal black and white with all tones in between with grey contrasts so you can easily see people, animals and automobiles....the detail is amazing.  Truly the camera's technology is the best I've seen.  The audio is also equally impressive as you can hear detail and clear sounds from people speaking much further than your human ear could pick up.  Too I love how you can speak back and forth with each camera.  Last I'd like to touch on the durability as it is made to last.  From the easy to use mounting system, literally any age person can install and the cameras tough exterior and optical system stands up to rain, wind and dust.  The picture is the proof!  Finally, the way the system notifies you and keeps a complete history of your videos that automatically store and is so easy to see and view and playback.  It is not only great for security but also informative to see how many people come by your home you never knew did from solicitors, neighbors, delivery personnel, family, etc., who never leave a note but you can see it recorded and they have no idea.  With children coming and going the added security can't be overstated.  Thank you arlo, I can easily pass along my highest recommendation to anyone of any age as the whole operating system is easy to use, amazing technology and a superior product through and through!
title: I'm very happy to talk about the small yet amazing arlo camera ...

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: D.Staley
content: In July I purchased a 2-Pro-camera security system with the base station. Right out of the box, one of the cameras had such low volume out of its speaker, it couldn't be heard more than 2 feet away - at maximum volume. I contacted Arlo customer service and with very little hassle, obtained an RMA and returned it for repair. A few days later, I received the repaired camera back in good working order. About a month ago, the other camera stopped sensing motion. I got out my ladder and removed the camera from its mount. I tried several remedies but the only thing that worked was removing the battery from the camera and then reinserting it. The camera then started sensing motion again. I got out my ladder again and remounted the camera. A couple of weeks later it stopped sensing motion again. Instead of continuing to go through this cycle over and over, I decided to contact Arlo support again. This time the agent wanted me to perform all kinds of useless, non-related tests on the camera. When I told them this camera's problem was intermittent and these tests probably wouldn't reveal any pertinent information, they insisted I spend my time to perform them anyway. I finally got fed up and told them I just wanted an RMA so I could send the camera back for repair. However they refused to do so. Arlo evidently hires morons to handle their online customer service, since they are incapable of diagnosing a problem without wasting hours of the customer's time. I realize some customers are technically challenged but it isn't fair for Arlo to automatically throw all customers into that category and assume we are all idiots. (I was an electronic and software engineer for 30 years.) Long story short, do not buy the Arlo Pro products. They are full of defects and their customer service is horrible!
title: Full of Defects & Horrible Customer Service

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: RGS
content: I bought this system primarily for motion detection -- and it's utterly worthless. I wanted to mount these on the second story where they could not be easily reached. That is impossible. They won't register anything at all. I moved them over the tops of the doors. They do not register any motion until someone is within about two feet of the door, even at maximum sensitivity -- and even then they are inconsistent. You can increase the range to about five feet if you lower the units to about six feet high -- but that is impractical. Before we got these, we had an old wired system, but I thought these would be more versatile. Huge mistake. On the occasions that they do detect motion, there is a several-second delay between the time motion is sensed and the time recording begins to conserve battery life. Someone could grab the camera, which must be mounted rather low, and smash it before the camera kicked in. Even if you just wanted to use them to keep an eye on your kids, there is a several-second delay between what is happening and when it displays on the screen. I can't understand why these are rated so highly. As far as I'm concerned, they're worthless. I waited too long to hook these up. Now I can't return them. eBay, here I come...
title: Motion Detection Is Utterly Worthless

author: AmaBuyer
content: So far, this system and I are off to a bad start.  I had an indoor Panasonic camera, that was plugged into the wall, and could just record to either the cloud or the micro sd from there (no base station, and it was only $64).  Unfortunately it was stolen, and I had in set up to record to the microSD and not the cloud (yup, I'm an idiot).  So I bought this Arlo system, with the plan to try it out and possibly expand it to more cameras.  Well, after about two or three days after the relatively easy set up, camera 1 goes down, cannot connect to the base station.  After some back and forth I am waiting on a replacement battery, again, this system has not been used for more then a few days. As far as the system goes, other reviews are correct, their is a huge delay between when motion is detected and recording starts (my cheapo Panasonic camera was far quicker to record).  Nightvision is good (when it worked), and overall clarity is good.  App is decent, far from excellent, far from horrible. Getting ahold of someone at Netgear was a bit of a challenge, but after contacting them, the customer support guy was fairly helpful troubleshooting.  He believes it is the battery and not the camera (I'll update this when I am back up and running), I think it is the camera.  One thing that really p'd me off though, is after spending the amount of money I spent on this system, the small print on the RMA says I am responsible for shipping costs...come on!  I feel like this is something that should be handled by the company, small detail, but it really is a nickel and dime approach to squeezing their customers. We'll see how this pans out, as I am expecting the new battery any day now.
title: Netgear needs to improve it sproducts that cost this much.

author: Don McFall
content: I'm not sure Amazon reviews are the best place to research this sort of thing but for what it's worth:  We had been using a Dropcam Pro pointed out a window to keep an eye on our cars.  While we were generally happy with the Dropcam its image quality was severely impacted by the window screen.  Removing the screen was not an option since we frequently open the window for ventilation and want to keep flying bugs out,  We considered the outdoor Nest camera when it came out but getting power outdoors was not practical for us. The Arlo Pro has excellent versatility in mounting options since it is completely wire free.  Constant recording would be nice but to improve battery life Arlo Pro is limited to recording clips when motion is detected or there is other trigger activity as defined by the user.  There are several options for clip length. If you're considering this product then spend some time reading up on Netgear's community site as well.

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Lana Peterson & Erik Hoeger-Lerdal
content: I don't know about you but when I went about researching security/monitoring cameras I was overwhelmed with decisions. I thought about Nest but the cost of the membership turned me off, other cameras have free apps but sketchy companies who manage them then.... tada! Arlo Pro came into my awareness and the vast amount of features won me over. 1. We love that it is moveable. We use this camera to watch our dogs when we are gone and we put them in different areas of the house so this allows us to be flexible. 2. We love the magnetic mount. It allows the mount to be more discreet than having a big stick. 3. We love the wireless component it makes 1&2 possible. 4. The battery is rockstar, after a week our battery is still in the 90% range. 5. We never have connection issues with the app. 6. The video is super clear even when not at full capacity for battery saving. The angle is wide enough that I can see the whole room. 7. I love the two way audio although my dogs have no idea what is going on. 8. At night we set the motion detection on and it records clips for you. Or you can set up alerts so for instance if you are at work and there is motion in your house you can see what is happening. 9. It has night vision! 10. There is a siren in the app so if #8 happens you can scare the robber while you call 911. 11. The app is free and enough recording to meet my needs is free. You can also access it through your computer. 12. You can take pictures or recordings when you are not there. So for me, if me dogs are doing something cute or naughty I can take a snap or video, it then is in our library for my husband to go see, or I can download and share with anyone. 12a. When I mean my husband can go see, I am referring to how you can have multiple accounts on the Arlo app for your device. 13. You can also buy an Arlo monitor if you don't want to use a computer or phone. This might be particularly nice for parents who want to use the Arlo for baby and security. The price is a little more than some of the cameras you can get on Amazon but #yougetwhatyoupayfor.
title: We love that it is moveable

author: MKe
content: So know that the ARLO come in at least two different versions. The main visible difference between them is that one comes with four batteries and the second one comes with the little square box as a battery. The one with the little square box I believe they designate as the Pro version. So let’s talk about the Pro version 1st it has great resolution great response you can trigger it both with movement and with sound I love the ability to do both of these. The revolution on this camera is also very good. The downside to this one is that you need a special charger and a very expensive 50+ dollar backup battery or you have to take the camera down and plug it in every time it runs out of charge. And to add insult to injury the special charger is 2 to 3 months backordered. The non-Pro version its resolution is okay but compared to the Pro version it’s probably half as good in both distance and resolution. The batteries are easily replaceable charger for these batteries is fairly reasonable although if you have more than one or two of these cameras you will probably need to add some more outlet sockets to your house so that you can charge the replacement batteries for your cameras. One of the other things about the non-Pro version is that it only has a motion activation mode it cannot be activated by voice. As a plus and does seem to last longer than the Pro version on a single charge.
title: Good system easy to install.

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: alon
content: This product has to be reviewed within the context of what it is. Comparing it to a 1080p or 4k wired camera system isn't fair... if you want that sort of quality and response from your security cameras you're going to have to run wires. But, for an affordable, feature-rich, easy to setup system this is as good as any I've tried. Given that the cameras are battery powered AND wireless there are some sacrifices that need to be made so yes, the video quality isn't stellar when on a setting that conserves power and logging in with the app can sometimes take up to 20 seconds to get a live feed. But I've found that the motion detect works very well and events are captured in the library as they happened. The scheduling feature to automatically arm it at night is nice and overall the app works very well. I had two NEST dropcams that I'd used to supplement the house's security system when we were away and while the picture quality was nicer, having to plug it in limited where I could put them and the app was buggy and never worked properly. I also like how the Arlo cameras communicate to a base station that's wired into the router instead of all the cams running over the hosue WiFi. Couple that with the free cloud subscription (something else it does better than dropcam) and it's a no-brainer if you want a few cameras and don't want to cut up your walls.
title: Easy system that has a lot of features for the price.

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Kevin Sanguansukdikosol
content: VERY GOOD OUTDOOR SECURITY CAMERA! WORTH THE MONEY TO BUY! I've doing lots of research and YouTubing. I was looking for a security camera that is wireless and wire free, Arlo Pro Security Camera by NETGEAR was a perfect fit. Now, I was very close on purchasing Blink but it didn't have the features that I was looking for such as zoom, solar panel, photo/video storage and siren. Arlo Pro was an easy setup. Zooming, Blink doesn't have zooming capability but then it also depends on where you set your Arlo Pro Camera. For example, if your trying to zoom in the Arlo Pro Camera from far away, you will not have a clear picture which is a downside. Solar panel, I purchase this camera before the solar panel first came out and not knowing if it's worth on buying or not but I took the risk because I need a good working camera. I charged the camera to 100% before installing and set it up to the best setting I can where it won't eat up the battery. When the solar panel was FINALLY for sale, I purchased 2 without not knowing it will work but my Arlo Pro battery was getting towards to it needs to be recharged. Photo/video storage, Blink only offers monthly paid cloud storage where Arlo Pro offers EXTERNAL storage. Arlo Pro Base Station offers a built in USB where you an plus in like a USB/thumb drive or external hard drive to store the videos or pictures. Siren, while doing some YouTubing, it has a loud siren. The siren will sound when you set the camera onto "ARMED". When I tested out the siren for the first time, the siren was so loud!! I even tested the siren to see how loud it is when the front door is open and close. LOVE IT!!! Arlo Pro is undetectable! I ask a couple of friends and family members if they can see the camera anywhere and they said no which it's a plus. Now with all that being said, would I recommend this? Definitely a YES! I am planning on purchasing a couple more both the camera and the solar panel. NOTE: If your a Mac user, Safari browser will not allow you to do a two-way talking which I don't know why so you will need to install Google Chrome. Night vision, it's not that great but still decent (you gonna have to use some lights). If your a type of person who does not want to drill holes through walls, do the wiring and get a monitor then this is the best option for you.
title: Worth the purchase.

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Garrett G. Graham
content: The reality is that most of these current gen security/wifi/webcam systems are not really up to people's expectations. You can compare them back and forth all day and you will still be missing things you expect with every system available. I would say the two major positives going for Arlo is the built in siren and flexible camera install. In just about every other area I am dissapointed. Video quality is not good, performance is sluggish, I can't adjust how long I want to capture on motion, setup is a tad confusing, a second battery is not included, price is too high, sharing with family required too many steps on their part, ETC. I wonder if Blink just might be the better option due to it's much more competitive pricing and similar features. I think each of these systems should include free 7 days off on going cloud storage at full HD. I think you should be able to live stream fairly quickly. I think connecting to the camera should not stop a live recording. I think at this price you should get a dedicated charger and an extra battery. The bottom line is features that cost extra money when they should be included significantly diminsh the value of this product. I have used the YI camera prior to this and in some ways it is a superior product as it does not require a hub, has better image quality, lower price and never misses motion. UPDATE - I have been trying to use the GEOFENCING feature for days and the only thing it has accomplished is arming and disarming the system constantly when I am not home. Then when I get home and I have been on WiFi for 2-3 minutes the system does not know it and goes off when I walk in front of the camera. Then the app does not load fast enough to turn it off. If I have to manually arm and disarm the system constantly it pretty much takes the SMART and PRO out of this system entirely. I will likely be packing this up, sending it back and getting a more traditional security system. UPDATE 2 - The video quality is totally unacceptable. Even on the highest quality setting at 4:30 in the afternoon with a decent amount of light I can't make out faces well enough to do anything with them. Sure I can tell when it is a family member, but if I had to turn these over to police to try and identify someone I think I would be laughed out of the building.
title: It's another disappointing system in a market of disappointing so called SMART products

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Will B
content: I think Arlo could be very useful for some very narrow and specific scenarios, but as a general purpose security camera it's not very good. The flexibility of being able to put the camera just about anywhere without running wires is valuable.  And the magnetic semi-circular mount is very innovative; combined with the wide-angle lens the mount allows surprising flexibility when positioning the camera. But the drawbacks are too great for this to be a decent general purpose security camera. The battery life is really short unless you put somewhere there's rarely any motion.  I have one camera in front of my house, watching my front door.  The battery lasted a few weeks.  I changed it to 100% yesterday, and this morning, within 20 hours, it'd down to 96%. Recharging or replacing the battery is an enormous hassle.  To recharge the battery in my camera out front, I need to get the ladder, go retrieve the camera, put the ladder away (I don't want it stolen), recharge the camera a few hours, get the ladder back out, put the camera back up, muck about with repositioning it, etc.  That's a ton of work. Picture quality is really bad.  For instance, with a person 10' from the camera, I could recognize the person if I know them, but it's not enough to really identify someone (e.g. useless for police to try to catch someone).  I could mount the camera lower, so I don't need a ladder, but then someone could just walk up and take it. The motion detection isn't very good.  It detects trees moving but often won't detect a person walking by until they're halfway through the field of view. And it's expensive.  There are cheaper wired camera systems with better resolution. So with a bad picture and a battery you need to replace a lot, this is a very limited camera.  Get a wired high-resolution camera and you'll be far better off. There are some scenarios it might be a decent choice.  If you're a renter and can't install a wired system maybe this is the only choice.  Of if you plan to put it somewhere where there shouldn't be any motion (like in your house when you're gone, if you don't have pets) it's probably fine.  But as a general security camera it's not good. Also it's so over-packaged that it's tough to return it.
title: Too limited for general purpose security camera.  Maybe it's good for some narrow scenarios.

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: arizonahd
content: I have had the system now for a little over a day. As others have said, it was easy to setup and appears to be a well thought out system. A couple things I noticed, that some might be interested in knowing. 1. Buying the cameras separately ended up costing me less (want to say about $66) then getting a multi camera kit. Not only was it less, but it includes separate cables for each camera, which from my understanding, you only get one charger with the multi kits. I have no idea why they price it that way. I also like having individual boxes in case I need to send one back under warranty or return. 2. There is no way to apply separate ‘modes’ to each camera or group of cameras (at least from what I can tell). I want the ability to set my inside camera to not record/alert when I am home or between 5pm and 12am, but that is not possible unless I don’t mind ALL my cameras having that setting. It really is a misstep in my opinion, all the cameras should be able to have their own settings and schedule. In addition, it would be amazing to have the ability to set rules so that if one camera is tripped, more than one camera can be engaged to record. For example, if someone steals a parcel from your doorstep, it would be nice if it could have a camera that might see them as they walk away or get in a vehicle. Unfortunately, they crippled the software to make it more user friendly leaving out customers who want a more sophisticated configuration. 3. Instead of buying an extra battery and the accompanied charger, just buy another camera. Yes, it costs more money but it ends up being a handy way to swap out batteries during recharging along with having an extra camera. I am using mine as a inside camera that I only turn on when I am out of town (because you know, only one mode is possible). 4. The speed of loading a live camera is a bit lacking. It usually takes 10-20 seconds, sometimes it will even time out. There is also occasional delays on the feed, some as long as minutes. 5. The intercom function is neat, but they went cheap on the speaker. No one is going to be able to hear you. Why did they even bother? 6. The siren is also useless unless you happen to catch the perps in the act and manually engage it. Not to beat a dead horse, but having additional active modes would prevent this. Despite the issues, I am actually pretty happy with it and would buy again. However, I am hoping Netgear eventually upgrades it’s software to make more configurations possible. Update - 03/05/2017 Well I feel like an idiot. Yes, you can choose individual modes that are specific to each camera. What threw me off is that when selecting the active mode, you are only allowed to select one at a time. However, under the schedule, you are able to select multiple custom modes for each schedule made (doh!). For example, I made two custom modes, one for during the day and one for at night. They are almost identical except I am going set the siren for both my front door and backyard during sleeping hours (no one should be there during those times). No sirens during the day.  I am going to leave my review unedited as punishment for not doing more research beforehand. Update - 04/04/2017 Battery life on my two most active cameras is about 50% after one month of use. I noticed the motion sensitivity doesn't work as well as I was hoping. Unlike my security system, you can't really adjust the motion for the size of object (like for a dog or cat). One thing that would REALLY help is if you could set motion boundaries. This would especially help with cameras that oversee a busy street, as you could disable motion on that part of the frame. As of now, I have completely disabled all the alerts (set them to email) as I get WAY too many false positives. I also disabled the alarm at night because it went off when a moth flew by the camera haha. That was an interesting way to wake up at 3am. I noticed that on rare occasions, the cameras won't record a motion event, which is concerning.
title: Good so far!

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: commiepinkofag
content: The Arlo Pro system is fraught with technical limitations which make it a poor choice for anything beyond very basic applications.  In particular, it seems deliberately crippled in ways which to force users to pay Netgear for its arbitrarily limited, overpriced cloud storage. The controller supports external USB storage, but requires the antiquated FAT32 format and supports a maximum partition size of only 1.6 tb., with no support for multiple partitions.  (1.6 tb.  For archival video files.  From up to 15 cameras per controller.  It's hard not to be sarcastic.)  The drive must be physically detached from the controller and plugged into a computer to access it.  The controller isn't capable of connecting to a network share, rendering any existing server infrastructure you might have useless. The controller can be accessed only through Netgear's Arlo servers, meaning the entire system becomes inaccessible if its internet connection is interrupted.  (That's right - you can't connect to the system through your local network, only through the internet via Netgear's servers, rendering the whole thing grossly inappropriate for privacy-critical applications.) You're forced to use the Arlo site for everything, yet the site itself is nothing write home about.  It offers no provision whatsoever for automating file management.  Downloaded video files (typically one clip per camera per movement - _thousands_ of files) are named in Unix Epoch date format rather than human readable.  The filenames contain no reference to which camera recorded them.  The site's filtering options are limited.  The site does support IFTTT, but its implementation is limited to the point of imbecility. The obvious thing any serious user would want - a library of easily accessed files organized by camera and date-time stamped, can be achieved only through laborious manual manipulation of the Arlo website.  Given that security systems typically run 24/7 indefinitely, this is simply unacceptable. Further weirdness…  Alerts are limited to motion and sound detection, which strikes me as downright bizarre.  How many users want to receive an email every time a camera sees something move or hears a sound?  Worse, it spews one alert per event, rather than aggregating the data in any useful way.  There's no provision for alerts in response to low battery, camera failure, or any other fault condition, meaning unreliability is essentially designed into the system. The wi-fi network created by the controller is utterly opaque and doesn't play well (i.e., at all) with others.  There's no provision for integrating Arlo into an existing wi-fi network, so any substantial installation ends up duplicating equipment, wasting money, and needlessly increasing radio interference. The few things Arlo does it does fairly well, but it's limited in ways that make it a very cool toy rather than a serious security tool.  If you want something beyond watching what your dog gets up to while you're at work, you'll want to look elsewhere.
title: Very Disappointing

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Andy F
content: This is a good camera that has solid functionality and is VERY easy to setup and use.  It is completely wireless, no power cord, no video cable, nothing.  That makes it very easy to install and get running... however, there are a few down sides. 1) Battery Life: They say it will last about 3-4 weeks, my first one went dead after a week. 2) Battery powered means you have to physically access it regularly.  Since you have to take the camera down and either replace the battery with a charged one (or recharge the one in the camera ) you won't want to place this too far out of reach. 3) Security of the camera(s) - unless you get the security mount, the only way the camera is mounted is via a magnet.  If someone reaches up and grabs the camera, it just comes off in their hand.  I have not lost a camera yet but I am concerned.  This combined with having to regularly access the camera means that you either risk it being stolen or you have to climb a ladder once a month. 4) You MUST have internet access to use the camera and video server.  Even with the mobile app you access the video via the internet.  Thus, the cameras are no good for security in a out of the way location (Think farm, vacation home, etc) that doesn't have internet access. 5) 4-6 second delay on "Live" video feed- If you watch the live feed, you are 4-6 seconds behind the real world.  Not a huge deal but if you are trying to talk to someone via the camera it causes a problem. 6) The camera appears to link to it's own video server wirelessly, not to your wifi network.  This limits the locations you can place cameras to within wireless range of your video server and you cannot use wifi extenders. That said, I really like the camera set and will continue to use it. Oh, and the Arlo website says that you can use it plugged into power as well as completely wireless.  That works well if you have a convenient power plug nearby. Arlo Pro Security System with Siren - 2 Rechargeable Wire-Free HD Cameras with Audio, Indoor/Outdoor, Night Vision  (VMS4230)
title: Good camera with a few drawbacks.

author: Shannon L. Plesh
content: I have the regular Arlo system and an Arlo Pro system installed at my house. Both systems are extremely easy to install and setup. You can have either of these systems up and running in under an hour which was perfect for me because I needed to have something installed before leaving my home before a night out. The Pro cameras have 2 way audio, rechargeable batteries, and both the base station and cameras have alarms. I bought the non-pro version first because that was all that was available at my local store, however after trying out the Pro version, I'd recommend them over the regular cameras. By the time you invest in rechargeable batteries and a charger you're almost spending as much as the Pro version anyway and your getting a lot more features. Additionally, the batteries on the Pro cameras seem to last longer. My only complaint is that the cameras are way to easy to knock down and steal with the provided mounts. There should be a way to lock them in place so that thiefs don't run away with your camera's. Both systems work with the same app so you can run multiple systems simultaneously if you want. The motion detection works pretty well but. If you set it too sensitive, then you'll get a lot of false alarms. my work around was to install two cameras at different angles covering the same area plus an additional camera at the front door. If one camera detects motion, then it's most likely a false alarm but when 2 or more cameras start going off at the same time, I know that someone is actually nearby. I'm very pleased with this purchase. I'd definitely recommend these cameras to anyone looking for a quick and easy security system.
title: Arlo Pro is worth the extra money

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: Jk
content: I'm probably sure most people who bought arlo is because of battery, the easiest installation there probably is on camera but that all comes with negative things. Got my placed in really busy area, so all the notifications has to be turned off o I I'll get around 100-200 notifications per day. Camera has been 7 days installed with full battery and already there is only 65% of the battery left. It won't go even a month. So that's out of question who would like to charge the camera every month, not me, if it had an option to run a charger cable to keep it running from outlet like nest, then this camera would be a 5 star. Picture quality is ok, not great but if you place it in right place it will work. Got mine 15 feet high and 20 feet away from my car, even with a close up I can't read the plates. Another issue is, 2 way talk from iOS didn't work not even once. But there is something really good about this camera is the microphone can take everything even when my neighbors talk outside. So after all these issues I need to return it, don't have time to babysit a camera. Update. One full month and battery is gone, motion sensor is very poor, needs big movements or it will send 20 notifications make 20 videos of couple seconds just from standing and smoking outside under camera. This is very annoying and had to disable it and just let it record. This needs more maintenance then anything else in my house, charge it every month is a joke. This camera would be ok with option to connect cable and let it record nonstop.
title: Sometimes it's better to  go extra mile.

content: I purchased this mid January 2017 and installed late January 2017.  It was easy to set up and easy to use.  I am so glad Netgear came out with this re-chargeable version as I wasn't too thrilled with having to constantly replace batteries.  One camera is on the front porch and the other is in the carport.  Both are in covered locations so other than cold or heat, they are protected from direct exposure to wind, rain, snow, ice, sun etc. To give an idea of the battery drain, by end of February, the carport cam was down to 55%, while the porch cam was down to 95%.  I thought the carport cam would hit 50% by beginning of March, but the drain actually slowed down - I think because the temp started to warm up a bit.  Jan and Feb saw temps of low 30's to mid 40's.  March temps were high 30's to low 50's.  By mid March, the battery finally hit 50%.  The carport cam records 10 second clips 3 to 5 times in the morning and 3 to 5 times late afternoon everyday.  This is with us coming and going each day.  The porch cam rarely gets triggered - usually when a package is delivered, or when I step out to grab the newspaper.  I charged it up the other day and it went from 45% to 100% in just over an hour.  At this moment, the porch cam is at 85%. Pros: Easy to set up.  Easy to use. Notifications to my cellphone usually comes within 2 seconds (sometime not - see cons), cameras are completely wireless, two way communication - sort of.  Many mounting possibilities. Re-chargeable. Cons: Expensive system, expensive add-ons. Notifications sometimes arrive a few minutes later - not sure if this is Arlo related, WIFI/Internet, or cellphone related. With the two way communication - unless I'm doing  something wrong - you have to go into the app, turn on the mic and talk, but you have to turn off the mic to hear a response, then turn it on again to talk again.  There should be a simple, quick toggle or button like a walkie talkie.  Speakers could be a little louder.  Once again - Expensive. I need a third camera, but will wait to see if any deals during the next Black Friday/Cyber Monday. **Update - May 27, 2017** 1) I don't think temperature has an effect on battery drain. Since recharging it for the first time in March, one month later in April, the charge was down to 50%.  I recharged again, but this time after four hours, it was only 75%. I unplugged it and plugged it again, then after another two hours, it was 95%.  Another hour later, 98%.  After some research, it seemed this was common as the battery is only supposed to charge to 85% capacity???? However, the first time I recharged in March, it was 100%. 2) After the 2nd recharge in April, It has drained down to 50% again here in late May.  This time recharge took just under 2 hours, and the unit is showing 100% charge. 3) The porch cam finally came down to 50% about mid May since it's original install in January.  It still only gets triggered a few times a week. I will be recharging it today. 4) There was a Arlo systems upgrade a few weeks ago.  Since then, the notifications on my Samsung S7 do not always open like they did prior to the upgrade.  My phone sometimes freezes when the Arlo app is trying to open. Also, it seems to take a lot longer to open the live view on the app.  Due to these issues, I have knocked a star off.
title: This was a good purchase... (see update)

product: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 5 camera kit (VMS4530)
author: A. Wing
content: All the parts are there for a great product, and then Netgear got greedy.  The want to force you to pay every month for unnecessary cloud storage, so they prevented reliable recording to local storage.  You can set it up to hopefully record only the motion-activated recordings locally (when it doesn’t silently fail).  But the manual recordings – you know, the ones you actually want to retain – those are deliberately not recorded locally.  They instead go to the cloud where they require manual intervention to download, one at a time, or else they get automatically deleted in 7 days (or earlier if you use up the paltry amount of storage provided sooner.  It’s just too much unnecessary work. Also, the camera won’t record from the beginning of motion being sensed until after the end of motion being sensed.  Instead, it records for a fixed period of time, starting a few seconds after motion is sensed.  Thus, you lose very important parts of the action.  This is a cop-out for their motion-sensing not being good enough to make the former scenario work reliably. I could live with the motion-sensing being sub-par, as that is an actual technical challenge that costs money to fix.  But forcing me to use the cloud to store my video, even if it were free, is not acceptable.  Frankly, placing videos on the cloud is the opposite of security, for a number of reasons. I’m returning mine.
title: Netgear crippled it.
